story:
A powerful Smartwatch with an upgradable MicroSD

....and retro Gaming Design....

We're building the greatest Smartwatch, ever....not crammed with every sensor available, just engineered around what we believe is really important: A kick-ass processor, a stunning display, outstanding connectivity, a big battery and a great OS. 

We also added a MicroSD port to give access to massive amounts of data, right on your wrist; and finally, because there's more to life than just raw power ;) we brought it to life with retro gaming design and content. 

 

The result? Gameband. One of the fastest, most powerful, thinnest, stunning Smartwatches money can buy. Oh, and we also made it one of the most affordable. 

In a world where most big-brand wearables from are 'cookie-cutter', Gameband gives you the opportunity to be part of something different. 

 

 

We've built Gameband and its design around the Qualcomm Snapdragon Wear 2100 processor, arguably one of the fastest and most capable wearable processors in the market today.

Rather than over stack Gameband with every conceivable component available to us, we focused on picking the core components essential to what we want Gameband to be: an amazing Smartwatch for people who love to game. 

That approach has several other benefits from a technical point of view: 

  • Less components = more space = larger battery & MicroSD slot
  • Less components = more affordable product
  • Less components = less manufacturing & quality risk
  • Less components = more budget for better processor & display

Another benefit of the Snapdragon processor is that it has already been designed for MicroSD support, which will further de-risk our development efforts.

Other key hardware areas for us are the inclusion of a square, 1:1 AMOLED 1.63" display, WiFi 802.11 and Bluetooth 4.2 (way better for audio).

For those worried about getting your Gameband wet, have no fear: Gameband will be be IPX7 compliant! 

Learn more about Qualcomm and Gameband by viewing the full interview with Jim Merrick, Director of Marketing, Qualcomm. 

The upgradable MicroSD capability turns Gameband into a high-speed portable drive, hosting your PC Games, photos, music, files and more. 

Our software & unique IC switch mean that when plugged into a computer the MicroSD runs our PixelFurnace game management and launch platform at USB3.0 speeds, and when connected via Bluetooth data can be accessed via mobile or audio devices.

 

PixelFurnance is basically like an iTunes for Games, that you can take with you and plug in anywhere. 

 

We're running Android Nougat 7.0

Gameband is compatible with iOS and Android, and will have access to iOS and Android Phone based Companion Apps to help manage your Gameband. 

Apps shipping with Gameband include:

 

Technically there are four key areas that make Gameband work:

  • Hardware (processor and connectivity)
  • Software: (Android Operating System & companion Apps)
  • MicroSD solution (accessible by PC)
  • PixelFurnace (game launch software)

Our team has already shipped a product, to over 20 countries and 35 retailers, that required experience in all of the above areas.

With Qualcomm support we have been introduced and are working with a leading ODM with over a decade of experience in Android development and deployment, with multiple products already in market. Together we are making sure every feature we want to integrate in Gameband will be delivered as promised.

The core functionalities we have been testing and prototyping are as follows:

  • Basic Android Operation
  • General productivity app use
  • Companion App capability
  • Bluetooth Audio
  • Voice control (Alexa)
  • Mini-game operation
  • PixelFurnace launch via MicroSD
  • Backup and other backend services

 

Gameband was designed in San Francisco by MATTER; a design studio with a portfolio that includes Samsung, Google, Sonos, and Logitech. Their Chief designer, Max Burton, has been involved in almost 100 wearable projects, from Smartwatches to luxury watches.

 

We had specific requirements for our design. It needed to be robust, as durable as a watch, while incorporating gaming influences and giving us the flexibility to create special editions, without overly complicating the manufacturing process. Drawing inspiration from rugged weaponry, vehicles and tools seen in games, the goal was to bring about a real-world device that you could just as easily imagine inside a game.

The result was a two-piece frame, held in place with 4 bolt screws, delivering both a design objective, and a functionality objective all in one.

Learn more about our design process by viewing full interviews with the team here: 

Interview with Max Burton, Founder and Chief Designer, MATTER 

Interview with Toby Stopper, Industrial Designer, MATTER 

 

Special editions and mini-games: we've partnered for launch with two iconic brands to bring top name brands to your wrist. 

Atari, who brought gaming into the living room, are working with us to bring it to your wrist. Rewriting classic titles like Pong, Centipede and more for our 1:1 1.63" display, with flush glass format for easy swiping, Gameband Atari Edition comes in Atari Red, with a variety of straps that let you show your love for this timeless gaming legend. 

Terraria, one of the most amazing indie game titles on the planet, is another launch partner we are fortunate to have onboard. Incorporating some of the well known images and design elements of the game, we are also working with Terraria on an exclusive mini-game version that will incorporate both the technology and the context of Gameband: i.e. a product you will take into the real-world and your daily life. 

It's about movement, gestures, voice, steps, location and lots more.  We believe that by building the right product, with the right technology and OS, partnered with great gaming studios.....you are going to see some amazing gaming experiences come to Gameband, and we can't wait to share them with you. 

 

 

 

 

There are four Gameband Editions available: Gameband Edition itself, Atari and Terraria Editions and Droid Edition. The differences between the various editions are colors, straps, packaging, and watchfaces. Here's the overview!

 

Gameband Droid Edition 
The Gameband Droid Edition is a high-end Gameband offering that includes: Brushed aluminium finish, black leather strap and Gorilla Glass. 

 

1. Click on the images below to share Gameband on Facebook or Twitter. 

 

2. Tag 5 friends in your post/tweet

3. Fill out this Google Doc form with your info and we'll include this FREE gift with your Gameband order (limit 1 gift per person) Thanks!

Disclaimers and other stuff you should know

Shipping: We've done our best to be accurate on shipping fees, however please be aware that you may be on the hook personally for customers fees and import taxes.

International orders: We will be shipping to most countries in the world barring the following countries due to logistical issues: Argentina, Belarus, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, Libya, Myanmar/Burma, North Korea, Somalia, Sudan, Syria and Yemen.

Straps: There is almost no substance in nature or created by man that will not cause an allergic reaction to somebody, somewhere. Our straps are all made from basic and common materials (silicon, leather, canvas nylon) however it is up to you to ensure Gameband is safe to wear. If you have sensitive skin than contact your doctor before wearing!

Battery life: People use devices like Gameband in so many different ways that it is almost impossible to say that the battery will last 'x' days. If all you do is play mini-games and while doing so you also keep wifi/bluetooth on, then don't expect to get through the day. If all you do is use basic apps but then plug in and use the MicroSD (which automatically charges Gameband while in use) then you'll get a few days of use.  What we can say is that the 400mAh battery we've included is the upper end of what you normally see in Smartwatches, and together with Qualcomm and our ODM we will continually look for ways to extend battery life.

Water resistance: For those worried about getting your Gameband wet, have no fear, Gameband will be be IPX7 compliant. This means it is suitable for: Splashes Rain or Snow Showering Incidental exposure to water of up to 1 meter for up to 30 minutes

HRM and GPS: In case you missed it in the specs: we do not have a heart rate monitor or GPS built in. This is so we had more room, and more money, for the things we did put in.  We are looking at partners who can help us build optional straps that do these things, for customers who really want this functionality.

Trademarks and IP: We've tried to respect everything we need to legally herein, both in terms of technology and marketing materials. If we missed anything it was not deliberate, please drop us a line and let us know. For clarity: this Gameband is not affiliated to Mojang SA in anyway (the makers of Minecraft), although our team has worked with them on a wearable band in the past. If you have a Minecraft license then it should work on the new and improved PixelFurnace that will ship with this Gameband. We'll test and post an update on that in the future.

Production: We are working with one of the worlds leading wearable manufacturers, with years of experience, and a design process that focused from day one on an objective of creating a product that can be produced on time and to scale.
story_txt:
A powerful Smartwatch with an upgradable MicroSD....and retro Gaming Design....We're building the greatest Smartwatch, ever....not crammed with every sensor available, just engineered around what we believe is really important: A kick-ass processor, a stunning display, outstanding connectivity, a big battery and a great OS. We also added a MicroSD port to give access to massive amounts of data, right on your wrist; and finally, because there's more to life than just raw power ;) we brought it to life with retro gaming design and content.  The result? Gameband. One of the fastest, most powerful, thinnest, stunning Smartwatches money can buy. Oh, and we also made it one of the most affordable. In a world where most big-brand wearables from are 'cookie-cutter', Gameband gives you the opportunity to be part of something different.  Smartwatch comparison chart (internal) We've built Gameband and its design around the Qualcomm Snapdragon Wear 2100 processor, arguably one of the fastest and most capable wearable processors in the market today.Rather than over stack Gameband with every conceivable component available to us, we focused on picking the core components essential to what we want Gameband to be: an amazing Smartwatch for people who love to game. That approach has several other benefits from a technical point of view: 
Less components = more space = larger battery & MicroSD slot
Less components = more affordable product
Less components = less manufacturing & quality risk
Less components = more budget for better processor & display
Another benefit of the Snapdragon processor is that it has already been designed for MicroSD support, which will further de-risk our development efforts.Other key hardware areas for us are the inclusion of a square, 1:1 AMOLED 1.63" display, WiFi 802.11 and Bluetooth 4.2 (way better for audio).For those worried about getting your Gameband wet, have no fear: Gameband will be be IPX7 compliant! Learn more about Qualcomm and Gameband by viewing the full interview with Jim Merrick, Director of Marketing, Qualcomm. The upgradable MicroSD capability turns Gameband into a high-speed portable drive, hosting your PC Games, photos, music, files and more. Our software & unique IC switch mean that when plugged into a computer the MicroSD runs our PixelFurnace game management and launch platform at USB3.0 speeds, and when connected via Bluetooth data can be accessed via mobile or audio devices.Plug and Play from your MicroSD using PixelFurnance PixelFurnance is basically like an iTunes for Games, that you can take with you and plug in anywhere. PixelFurnace, Gameband's proprietary management and launch platform We're running Android Nougat 7.0Gameband is compatible with iOS and Android, and will have access to iOS and Android Phone based Companion Apps to help manage your Gameband. Apps shipping with Gameband include: Technically there are four key areas that make Gameband work:
Hardware (processor and connectivity)
Software: (Android Operating System & companion Apps)
MicroSD solution (accessible by PC)
PixelFurnace (game launch software)
Our team has already shipped a product, to over 20 countries and 35 retailers, that required experience in all of the above areas.With Qualcomm support we have been introduced and are working with a leading ODM with over a decade of experience in Android development and deployment, with multiple products already in market. Together we are making sure every feature we want to integrate in Gameband will be delivered as promised.The core functionalities we have been testing and prototyping are as follows:
Basic Android Operation
General productivity app use
Companion App capability
Bluetooth Audio
Voice control (Alexa)
Mini-game operation
PixelFurnace launch via MicroSD

story:
NOTE: How To Stand Out in a Suit is now available exclusivly on Amazon , get your copy here.

Standing out from the crowd, it gives you confidence and opens doors to meeting new people, each that comes with its own new opportunities. Standing out from the crowd essentially is an important factor in success, so the question is what is the best way to do it?

There is one simple way to stand out from the crowd; it is through the way you dress. Dress the best and get noticed, it’s as simple as that. For guys the most dressed up you can get is to wear a suit, so here’s how to make it work.

Written by GOWDA FASHION CEO Arjun Gowda, ‘How to Stand Out in a Suit’ (a.k.a. #thesuitbook) is an easy to follow how-to guide to take away the confusion for guys when it comes to putting together a suit in the way that works best for you.

The Suit Book is for all who cannot put a suit together themselves, and just as much for those whom already dress well but want to go that extra mile.

The Suit Book ver. II is a current update on the 2014 original, in which we address the most recent styles.

For the past seven years Arjun has been working in fashion and styling; starting out as a designer in the Lakshmi-Bee Fashion House: Menswear Division Arjun learnt all the ins and outs of designing and putting together the stand out suit.  

Recently becoming the CEO of GOWDA FASHION, Arjun decided to compile all he has learnt so far into an easy to follow how-to guide for guys, helping them to put together a suit in the way that works best for them.

 

 

NOTE: If you're after a wrinkle free, sweat free dress shirt that requires no buttoning you can pick up a Slip Shirt (as seen in the book) from our other campaign here: igg.me/at/gowdafashion

story:
FOR ALL THINGS PARTY:

Have you ever had the joys of shopping for a formal dress only to find out that it isn’t as much fun as you originally thought it would be? What often begins as an exciting adventure of satin, sequin and all-things-Femme, quickly becomes a mission of waning patience, inflating budgets and last minute compromises.

DOUBLE YOU FASHIONS has recognized a demand for custom-made items. We’ve exclusively focused on Made-to-Measure garments for almost a decade. We LOVE our face-to-face consultations and work very hard to ensure a big smile at the end of each contract.People everywhere want something made especially for them.

Unfortunately we find there just aren’t enough hours in the day to meet with everyone.

And so we pitch this Project:
PaperDollPartyDress.com: A virtual space where women can design any dress for any occasion.

But first, let’s clear the air…

THIS IS NOT E-COMMERCE:
Double You Fashions is not proposing to build an average consumer website, where customers buy whatever happens to be on sale. Nor are we looking for on-going support for server fees or domain names etc.

PaperDollPartyDress.com will be, to put it simply, an easy-to-use Design Tool for anyone looking for a party dress. We don’t conduct business based on the traditional Wholesale/Retail model. We don’t order bulk items from vendors located overseas. We don’t stock up on inventory and hope that our product sells. We don’t carry other labels and brands. And there is no complicated Supply Chain.

Instead PaperDollPartyDress.com will act as a direct link between Fashion House and Fashionista. Once this platform is built, the Indiegogo Campaign is complete and will begin to function as a self-operating machine. We plan to do this by building a dress library and holding production until a style is ordered.

We make money when we sell a dress. We save money when we don’t.

ALWAYS FIND YOUR PERFECT FIT:
We don't deal in retail sizes. Instead, upon ordering you will be asked to fill out a set of measurements. This information is stored on file and relayed directly to the Patternmaker. Once your dress is sewn up, we re-measure the Bust, Waist & Hip (ensuring all is correct), send an email notification and ship.

No more disappointments, we have your size! 


INTERACTIVE & FAIR PRICING:
No one likes a big surprise when they get to the checkout. This is why we would include immediate and interactive pricing. This is a unique feature which could be useful for everyone, especially for Bridal Parties.

Often times, friends and family members are invited to be part of the Big Day. Many of the main details (colour, length, material) are chosen by the Bride, which makes complete sense. What doesn't make sense is the huge bill that comes with the darn thing!

With our Interactive Pricing, the dollar amount corresponds directly to each design element.

Tiny adjustments for big savings!

ACCESSIBLE:
We understand that not everyone lives in the big city. Small town girls have the same special events to attend to, but often nowhere to shop. The beauty of PaperDollPartyDress.com is any user can build any dress she wants from anywhere that can connect to the internet. So even if she dislikes shopping malls, PaperDollPartyDress.com will still have you looking fabulous.

REDUCE REUSE RECYCLE:
Occasionally, Double You Fashions receives requests to take apart a dress and remake it into something else. This is either because the original dress doesn't fit or simply because our clients no longer need the style for what it was originally intended for. Either way, we believe beautiful things should never be hidden away in a closet.

Because dresses from PaperDollPartyDress.com will be made local to our Design Team, we will be able to provide the unique ability to take back your purchase and re-sew it into a new garment for your next big event.


FOR ALL OCCASIONS:
Life offers many fun reasons to get dolled up and show off your girly side:
*Bridal
*Sweet 16’s
*Bat Mitzvahs
*Prom and Graduation!

PaperDollPartyDress.com will be the only place you will need to remember for One-Of-A-Kind Dresses.

No more schlepping from store to store, no more disappointing fit issues and no more giant price tags for a dress you’ll only wear once. With your help, we can build this tool and

STOP THE DRESS STRESS!

 


Risks and challenges


Over the decade, Double You Fashions has become synonymous with elegant gowns, speedy turn-around and affordable prices. Customers never worry about fit issues or struggle to find styles that meet their budget. With our extensive knowledge of Pattern Making and Sourcing, every customer leaves with a dress made perfectly for her body, and at a price she’s comfortable with.

We often beat what’s available at retail level.

With that said, our biggest challenge will be ensuring PaperDollPartyDress.com can truly replace our Designer-to-Client interactions, especially in regards to Customer Service. Oftentimes, customers may have a certain vision in their head but have no idea how to actually create it in reality. Although the ultimate decision is that of our clients, they still rely on our Designer to help suggest appropriate silhouettes and fabrics.

This could be solved in several ways. One of which includes using a Design Assist Feature, similar to that of Microsoft’s Clippy. Another solution includes the use of more “life-like” Avatars; ones with real hips, bellies and busts. We would ensure our sketches are drawn in a very life-like manner, allowing garments to drape and flow on screen, the way they would in real life.

In addition to that, we will also need to ensure our Interactive Pricing works correctly. Calculations need to be fair and on par with what we would offer during a regular face-to-face consultation.

To prepare for this this, we will test the site multiple times and test it again. We will perform numerous Trial Runs before going live. We’ve even offered this as a reward as we believe so strongly in creating a quality product which people will enjoy again and again.

Lastly, we will have to anticipate a certain level of education. We can't expect our visitors to know how to take proper measurements, or know what materials are most flattering.

This is easily solvable with short instructional videos, interactive graphics or the inclusion of a FAQs section. If PaperDollPartyDress.com is going to be completely "Self-Serve" then it must be clear to understand and accurate, 100% of the time.

story:
What is 42aFurnace?

    4  2  a  Furnace is an engine that generates funds for Christian missions (30% of profits go to the Christian missions) while at the same time spreading Gods word and glorifying him through clothing. The name is in reference to Shadrach, Meshach, Abednego and the Angel in Daniel 3.

    The Christian missions we support are Night Shift street ministries and Love Global. Hopefully when we are more developed we will be able to cycle in other charities as well.

    Your contribution either directly, or through sharing this with your friends and praying for us is such a blessing. And gets us one step closer to being able to save souls and point peoples’ lives towards Jesus through the clothing we wear.

 

 

Crusader front  (Joshua invading the promised land)

 Crusader back  (Joshua conquering the promised land)

 

Samson front   (about Samsons life)

Samson Back   (about Samsons life)

 

What We Need & How you can help

 

    We need a minimum of $18000 dollars and are hoping for $24000 so we can make an order in bulk and get the printing prices to a manageable level to sell in retail stores.

    This is my purpose from God, it has taken a huge amount of time and effort over the past 2 years, but I truly believe that all of us together can make this happen.

    Why not a flexible campaign? We're dedicated to glorifying God and giving our best as an offering to Him. For all-over t-shirt printing this means screen printing, and you can't get shirts printed by this method in ones and twos. it only starts to be possible to get these shirts into retail stores at 900 or 1200 shirts per a design. so if on Indiegogo we only sold 100 shirts we wouldn’t be able to fulfill the order. That’s why we have a fixed campaign.

    What happens if you go over the $18000? We'll be able to start printing! This is the absolute minimum, we are hoping for $24000, and if we get an overwhelming outpour of support we'd love to offer some more of the designs we've got cooking and can't wait to get out there.

 

Questions

 

    When will I receive my shirt? In Canada and the continental U.S.A. they will arrive before Christmas (maybe not Alaska) everywhere else we will try our best to get them to you asap but the international shipping may not get to you in time. Hopefully it will, but we can't guarantee it, :) perhaps stuff a stocking with a coupon saying "1 cool shirt coming".

    What of and where from is my shirt made? These are high quality 100% cotton shirts. the cotton is grown and woven in the U.S.A., sewn together in Haiti under good working conditions approved by the International Labour Organization, the Better Work Program and the International Finance Corporation. The T-shirts are then high quality all-over printed in the U.S.A. 

    How do I select my size? Take one of your T-shirts that fit you well and measure from armpit to armpit and that is your 'chest size'. The shirts are 'slim fit' T-shirts. *Note sizes XL and above have more room around the stomach.

Size                        Chest                          Body length

X Small    -      17 inches                  25 inches

Small       -      18 inches                  27 inches

Medium    -      20 inches                  28  inches

Large       -      22 inches                  29 inches

X Large    -      24 inches                  30 inches

2X Large  -      26 inches                  31.5 inches

3X Large  -      28 inches                  33  inches

 

 

Sharing would be a huge blessing

- Click the 'like' and 'tweet' buttons below the video and share it on Facebook, Twitter and everywhere else.

- Copy the link below the video and e-mail it to your friends, or send them to www.indiegogo.com/42aFurnace

- Tell your friends and tell your Church or Youth Group, ask them to share it as well :)

- Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools below the video.

- Say hello and "like" our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/42aFurnace 

 

Thank you for your support and helping us achieve this, gain converts and glorify God. God Bless. - Robert Bailey
story_txt:
What is 42aFurnace?
    4  2  a  Furnace is an engine that generates funds for Christian missions (30% of profits go to the Christian missions) while at the same time spreading Gods word and glorifying him through clothing. The name is in reference to Shadrach, Meshach, Abednego and the Angel in Daniel 3.
    The Christian missions we support are Night Shift street ministries and Love Global. Hopefully when we are more developed we will be able to cycle in other charities as well.
    Your contribution either directly, or through sharing this with your friends and praying for us is such a blessing. And gets us one step closer to being able to save souls and point peoples’ lives towards Jesus through the clothing we wear.
 
 
Crusader front  (Joshua invading the promised land)

 Crusader back  (Joshua conquering the promised land)
 

Samson front   (about Samsons life)

Samson Back   (about Samsons life)

 
What We Need & How you can help

story:
INOCHI is born with a mission to reconnect the world. With INOCHI, no more compromission of facial expression and lips movement in every words you speak and every breath you take.  

 

Our filter media has been tested in compliance with ASTM F2100-19 and EN 14683:2019, Annex B. The filter media received a Filtration Efficiency greater than 99.67%.  Our filter material has also been tested against a particle size of 0.1μm and received an over filtration efficiency of 98%.

We believe that communication is more than words. The face expression, especially the smile, incorporates your innate positive energy and differentiates oneself. Thus, it has its right to be shown and seen. Nevertheless, conventional masks, while blocking the pollutants, compromise the expression of personal identity as well as communication.

The transparent design of INOCHI not only activates all the means of interpersonal communication but also facilitates lip-readers around the world. 

INOCHI is polished with a permanent Anti-Fog coating inside the mask. The layer keeps the mask clean and clear regardless of airflows while breathing.

The mask frame is made from soft and pliable silicone. The material secures 100% fit to facial contours of every face shape. 

INOCHI is designed with style that makes it both functional and practical. Traditional square-block protective mask is entirely replaced with aesthetic and seamless design of water-drop shape; thus, you can wear the mask with pride. 

Designed by a group of minimalist, INOCHI works as a compact facegear for activities, indoors and outdoors alike:

(i) Lightweight and elastic;

(ii) A built-in space for mini-sanitizer, refillable by users;

(iii) Replaceable protective filtration;

(iv) Super soft contours and adjustable loops for daylong comfort.

 

 
 

 We aim to make INOCHI adaptable to multiple contexts and settings. 

In international places: airports, hotels, shopping centres, scenic and tourist spots

In mass transportation: buses, cars, taxis, trams, ferries and boats, subways

In social places: restaurants, coffee shops, appointments and gatherings

In daily activities: in supermarkets and  groceries, in retail stores

In working: on the streets, at schools, in the offices, meetings and business events

In activities: outdoor sports, team sports,  gym and physical training classes

In moments of companionship: datings, meetings, gatherings

INOCHI is built to last. Existing face masks - whether by disposable or cloth material, are intended for short duration if not single use. On the contrary, INOCHI - being reusable, easy to clean with replaceable filter, originally aims at long-term use. There is no point protecting ourselves today while harming the environment in future. 

Let us spend smarter! 

Below comparison tabulates the budget estimation for conventional protective mask versus INOCHI. The assumption made is 02 items per day for surgical masks and 6 items per month for washable ones, inclusive of 10 washes.

By partnering with Abody.ai, a tech expert in providing solutions for body metrics data via artificial intelligence, we achieve better accuracy and convenience in face measurement to produce fit-to-face masks. 

Abody.ai app is ready on Apple Store for downloading. Face metrics shall be obtained via ONE self-portrait of your face via this app. Alternatively, conventional method with measurement tape remains intact. 

 

Testing

story:
Hi everybody Please forgive my video, it was very hot in my studio aka storage room and I probably left out a lot of details so here it goes. I'm a filipino born and raised in Los Angeles and since will always and forever call LA home.

I didn't really have any direction most of my life, so I did what I could to survive in this crazy city we call LA. I took care of a lot of people probably more so than myself until I stumbled upon this fashion harness idea by accedent actually on Halloween one year. Who knew!

This fashion show is a such a great sense of accomplishment for myself and it gives me a sense of worth and value and that I can do things that makes a difference in peoples lives cause fashion makes people happy and to contribute to other peoples happiness, I'm all for it!

I've been doing a lot of research when I finally decided what I wanted to do in my life and I didn't want to do what most people have already done. And in fashion, yes one day your in and one day your out. But with accessories, they are forever!

OK so here are the details on which where the $5,000 is going and I will list them to make it easier to read. Here we go!

-The actual collection

-hair and make-up team and their kit fees

-entertainment performers

-seating rental

-craft service (food & drink) for models and artists cause it's gonna take all day folks

-gifts for donations

-Signs

-dress form

-rolling racks

With the limited edition keychains and bracelets, each one is different and unique. I embrace uniqueness and individuality and I like to apply that to everything I make. So if you get something that's made by my hands, chances are I probably won't make it again.

The more everybody pitches in and help fund the KKg fashion show, the more epic the show will be.  But if I do not reach my goal it's not the end of the world and I will still try to make it a good show for you to see.

Don't forget to check in and see how with the help of my family, friends, and fans, WEHO is going to be in for an amazing show

Also don't forget to follow me at www.kennykennygear.com with my social media at the bottom of my page to my facebook, twitter, blog, etc. and please share this info with everybody. Thank you for makingthis happen

story:
100K IS OUR FINAL STRETCH GOAL... LET'S DO THIS!

 

A lifelong PASSION for film inspires us to create yet another film… our 4th! Our director Jivan Avetis yan who grew up in Artsakh has always been captivated by the world of cinema. Jivan’s fascination with film began when he was a little boy growing up in Khachmach, a village on the outskirts of Stepanakert. In fact, Jivan’s lifelong DREAM of creating a film in Khachmach was realized in 2015 with the production of our second feature film The Last Inhabitant, now streaming on Prime.

Jivan’s deep-rooted passion for filmmaking is what brings us here to our crowdfunding campaign TODAY! There is so much to be told! We need to REWRITE stories and share it with a mainstream audience. Artsakh will serve as the backdrop of the storyline of our new feature film project, Revival, a film that is thought-provoking, mind-twisting, with several unexpected turns of events. Ohhhh and you will get to meet ORCHID20… Murat’s creation!

Revival, two and a half years in the making, will be on your WATCHLIST in 2024… YES, filmmaking is a process!

Link in bio on Jivan Avetisyan’s Instagram page to check out info on his award-winning films! 

Armenian international award-winning film director Jivan Avetisyan from Artsakh spent 38 horrifying days in Stepanakert this past October documenting the war crimes committed against the Armenian population. He will be integrating his findings in our film project.

Jivan is no stranger to the international cinematic world as his three previous feature films, Tevanik (also streaming on Amazon Prime), The Last Inhabitant, and Gate to Heaven have their own individual global success stories. Jivan also rocked the Berlinale Talents 2020, a talent program within the framework of the Berlin International Film Festival. He was selected amongst 3,400 applicants to attend with our new film project Revival, Berlinale Talents 2020. Jivan, as a Berlinale Talent 2020, was also selected by the reputable German international broadcast Deutsche Welle to be the subject of a documentary.

What else? Our film project Revival received the following shout out from Roy W. Dean - Summer 2020 Grant, From the Heart Productions: “Thanks for sending us your brilliant film to review.  We have sincerely enjoyed reading your work. The film has been selected in the category of "Hot Films in the Making". We like the film and know it has excellent potential.  We will host your film on our website for a year to help you promote it and to help you raise funds.”

Here is the latest from Cineuropa! Jivan Avetisyan's Interview and Gate to Heaven Film Review after Moscow International Film Festival “Pulls Nagorno-Karabakh Drama Over Violence Worries”: Moscow Times.

LET’S DO THIS! Thank you for your ongoing support. We are CONFIDENT that we are on the right track with our film project!

One woman’s secret forces three destinies to intertwine when a young robotics student living in France is determined to root out the truth of his father’s wartime death in Armenia / Artsakh… his girlfriend, a young Frenchwoman sets out to reunite with her estranged volcanologist father in Iceland to trace her indigenous Canadian roots… his esteemed French professor, a descendent of a Holocaust survivor, reclaims his abandoned Jewish roots in Israel in search of the meaning of life.

Along the way, the hardships they face force them to make sacrifices that bring them closer to their true identities.

It’s almost a WRAP - we are at the tail end of finalizing our script and it’s EXCITING!!!

The National Cinema Center of Armenia, Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation of Armenia, ARTsakh Arts and Cultural Foundation of the US, "Artbox" Production House of Lithuania, and Executive Producer funded the pre-production phase of Revival, for a total of $51,700.

What’s next? The next 6 months are crucial. We have a hefty campaign goal of $100,000 for our production in Armenia in the Fall of 2022. $25,000 is the magic number to help us kick start the project. The remainder of our budget will be completed by other funds, grants, and fundraising campaigns.

We want you to feel part of this BIG production! Be a backer and receive a PERK! We have customized a selection of tiered rewards! Spread the word and share our links! We can DO THIS TOGETHER!

Development Phase (10/2018 – 03/2021):

Completed with a budget of $51,700

Funded By:

Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation, National Cinema Center of Armenia, Artsakh Arts and Cultural Foundation, Artbox Production House, and Executive Producer

Crowdfunding Campaign:

Keeping the project on track! The next 6 months are crucial in order to lead our production to success in the fall of 2022

Budget:

$384,470

Funded By:

$80K funded by Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation

Goal:

1. Seek $100K from the crowdfunding campaign

2. Seek $204K from National Cinema Center of Armenia, other funds and grants, fundraising efforts, private screenings, donations, and investors

Production Phase:

Fall 2022

Phase 1 - Production in Armenia

Phase 2 – Europe and Other

Forecasted Budget for Production in Armenia: $384,470

Crowdfunding Campaign $100K

I believe art can HEAL

Jivan is an Armenian film director, born in Gyumri, raised in Artsakh, and currently based in the capital city of Yerevan, Armenia. As a child, Jivan grew up during one of the most violent conflicts in the Caucasus and understands well the brutal consequences of war. Although his own childhood was stripped of playful mischief, he was instead laden with responsibility to protect family and friends. He did not abandon his dream and passion for filmmaking.

Jivan’s lifelong dream of storytelling, of chronicling history, and putting Artsakh on the world map has been realized through the art of filmmaking. Jivan has created well over 20 documentaries, short films, and three feature films, Tevanik, The Last Inhabitant, and Gate to Heaven.

I believe film can EDUCATE

Narine, a film director and scriptwriter born in Kapan is currently based in Yerevan, Armenia. Narine, who joined Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation from the very beginning, has played an instrumental role and currently serves as the Creative Director of the Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation. Narine has been creating films with director Jivan Avetisyan for the past six years.

I believe in the power of STORYTELLING

Monique’s storytelling experience spans over twenty years as a writer and producer of the film, books, and new media. Monique began her career as a broadcast journalist in California’s Napa Valley in 1989, producing live radio coverage of the wine industry and local politics. Monique has written, edited, and produced works on film, art, science, history, and pop culture for The Walt Disney Company, National Geographic, Discovery Channel, Fodor’s Travel, and Insight Editions (Harry Potter: The Wand Collection).

In 2006, as editor-in-chief of divinecaroline.com, Monique helped launch one of the first social media publishing websites for women dedicated to storytelling. She continues to write and consult on film projects including Neil Bell’s 2014 documentary Welcome To Somalia and Jivan Avetisyan’s 2019 feature film Gate to Heaven. Monique presently lives in California and is now developing the screenplay for Revival.

I believe in MAKING A DIFFERENCE

Masis is the co-founder of Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation and has been serving as its Chairman of the Board of Trustees since its inception in 2014. Masis decided to establish the organization along with Jivan Avetisyan with a mission to create cultural projects, particularly films, whose beliefs are based on universal human values.

Masis began his film career with Tevanik in 2014 as a Producer. Masis produced and co-wrote the script for The Last Inhabitant (2016). He also produced the foundation's third feature film Gate to Heaven (2019). Masis is currently working on the foundation’s new film projects Revival and Black List, which are currently in the development stage.

I believe film is a POWERFUL MEDIUM

Kestutis is an industry expert and an international award-winning producer with over twenty years of experience. He chairs the Board of Independent Producers Association and the Advisory Board of the Vilnius Film Office. Additionally, he is a Board Member of the Film Policy Council at the Ministry of Culture.

Kestutis began his career in producing films in 1998 in Vilnius, Lithuania and since then he has become one of the most active, influential, and successful film producers in the country. In 2003, Kestutis founded his own production company "ARTBOX", which has produced a number international feature films and documentaries.

I believe in REWRITING STORIES

Adrineh’s upbringing, traveling, being multi-lingual, and exposure to different cultures have led her to a career in the hospitality industry. Adrineh is currently an Executive in a leading luxury brand hotel.

As a grandchild of Armenian Genocide Survivors of both paternal and maternal side, Adrineh has always had the determination and perseverance to bring awareness about Armenian culture and causes around the globe.

Adrineh’s involvement with film began in 2014 with Jivan Avetisyan’s previous international award-winning film, Tevanik. Adrineh then served as the Executive Producer for Jivan Avetisyan’s next three feature films The Last Inhabitant, Gate to Heaven, and Revival. Adrineh’s next film project also includes Black List.

 I believe in SIMPLICITY in storytelling

Jan is an award-winning German writer/director and dramaturg. He studied screenwriting at the German Film and Television Academy Berlin (DFFB) and holds an MA in directing from the Polish National Film School in Lodz (PWSFTviT).

For many years now, Jan works internationally as a mentor for other screenwriters to support them during their story development process and teaches storytelling at the Polish National Film School and at the German Film and TV Academy Berlin (DFFB).

I believe in the FUTURE of Armenian Cinema

A very well-respected and reputable writer, film critic, translator, and editor who also serves as a member of the International Federation of Film Critics (FIPRESCI) Awards. Zaven was awarded with the 2015 President Prize for his long-term commitment and influential work in the film industry in Armenia. Zaven’s accolades span over two decades.

I believe in INSPIRATION

Viken is an experienced technology executive who has lived, studied, worked and lectured in half a dozen countries on three continents and is also fluent in eight languages.  A recipient in 2012 of HM Queen Elizabeth II Diamond Jubilee Medal for his contributions and services to Canada, he is a professional engineer who has worked for Canada’s top aerospace, telecommunications and IT innovation companies.  He is also a human rights’ activist and an expert in long term grassroots policy initiatives for the improvement of the lives of citizenry.

Viken’s published works include essays in online and traditional Armenian media as well as poems in an anthology of modern Armenian poetry; already in the early nineties, he published academic research that correctly predicted all the long- term future impacts of rapidly evolving technology on global education markets.  He continues to fulfill several advisory and international jury roles for Armenian and non-Armenian projects and organizations in business, academic, government policy and literary settings.  He is particularly proud of being the first project manager of the TUMO Center having worked with the visionary couple Sam and Sylva Simonians to bring together the initial team that made the dream a reality.

One of Viken’s main interests are Armenian studies and he continues to research and lecture extensively on the topic. 

 Viken is a major contributor to the creative team of the film project Revival.

I believe in COMBINING FORCES

Hasmik Avetisyan is a Strategy Consultant based in Berlin, Germany. Hasmik helps businesses and senior leaders worldwide set up and run successful large-scale transformation / turnaround programs. She started exploring film industry almost a decade ago acting in short movies, commercials and getting bit parts in larger productions as a hobby while being an Economics student.

The growing filmmakers’ network and love for working behind the camera eventually landed her first film production jobs at student projects. While focusing on her consulting career in subsequent years, in 2018 she teamed up with Jivan Avetisyan and Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation with the vision of creating high-quality festival films that are also commercially viable. Hasmik holds an MSc. Degree in Economics and Management from Humboldt University of Berlin.

We believe in VISUAL STORYTELLING through costumes

Vicken, a native Californian graduated with a Bachelor of Architecture from the Southern California Institute of Architecture (SCI-ARC) and received his Master of Fine Arts in Fashion from the Academy of Art University, in San Francisco, CA. Vicken’s approach to design is at the synthesis of fashion and architecture.

Kyung Hwa Kim, a native of Seoul, Korea, graduated from SookMyung Women’s University where she received her Bachelor of Fine Arts and Master of Fine Arts in Arts and Crafts. Kyung Hwa pursued a career in teaching and design and later returned to academia to complete yet another Master of Fine Arts in Fashion Design from the Academy of Art University in San Francisco.

The union of these two professions has opened the door to exploring the topography and the dynamics of the human body both in motion and at rest, channeled through the construction of the garment.

I believe films can INFLUENCE viewers

A native Californian, Arthur is the founder of EFP Realty through its exclusive relationship with John Hart Real Estate. Arthur specializes in the acquisition and sales of commercial and residential investment property. Arthur is also a 20-year veteran investment advisor with sharp business acumen for real estate investing.

Arthur’s involvement with film began in 2014 with Jivan Avetisyan’s previous international award-winning film, Tevanik. Arthur also played an instrumental role in the making of Jivan Avetisyan’s second feature film, The Last Inhabitant, to later become the Supervisor Producer for Jivan's third feature film, Gate to Heaven. Arthur's financial background and his strategic planning skills have helped tremendously in making key business decisions for our films.

 Arthur will now serve as the Associate Producer for Revival.

I believe film can ENLIGHTEN and impact society

A native Californian, Garo R. Madenlian, Esq. is a partner at Kevorkian and Madenlian LLP with years of experience as a Deputy District Attorney where as a prosecutor Garo honed his trial skills and secured impressive results with numerous jury verdicts in his favor. Garo focuses his practice in the areas of criminal defense and personal injury as well as employment law, family law, and living trusts.

Garo played a key role in the making of Jivan Avetisyan’s second feature film, The Last Inhabitant, to later become the Supervisor Producer for Jivan's third feature film, Gate to Heaven. Garo's legal background has been instrumental in giving legal advice as well as finalizing agreements with actors, producers, sales agents, and distributors.

Garo will serve as the Associate Producer for Revival.

I believe in the BIG PICTURE

Raffi Keuhnelian is a Canadian-Armenian, born in Montreal, living in Yerevan. He is the co-founder and CEO of iNexxus.com, a digital marketing and creative agency with offices in Montreal and in Yerevan. The company has been operating in Yerevan since 2013 and currently employs over 15 young professionals from Armenia and the Diaspora. Raffi Keuhnelian is also the CEO and co-founder of MusicPromoToday.com, a digital music marketing agency, focusing on promoting artists and labels. 

Raffi Keuhnelian has been a member of the Forbes Agency Council and the Young Entrepreneur Council since 2017. His publications have been featured on major outlets such as Forbes, HuffingtonPost, and Mashable. Raffi is also involved with many different Armenian organizations and programs, he is a board member of Pahapan.org; an NGO that builds rescue shelters for children in schools across border villages in Tavush, Armenia. 

He is also the founder of ArtsakhStrong.am; a humanitarian and development program built to promote Armenians from the Diaspora to come volunteer in Armenia and also to provide aid and support to people affected by the war. A dedicated Armenian, Raffi Keuhnelian brings his knowledge and experience to ideas he believes.

I believe film is the single GREATEST ART FORM

Armen Karaoghlanian is the founder of Armenian Film Society, a non-profit organization dedicated to shining a spotlight on Armenian films and filmmakers. Armenian Film Society has held events with filmmakers such as Atom Egoyan, Mardik Martin, Sev Ohanian, and others.

Armen Karaoghlanian is a graduate of the University of Southern California’s School of Cinematic Arts and has an extensive background in film and marketing. In his career, he has been featured on Complex, Fast Company, Hypebeast, Filmmaker Magazine, and Indiewire.

I believe in FORGING OUR OWN HISTORY

Born and raised in Los Angeles, Van Der Megerdichian attended Holy Martyrs Armenian High School and went on to receive his formal education at UCLA. During his time at UCLA, Van interned at the Republic of Armenia’s Ministry of Economy and the United Nations office in Yerevan, Armenia where he worked at the UNHCR and UNDP agencies. He graduated Phi Beta Kappa and cum laude from UCLA with a departmental honors degree in History and a minor in Armenian Studies, while also receiving college honors. 

During his time at UCLA, Van also joined The Strategic Insights Group, a Los Angeles-based consultancy. He later went on to establish Zartonk Media, a new-age independent Armenian multimedia news outlet. Van is currently a research fellow at the Philos Project and a student at Columbia University’s School of International and Public Affairs studying international finance and economic policy.

My goal is to create films that will strongly appeal to the international audience and to do so, it is extremely important to create co-production projects that tell Armenian stories incorporated with international elements, including locations. I plan to shoot the film Revival in several locations because it takes place in Armenia/Artsakh, France, Iceland, Jerusalem.

As an Armenian film director, my main objective is to tell a powerful, true and honest story that can resonate with many viewers regardless of their own identity and religion. I have presented fragments and glimpses of stories that I have heard, read and witnessed at different times. In a sense, the film is based on true stories and historical events that are all accurate. The narratives are intertwined in an interesting way and become a part of a completed single continuous chain.

With conviction, I want my films to continue to provide hope to the audience, help facilitate their own personal journeys while valuing every living moment, and inspire a strong determination to achieve their dreams. 

– Jivan Avetisyan

1. What is the film about?

In a story, where true identity is born out of the darkness of the past, the plot follows one woman’s secret which forces three destinies to intertwine when a diasporan young robotics student living in France is determined to root out the truth of his father’s wartime death in Artsakh... his girlfriend, a young Frenchwoman sets out to reunite with her estranged volcanologist father in Iceland to trace her indigenous Canadian roots... his esteemed French professor, a descendant of a Holocaust survivor, reclaims his abandoned Jewish roots in Israel in search of the meaning of life. Along the way, the hardships they face force them to make sacrifices that bring them closer to their true identities.

2. When will the film production begin?

Production is slated for Fall 2022

3. When will the movie be released?

Earmarked for Fall 2024 in theatres near you. Yes, there is a process involved. The key is to find the best distribution company that fits our needs. Once a deal is made, then a release date is announced.

4. Is there any big-name talent in the film?

Of course! We have many talented and well-regarded Armenian actors and actresses that will make great appearances in the film along with an international cast. More to come!

5. How is the budget determined?

The budget is determined based on our past practices of making our previous films. Additionally, each producer from his or her respective country has to provide a cost analysis based on the needs of the production. These cost analyses are then taken into consideration when creating a budget.

6. When will my perks be available?

Once the film is completed in 2024.

7. How will I get my digital download?

When the time arrives, we will forward you an e-mail with a link to download the film.

8. When will the DVDs be shipped and/or become available?

We will let you know when the time arrives that we would like to send you your DVD. We always deliver on our promises!
story_txt: 100K IS OUR FINAL STRETCH GOAL... LET'S DO THIS! A lifelong PASSION for film inspires us to create yet another film… our 4th! Our director Jivan Avetis yan who grew up in Artsakh has always been captivated by the world of cinema. Jivan’s fascination with film began when he was a little boy growing up in Khachmach, a village on the outskirts of Stepanakert. In fact, Jivan’s lifelong DREAM of creating a film in Khachmach was realized in 2015 with the production of our second feature film The Last Inhabitant, now streaming on Prime.Jivan’s deep-rooted passion for filmmaking is what brings us here to our crowdfunding campaign TODAY! There is so much to be told! We need to REWRITE stories and share it with a mainstream audience. Artsakh will serve as the backdrop of the storyline of our new feature film project, Revival, a film that is thought-provoking, mind-twisting, with several unexpected turns of events. Ohhhh and you will get to meet ORCHID20… Murat’s creation!Revival, two and a half years in the making, will be on your WATCHLIST in 2024… YES, filmmaking is a process!Link in bio on Jivan Avetisyan’s Instagram page to check out info on his award-winning films! Armenian international award-winning film director Jivan Avetisyan from Artsakh spent 38 horrifying days in Stepanakert this past October documenting the war crimes committed against the Armenian population. He will be integrating his findings in our film project.Jivan is no stranger to the international cinematic world as his three previous feature films, Tevanik (also streaming on Amazon Prime), The Last Inhabitant, and Gate to Heaven have their own individual global success stories. Jivan also rocked the Berlinale Talents 2020, a talent program within the framework of the Berlin International Film Festival. He was selected amongst 3,400 applicants to attend with our new film project Revival, Berlinale Talents 2020. Jivan, as a Berlinale Talent 2020, was also selected by the reputable German international broadcast Deutsche Welle to be the subject of a documentary.What else? Our film project Revival received the following shout out from Roy W. Dean - Summer 2020 Grant, From the Heart Productions: “Thanks for sending us your brilliant film to review.  We have sincerely enjoyed reading your work. The film has been selected in the category of "Hot Films in the Making". We like the film and know it has excellent potential.  We will host your film on our website for a year to help you promote it and to help you raise funds.”Here is the latest from Cineuropa! Jivan Avetisyan's Interview and Gate to Heaven Film Review after Moscow International Film Festival “Pulls Nagorno-Karabakh Drama Over Violence Worries”: Moscow Times.LET’S DO THIS! Thank you for your ongoing support. We are CONFIDENT that we are on the right track with our film project!One woman’s secret forces three destinies to intertwine when a young robotics student living in France is determined to root out the truth of his father’s wartime death in Armenia / Artsakh… his girlfriend, a young Frenchwoman sets out to reunite with her estranged volcanologist father in Iceland to trace her indigenous Canadian roots… his esteemed French professor, a descendent of a Holocaust survivor, reclaims his abandoned Jewish roots in Israel in search of the meaning of life.Along the way, the hardships they face force them to make sacrifices that bring them closer to their true identities.It’s almost a WRAP - we are at the tail end of finalizing our script and it’s EXCITING!!!The National Cinema Center of Armenia, Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation of Armenia, ARTsakh Arts and Cultural Foundation of the US, "Artbox" Production House of Lithuania, and Executive Producer funded the pre-production phase of Revival, for a total of $51,700.What’s next? The next 6 months are crucial. We have a hefty campaign goal of $100,000 for our production in Armenia in the Fall of 2022. $25,000 is the magic number to help us kick start the project. The remainder of our budget will be completed by other funds, grants, and fundraising campaigns.We want you to feel part of this BIG production! Be a backer and receive a PERK! We have customized a selection of tiered rewards! Spread the word and share our links! We can DO THIS TOGETHER!Development Phase (10/2018 – 03/2021):Completed with a budget of $51,700Funded By:Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation, National Cinema Center of Armenia, Artsakh Arts and Cultural Foundation, Artbox Production House, and Executive ProducerCrowdfunding Campaign:Keeping the project on track! The next 6 months are crucial in order to lead our production to success in the fall of 2022Budget:$384,470Funded By:$80K funded by Fish eye Art Cultural FoundationGoal:1. Seek $100K from the crowdfunding campaign2. Seek $204K from National Cinema Center of Armenia, other funds and grants, fundraising efforts, private screenings, donations, and investorsProduction Phase:Fall 2022Phase 1 - Production in ArmeniaPhase 2 – Europe and OtherForecasted Budget for Production in Armenia: $384,470Crowdfunding Campaign $100KI believe art can HEALJivan is an Armenian film director, born in Gyumri, raised in Artsakh, and currently based in the capital city of Yerevan, Armenia. As a child, Jivan grew up during one of the most violent conflicts in the Caucasus and understands well the brutal consequences of war. Although his own childhood was stripped of playful mischief, he was instead laden with responsibility to protect family and friends. He did not abandon his dream and passion for filmmaking.Jivan’s lifelong dream of storytelling, of chronicling history, and putting Artsakh on the world map has been realized through the art of filmmaking. Jivan has created well over 20 documentaries, short films, and three feature films, Tevanik, The Last Inhabitant, and Gate to Heaven.I believe film can EDUCATENarine, a film director and scriptwriter born in Kapan is currently based in Yerevan, Armenia. Narine, who joined Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation from the very beginning, has played an instrumental role and currently serves as the Creative Director of the Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation. Narine has been creating films with director Jivan Avetisyan for the past six years.I believe in the power of STORYTELLINGMonique’s storytelling experience spans over twenty years as a writer and producer of the film, books, and new media. Monique began her career as a broadcast journalist in California’s Napa Valley in 1989, producing live radio coverage of the wine industry and local politics. Monique has written, edited, and produced works on film, art, science, history, and pop culture for The Walt Disney Company, National Geographic, Discovery Channel, Fodor’s Travel, and Insight Editions (Harry Potter: The Wand Collection).In 2006, as editor-in-chief of divinecaroline.com, Monique helped launch one of the first social media publishing websites for women dedicated to storytelling. She continues to write and consult on film projects including Neil Bell’s 2014 documentary Welcome To Somalia and Jivan Avetisyan’s 2019 feature film Gate to Heaven. Monique presently lives in California and is now developing the screenplay for Revival.I believe in MAKING A DIFFERENCEMasis is the co-founder of Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation and has been serving as its Chairman of the Board of Trustees since its inception in 2014. Masis decided to establish the organization along with Jivan Avetisyan with a mission to create cultural projects, particularly films, whose beliefs are based on universal human values.Masis began his film career with Tevanik in 2014 as a Producer. Masis produced and co-wrote the script for The Last Inhabitant (2016). He also produced the foundation's third feature film Gate to Heaven (2019). Masis is currently working on the foundation’s new film projects Revival and Black List, which are currently in the development stage.I believe film is a POWERFUL MEDIUMKestutis is an industry expert and an international award-winning producer with over twenty years of experience. He chairs the Board of Independent Producers Association and the Advisory Board of the Vilnius Film Office. Additionally, he is a Board Member of the Film Policy Council at the Ministry of Culture.Kestutis began his career in producing films in 1998 in Vilnius, Lithuania and since then he has become one of the most active, influential, and successful film producers in the country. In 2003, Kestutis founded his own production company "ARTBOX", which has produced a number international feature films and documentaries.I believe in REWRITING STORIESAdrineh’s upbringing, traveling, being multi-lingual, and exposure to different cultures have led her to a career in the hospitality industry. Adrineh is currently an Executive in a leading luxury brand hotel.As a grandchild of Armenian Genocide Survivors of both paternal and maternal side, Adrineh has always had the determination and perseverance to bring awareness about Armenian culture and causes around the globe.Adrineh’s involvement with film began in 2014 with Jivan Avetisyan’s previous international award-winning film, Tevanik. Adrineh then served as the Executive Producer for Jivan Avetisyan’s next three feature films The Last Inhabitant, Gate to Heaven, and Revival. Adrineh’s next film project also includes Black List. I believe in SIMPLICITY in storytellingJan is an award-winning German writer/director and dramaturg. He studied screenwriting at the German Film and Television Academy Berlin (DFFB) and holds an MA in directing from the Polish National Film School in Lodz (PWSFTviT).For many years now, Jan works internationally as a mentor for other screenwriters to support them during their story development process and teaches storytelling at the Polish National Film School and at the German Film and TV Academy Berlin (DFFB).I believe in the FUTURE of Armenian CinemaA very well-respected and reputable writer, film critic, translator, and editor who also serves as a member of the International Federation of Film Critics (FIPRESCI) Awards. Zaven was awarded with the 2015 President Prize for his long-term commitment and influential work in the film industry in Armenia. Zaven’s accolades span over two decades.I believe in INSPIRATIONViken is an experienced technology executive who has lived, studied, worked and lectured in half a dozen countries on three continents and is also fluent in eight languages.  A recipient in 2012 of HM Queen Elizabeth II Diamond Jubilee Medal for his contributions and services to Canada, he is a professional engineer who has worked for Canada’s top aerospace, telecommunications and IT innovation companies.  He is also a human rights’ activist and an expert in long term grassroots policy initiatives for the improvement of the lives of citizenry.Viken’s published works include essays in online and traditional Armenian media as well as poems in an anthology of modern Armenian poetry; already in the early nineties, he published academic research that correctly predicted all the long- term future impacts of rapidly evolving technology on global education markets.  He continues to fulfill several advisory and international jury roles for Armenian and non-Armenian projects and organizations in business, academic, government policy and literary settings.  He is particularly proud of being the first project manager of the TUMO Center having worked with the visionary couple Sam and Sylva Simonians to bring together the initial team that made the dream a reality.One of Viken’s main interests are Armenian studies and he continues to research and lecture extensively on the topic.  Viken is a major contributor to the creative team of the film project Revival.I believe in COMBINING FORCESHasmik Avetisyan is a Strategy Consultant based in Berlin, Germany. Hasmik helps businesses and senior leaders worldwide set up and run successful large-scale transformation / turnaround programs. She started exploring film industry almost a decade ago acting in short movies, commercials and getting bit parts in larger productions as a hobby while being an Economics student.The growing filmmakers’ network and love for working behind the camera eventually landed her first film production jobs at student projects. While focusing on her consulting career in subsequent years, in 2018 she teamed up with Jivan Avetisyan and Fish eye Art Cultural Foundation with the vision of creating high-quality festival films that are also commercially viable. Hasmik holds an MSc. Degree in Economics and Management from Humboldt University of Berlin.We believe in VISUAL STORYTELLING through costumesVicken, a native Californian graduated with a Bachelor of Architecture from the Southern California Institute of Architecture (SCI-ARC) and received his Master of Fine Arts in Fashion from the Academy of Art University, in San Francisco, CA. Vicken’s approach to design is at the synthesis of fashion and architecture.Kyung Hwa Kim, a native of Seoul, Korea, graduated from SookMyung Women’s University where she received her Bachelor of Fine Arts and Master of Fine Arts in Arts and Crafts. Kyung Hwa pursued a career in teaching and design and later returned to academia to complete yet another Master of Fine Arts in Fashion Design from the Academy of Art University in San Francisco.The union of these two professions has opened the door to exploring the topography and the dynamics of the human body both in motion and at rest, channeled through the construction of the garment.I believe films can INFLUENCE viewersA native Californian, Arthur is the founder of EFP Realty through its exclusive relationship with John Hart Real Estate. Arthur specializes in the acquisition and sales of commercial and residential investment property.
