story_txt:
:::STRETCH GOAL $35,000:::

THE CAST
DANIELLE HARRIS

BILLY BLAIR (MACHETE, ALITA BATTLE ANGEL)

TATIANA SOKOLOVA

story:
Overview

Growing up, Spider-Man was always a massive part of my life. Whether it was a distraction from problems at home, or an escape into a world greater than myself, he was there with me every step of the way – not as a flawless idol, but as someone I could directly relate to. Peter Parker is endearing because he isn't perfect – he gives up, he falls short, he collapses under pressure. Rather than an icon, he's there to reassure the world that they are not alone in their struggles...he is reacting, failing, and prevailing just like anyone else. With this film, we want to dive into his natural human flaws: What defines a man who is crushed by his own mind? We pulled from hundreds of different comic books from over the years, whether it was written by Stan Lee, or Gerry Conway, or Tom DeFalco, or any other legendary writer to take on the character, all in an effort to craft a story that honors the character in the best way that we can.

We decided to primarily take inspiration from 'Spider-Man: Blue' (along with many other stories during that era such as 'Death & Destiny' or Gerry Conway's run) and 'The Kid Who Collects Spider-Man', two grounded stories that focus on the melancholic life of the character. Our approach is very character driven, with necessary action, but not an over-saturation of it. At the core, it is very much a story about normal human beings burdened by elements of fantasy, much like Sam Raimi's 'Spider-Man 2', my personal favorite film of all time.

 

The Suit:

With the help of a talented crew, we have been given the opportunity to bring our ideal Spider-Man costume to life. Designed by Tiago Datrinti, the suit is a modernized version of John Romita Sr, Ross Andru, and Gil Kane's original artwork, with a custom logo created by Evan Jackson.

Following the initial design, it was projected by Lorenzo Di Sante, who modified the concept into a 3D landscape and illustrated its translation into live-action.

After the 3D projections, @comicsuitfactory began practical realizations of the face shell & logo, in addition to group consultations for exchanges of ideas and plans.

Finally, the team at The Amazing Spider-Lab began crafting the full costume. The result became my favorite Spider-Man costume ever made, and I could not be more proud of the work they did.

 

 

Budget:

 

Cast:

Warden Wayne will be portraying Spider-Man in this film. I have known him for nearly four years now, and with our shared creative mindset, the development of the project has been absolutely seamless. We have helped each other grow as creators, and over the years, I have watched his progression as a dedicated, talented actor who will do justice to this character. 

Harry Osborn will play a major role in the film, and he will be portrayed by Sean Wythe – one of the most dedicated, determined, and talented actors I know. Sean has been a massive part of this project — not only in his ability to tirelessly work on his performance, but also in his contributions to the film itself. He is responsible for the ‘Lotus’ title, and his constructive criticism on the script has led it to become the best it can be. While he will not become the Green Goblin in this story, you will see how he deals with the death of his father, Norman Osborn, and how it ties directly into the central themes that we chose.

Illuminating the conflicts of the film will be Mary Jane Watson, played by Moriah Brooklyn. Her passion, energy, and charisma brought something to the role that I have never seen before in an adaptation, and the moment I saw her, I knew I was looking at someone who could truly do justice to this massively important character. We are all excited to work with her this summer, and show you a version of MJ that we feel has been overlooked outside of comics!

Tuyen Powell will be portraying Gwen Stacy in this film – the person who taught Peter Parker the meaning of love. While we can't give many details on her role in the narrative, I can say that Tuyen's passion for comics seriously revealed itself through her audition. Each line was delivered with the perfect level of subtlety that we were looking for, and the energy surrounding her illustrates exactly who Gwen Stacy is. We can't wait to work with her when production begins!

Max Fox is Tim Harrison – the emotional core of the entire storyline. Faced with the curse of terminal illness, Tim lives his final days with hope and optimism, effortlessly modeling himself off of the icon that he views Spider-Man to be. I wanted Max in this project since the day we announced it – not only does he carry a strong presence with his acting, but he also loves the comic books about as much as the character he's playing! We have faith that he will nail the role, and deliver the exact portrayal that we are envisioning!

Milestone Goals:

$5,000: A linear study focused on Spider-Man, but limited by a smaller cast. No action — only a simple drama driven by Peter’s internal struggle as he faces his own flaws.

$10,000: A look into the mind of Peter Parker on a larger scale. This would allow us to bring a key character from the world of Spider-Man into the story, who would reflect the themes and enhance its meaning with a clear contrast to Peter’s conflicts. This would also allow for small CGI sequences, creating a more atmospheric New York environment.

$15,000: This would allow us to adapt a more fulfilling supporting cast from the full script, all building into the themes of the story and elevating it to a new level. With multiple CGI sequences, we will be able to bring a whole new perspective, with a longer runtime and a more impactful conclusion.

$20,000: This is the full version of the film that we have wanted to enliven for years. While it’s an ambitious goal, it would allow us to adapt all of our ideas, with a grand opening sequence, complex characters with their own struggles & flaws, and a satisfying conclusion that embraces the messages of Spider-Man.

$20,000 +: The sky is the limit. Anything in addition to the initial budget will allow us to flesh out the quality & length of the film like we had never thought possible, and achieve ideas that were previously only a hopeless dream.

~ GJK
story_txt: OverviewGrowing up, Spider-Man was always a massive part of my life. Whether it was a distraction from problems at home, or an escape into a world greater than myself, he was there with me every step of the way – not as a flawless idol, but as someone I could directly relate to. Peter Parker is endearing because he isn't perfect – he gives up, he falls short, he collapses under pressure. Rather than an icon, he's there to reassure the world that they are not alone in their struggles...he is reacting, failing, and prevailing just like anyone else. With this film, we want to dive into his natural human flaws: What defines a man who is crushed by his own mind? We pulled from hundreds of different comic books from over the years, whether it was written by Stan Lee, or Gerry Conway, or Tom DeFalco, or any other legendary writer to take on the character, all in an effort to craft a story that honors the character in the best way that we can.We decided to primarily take inspiration from 'Spider-Man: Blue' (along with many other stories during that era such as 'Death & Destiny' or Gerry Conway's run) and 'The Kid Who Collects Spider-Man', two grounded stories that focus on the melancholic life of the character. Our approach is very character driven, with necessary action, but not an over-saturation of it. At the core, it is very much a story about normal human beings burdened by elements of fantasy, much like Sam Raimi's 'Spider-Man 2', my personal favorite film of all time. The Suit:With the help of a talented crew, we have been given the opportunity to bring our ideal Spider-Man costume to life. Designed by Tiago Datrinti, the suit is a modernized version of John Romita Sr, Ross Andru, and Gil Kane's original artwork, with a custom logo created by Evan Jackson.Following the initial design, it was projected by Lorenzo Di Sante, who modified the concept into a 3D landscape and illustrated its translation into live-action.After the 3D projections, @comicsuitfactory began practical realizations of the face shell & logo, in addition to group consultations for exchanges of ideas and plans.Finally, the team at The Amazing Spider-Lab began crafting the full costume. The result became my favorite Spider-Man costume ever made, and I could not be more proud of the work they did.  Budget: Cast:Warden Wayne will be portraying Spider-Man in this film. I have known him for nearly four years now, and with our shared creative mindset, the development of the project has been absolutely seamless. We have helped each other grow as creators, and over the years, I have watched his progression as a dedicated, talented actor who will do justice to this character. Harry Osborn will play a major role in the film, and he will be portrayed by Sean Wythe – one of the most dedicated, determined, and talented actors I know. Sean has been a massive part of this project — not only in his ability to tirelessly work on his performance, but also in his contributions to the film itself. He is responsible for the ‘Lotus’ title, and his constructive criticism on the script has led it to become the best it can be. While he will not become the Green Goblin in this story, you will see how he deals with the death of his father, Norman Osborn, and how it ties directly into the central themes that we chose.Illuminating the conflicts of the film will be Mary Jane Watson, played by Moriah Brooklyn. Her passion, energy, and charisma brought something to the role that I have never seen before in an adaptation, and the moment I saw her, I knew I was looking at someone who could truly do justice to this massively important character. We are all excited to work with her this summer, and show you a version of MJ that we feel has been overlooked outside of comics!Tuyen Powell will be portraying Gwen Stacy in this film – the person who taught Peter Parker the meaning of love. While we can't give many details on her role in the narrative, I can say that Tuyen's passion for comics seriously revealed itself through her audition. Each line was delivered with the perfect level of subtlety that we were looking for, and the energy surrounding her illustrates exactly who Gwen Stacy is. We can't wait to work with her when production begins!Max Fox is Tim Harrison – the emotional core of the entire storyline. Faced with the curse of terminal illness, Tim lives his final days with hope and optimism, effortlessly modeling himself off of the icon that he views Spider-Man to be. I wanted Max in this project since the day we announced it – not only does he carry a strong presence with his acting, but he also loves the comic books about as much as the character he's playing! We have faith that he will nail the role, and deliver the exact portrayal that we are envisioning!Milestone Goals:$5,000: A linear study focused on Spider-Man, but limited by a smaller cast. No action — only a simple drama driven by Peter’s internal struggle as he faces his own flaws.$10,000: A look into the mind of Peter Parker on a larger scale. This would allow us to bring a key character from the world of Spider-Man into the story, who would reflect the themes and enhance its meaning with a clear contrast to Peter’s conflicts. This would also allow for small CGI sequences, creating a more atmospheric New York environment.$15,000: This would allow us to adapt a more fulfilling supporting cast from the full script, all building into the themes of the story and elevating it to a new level. With multiple CGI sequences, we will be able to bring a whole new perspective, with a longer runtime and a more impactful conclusion.$20,000: This is the full version of the film that we have wanted to enliven for years. While it’s an ambitious goal, it would allow us to adapt all of our ideas, with a grand opening sequence, complex characters with their own struggles & flaws, and a satisfying conclusion that embraces the messages of Spider-Man.$20,000 +: The sky is the limit. Anything in addition to the initial budget will allow us to flesh out the quality & length of the film like we had never thought possible, and achieve ideas that were previously only a hopeless dream.~ GJK

story:
Short Summary

Dani Thompson

Zombies have overrun the earth, and young Scott's the last to learn about it - so he can't be too picky when it comes to choosing his safe haven. And as it goes with all crisis like this one, they can bring out the best in humans - or the worst. So when Scott's confronted with the other survivors in the farmhouse he's found refuge at he's quick to learn that the living can be just as dangerous as the undead, and staying put until help arrives could seriously shorten his lifespan …
The House That Zombies Built, starring horror icons Laurence R. Harvey and Dani Thompson and directed by zombie specialist Jason Wright - the zombie film that genre fans have long waited for!!!

We at Zombie House Productions are passionate about the zombie genre, so we want to give all fans of the undead the best the genre has to offer in both story and execution, which means The House that Zombies Built will combine character-driven drama harking back to the mother of all zombie movies, Night of the Living Dead, with contemporary zombie action, replete with shotguns, chainsaws, blood and guts.
“Our zombies are fast, nasty, scary – something you can’t get away from,” promises director Jason Wright, “but we rely on equal parts on zombie violence, clever dialogue and character development, and a cinematic feel a proper zombie apocalypse truly deserves.”

 

Laurence R. Harvey

Who's in it

The House That Zombies Built will star Laurence R. Harvey and Dani Thompson, both horror icons in their own right.
Laurence R. Harvey will always be remembered for his disturbing performance in Human Centipede II (Full Sequence) and has since starred in many fun genre movies including Frankenstein Created Bikers and Zombie Wars.
Dani Thompson left her mark on the genre in films like Serial Kaller, Axe to Grind, PandaMonium, Beyond Fury and of course Bad Moon Rising. 

Also on board will be Sam Dunning, Reis Daniel and Rosie Kingston.
Sam has worked with the team behind The House That Zombies Built on Acid Pit Stop and Mannequin.
Reis is an actor and stand-up comedian and known from such comedy shows/channels as Pop Sludge, UniLad and LadBible, but has also dabbled into horror in flims like Grindsploitation 4: Meltsploitation and There's No Such Thing as Zombies.
Rosie is a skilled theatre and movie actress who has already gotten her teeth into the horror genre with the fan favourite I Scream on the Beach!

But wait a minute, isn’t that what’s ‘is name? 
Yes, celebrities die, too, and there’s a fair chance they’ll return as zombies, just like the rest of us – so as a special treat for the celebrity spotters in our audience, we’re planning many a celeb-cameo, playing their post-life selves. Who do we have in store? That’s for us not to say and for you to find out.

 

 

Jason Wright

Who we are

Our producer/director Jason Wright’s dedication to the zombie genre is second to none, as not only has he done several zombie features (Acid Pit Stop, Zombie Wars), shorts (Zombie Boot Camp, Infected, Zombie Playground: Ice Cream), and promo videos (Resident Evil 6, Fear the Living Dead, Walker Stalker London), he also runs the webzine Digital Dead, and he’s the organizer of zombie-themed events of all kinds, from zombie walks to zombie booths to, yes, zombie weddings – so it’s safe to say, he’s got some zombie blood in his veins, and with him at the helm you’ll get top shelve zombie entertainment.

Niki Sheldrake

Our producer/screenwriter Niki Sheldrake is an experienced screenwriter who has had both producing and screenwriting training at the London Met School. He has worked on projects that have been on commission and self-initiated, encompassing comedy, horror, action and thriller work. In 2016 he set up Rated Films to market and package his own material, and is currently producing his horror/comedy Arthur's Smalltown Country Massacre with Substantial Films and Dominik Hartl attached to direct. At present he has a number of projects in development with RR3 Films, including his black comedy The Debt Inherited  - starring Tom Hopper, and a spin off web-series called  Chas and Ralfie. His earlier work includes an action comedy feature script called Dangerwalker that made the semi-finals of the LA Comedy Scripts Screenplay Competition, a commission to write an action movie for the producer Nick Thurlow, and a 10 x 10 minute web series called A Silicon Love Story for award winning producer Anne Santa Maria at Groupe Telfrance.

Kirsty Richardson

Michael Haberfelner

Also on our board of producers are Kirsty Richardson and Michael Haberfelner.
Kirsty has handled most of Jason Wright's movies including Acid Pit Stop, Zombie Wars and Mannequin.
Michael worked with Jason on Mannequin, as well as producing movies based on several of his own scripts, including There's No Such Thing as Zombies and Talk of the Dead.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

There's nobody more passionate about making a great zombie movie in all of Essex, maybe all of the UK, than us at Zombie House Productions - but unfortunately one cannot make a film on passion and good will alone, we also need the right equipment and locations, our cast and crew need food and housing, heck even our zombies need makeup (those vain bastards). To that end, we are working with a non-profit organization local to Southend on Sea, Essex, and also a collective community to get as much support as possible. But that still leaves us a bit short on the monetary side, so we're raising funds to cover costs of food, drinks, props, materials, writers, cast, crew and so much more. Every little helps, from £1 up, so please donate what you can and let‘s make this film project happen.

 

Risks & Challenges

Time and again, we as a team have proven that we can make (and release) a feature film, so we are more than qualified to see through the production of a movie from beginning to end - so we would love to say this is risk-free, as we're determined to the teeth to make this movie ... but if 2020 and that virus that's named after a brand of beer (but for the life of it I can't remember which) have taught us anything, it's to expect the unexpected. But unless bad comes to worse and then some, we WILL see this movie through, as making zombie movies is in our blood!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Yes we do understand that money can occasionally be a bit on the tight side - heck, we're filmmakers, other than making movies the occasional lack of funds is also in our blood. So if you really want to help but are strapped for cash, why not share our campaign on all social media you can think of - and then some more you have only just googled and are surprised they exist. And tell your friends and family, and heck, even strangers about it incessantly. Paint a mural with the campaign link onto your housefront, spray the link onto planes, trains and automobiles, print out flyers to hand out to passers-by - in short, there are millions of ways to help if you're as passionate about raising the dead as we are - and a big thank you for that in advance!!!

story:
Michael Paré has just joined our cast of Bridge of the Doomed. Michael Paré is known for playing the lead in "Eddie and the Cruisiers", "Tunnel Rats" and "Streets of Fire". 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0001595/?fbclid=IwAR1OTNbSxzFIt5IJkEd5r80_LqpJWnQ5giYro7h_4CWVFq9DiYkWZ5LLPj8

Robert LaSardo has just joined the top cast of Bridge of the Doomed. Robert is known for being in NIP/Tuck, General Hospital, The Mule with Clint Eastwood and NYPD Blue. 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0489436/?ref_=tt_cl_t3&fbclid=IwAR0eu912H5CX4UkmaqZgzS6PKMCTxCEGSB6zOx0TXh0YHtxaL0MLMIg9MjY

 

Kate Watson has signed on to do the role of Sgt. Hernandez

Sarah French has signed on to the play the lead role of Susan.

SYNOPSIS: 

A group of soldiers are ordered to hold a bridge during a zombie outbreak, but what lives underneath the bridge, proves to be even more deadly.

We need your help to make zombie horror film history!  Claim a perk and join our team!

 

 

Be a part of a fresh and original story and help us bring this vision to the big screen!

Producers Michael and Sonny Mahal, following in the success of their recent "Attack of the Unknown starring Robert LaSardo, Richard Grieco and Tara Reid" “Bus Party To Hell” starring Tara Reid and "Art of the Dead" starring Richard Grieco and Tara Reid, they are ready to conquer the world of horror and thrills again with “Bridge of the Doomed”. With a passion for bringing new and exciting stories to the big screen while expanding the scope of filming in the Vegas Community, Michael and Sonny will once again knock this production out of the park!

 

 

Here is the 30 second trailer for our last feature "Attack of the Unknown" starring Richard Grieco, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  (the film is currently in post-production and will be shopped at American Film Market in November of 2019) 

 

Art of the Dead movie just recently signed to ITN distribution and will be released at Walmart's nationwide on October 1st, 2019.  Art of the Dead will also be released on all major VOD platforms including Amazon, Xbox, Playstation, Vudu, Cable networks like COX and DISH and DirectTV.

 
 

Here is the trailer for Bus Party to Hell starring Tara Reid. This movie is currently released in over 18,500 Redbox locations across the United States. This is huge for an Indie Film!  This was funded through Indiegogo and is in every other Redbox in America.  You can also get it on all major cable and VOD platforms.

 

 

 

 

Here is Michael Su's Director of Photography reel.  Michael Su will be the Cinematographer and a Director on Bridge of the Doomed!

 
 

DEMO REEL FOR V.G.P. EFFECTS & DESIGN STUDIO. THEY WILL BE DOING ALL THE ZOMBIES, CREATURE AND SFX FOR BRIDGE OF THE DOOMED. 


Below are some of Vincent Guastini and VGP Effects zombie work.  The same company that will be doing the zombies on "Bridge of the Doomed"

story:
Hey there!

 If you've made it here, we greatly appreciate you! Here's a little bit about what we're trying to do: 

"Behind Glass" is an exploration of trauma masked as a science fiction piece. When an astronaut is quarantined after a space mission, we embark on her journey in captivity. 

This short is written by Brynn Mitchell, and produced by Chelsea Davis and Laynie Mitchell at Vansell Entertainment. Our star is Emilie Deville, a dear friend, and phenomenally talented actress with an extensive career in film and television in France. 

When will it be completed?

We will be finished with the final edit by December 1, available to watch for donors at that time. We then plan to submit to a multitude of festivals, and Brynn will use it to apply for grad school!

What will the money pay for?

We are trying to pay our cast and crew! We are working with professionals and want to pay them for their work. Having talented friends is great, but being able to pay them for their work is even better! This money will also pay for equipment, food, a location, set design, costumes, makeup, editing, and hopefully some festival submissions!

More info on the creator/links to other works: 

I’m Brynn! I’m interested in female-forward stories that examine the inner workings of morally ambiguous situations and perspectives. 

Link below to my Vimeo to view my most recent works:

- https://vimeo.com/brynnwalkermitchell

 

What We Need & What You Get

Since this is the biggest goal we've had in our fundraising, here are a couple things to note about what you'll receive in return for your generosity and support! 

All donors will get access to the completed film before the public.

Tier 1: $50 or more:

 - You will receive an invitation to the premiere party!

Tier 2: $100 or more

- all above gifts plus...

- You'll receive a special thanks in the credits of the film! 

Tier 3: $200 or more: 

- all of the above plus...

- You'll receive the commemorative production sticker in the mail :) 

 

Risks & Challenges

With your help, we will be engaging in our biggest production yet. But with greater ambition comes greater challenges. 

- so much of this project's success is in the execution of our world-building. Every detail must be perfected and believable. 

- Due to Covid compliance, we have to keep our crew minimal. This means everybody on set will be working extremely hard to get everything done and create the best product we can. 

- Performance driven pieces always offer an extra risk (but a fantastic reward!). If the performances fall flat, the entire piece falls flat. So it's a good thing we have INCREDIBLE talent already signed on! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please follow @vansellentertainment on instagram to follow along and get a behind the scenes look! 
  • Share this campaign with as many people as you can!! 

We profoundly appreciate all of your support!! Can't wait to make this movie.

story:
ZOMBINATRIX - She's Into Whips and BRAINS!

ABOUT THE MOVIE

Synopsis: After Mistress Tawny (Bianca Allaine), a beautiful dominatrix, is brutally murdered by an unsavory gang of thugs, she mysteriously rises from the grave to seek vengeance on her killers. As the supernatural ZOMBINATRIX, she takes great pleasure in incorporating her sadistic kinks into killing her enemies- and any poor soul who stands in her way. After all, she is into whips and BRAINS!

ZOMBINATRIX is the hotly anticipated, heavy metal, zombie horror movie starring actress and scream queen, Bianca Allaine, and directed by award-winning filmmaker, Michael Kyne.

ZOMBINATRIX is a very stylized, sleek, and sexy horror film, which follows the story of a tantalizing zombie dominatrix. As filmmakers, our love of the horror movies and heavy metal music of the late ‘80s and early ‘90s leaves an indelible mark on the aesthetics of our film, with elaborate costuming, striking locations, extravagant sets, and impeccable lighting.

However, this IS a zombie horror film, so expect to see ample amounts of blood, monsters,  classic practical special effects, and Hollywood visual effects including stop-motion animation courtesy of award-winning established artists Webster Colcord and Ralph Cordero. PLUS, if that wasn't to whet your appetite for destruction, world-famous album cover illustrator Ed Repka (Megadeth, Death, NOFX, and MANY more!) is designing an ORIGINAL Metal Monster Mascot poster just for ZOMBINATRIX!

MEET THE CREATORS!

Husband and wife team Michael Kyne and Bianca Allaine founded Video Vamp, LLC as  a video and film production company in 2017. Currently, they are producing their feature-length heavy metal, sleaze rock, and thrash-infused horror film, ZOMBINATRIX. Bianca Allaine stars as the title character- a wickedly tantalizing dominatrix who is resurrected from death to seek savage vengeance on her enemies. The movie is co-written and directed by Michael Kyne.

MICHAEL KYNE- Director, Co-Writer

Michael Kyne is a professional historian and an award-winning filmmaker. Growing up in the late ‘80s and early ‘90s, he was greatly influenced by the horror films, rock, and heavy metal music culture of the era. 

Michael holds a Master of Arts degree from the Savannah College of Art & Design (SCAD). He has over 10 years of filmmaking experience, beginning with special effects and prop making before transitioning into the world of art direction and production design. He has worked in all aspects of film and television production, both in front of and behind the camera. In a variety of locations management and art department roles, Michael has been responsible for the overall look of several History Channel and Smithsonian Channel documentaries. 

Michael incorporates the aesthetics of cult films, midnight movies, and exploitation into his own unique style of filmmaking. His short film, the erotic thriller Web of Deceit, was originally produced as an entry into the ABCs of Death 2 Search for the 26th Director competition. It placed 20th out of over 540 entries from all over the world and is currently available on Bloody Disgusting’s World of Death anthology. 

Recently, Michael worked with Varla Dogwood films on several music documentaries, including Encore: The Hammerjacks Documentary and Can’t Stop the Show: The Return of Kix, which went to number one on the Billboard Top Music Video Sales chart.

BIANCA ALLAINE- Actress, Producer, Co-Writer

Bianca Allaine began her career as a print and runway model in her native Dallas, Texas. Growing up fascinated by the technicality, creativity, and artistic aspects of filmmaking, she moved to Los Angeles at the age of 18 to pursue a career in movies. She was quickly signed with a talent agency and went on to work as a background actress in numerous music videos, commercials, television shows, and films. 

Bianca began landing larger roles in independent films- most notably her standout role as the horribly mutated Pig Bitch in the cult horror movie, Albino Farm, alongside stars Chris Jericho, Richard Christy, and Duane Whitaker. Her performance garnered acclaim and she quickly became a name in the horror community as a popular scream queen. 

In 2010, Bianca met future husband Michael Kyne when she was invited on as a guest to his popular radio show, Macabre Café. The couple married in 2011 and began collaborating on numerous projects, merging their unique creative styles and love of ‘80s heavy metal music and horror movies.

With the love and support of Michael, Bianca began working more behind the camera as a writer, costumer, producer and set designer on their collaborative projects Watch These Films with Bianca Allaine, various Video Vamp short films, and the highly acclaimed, award-winning film, Web of Deceit. She is responsible for handling press, marketing, promotion and communication with press and ZOMBINATRIX fans around the world. 

WORLD-FAMOUS ARTISTS

What makes ZOMBINATRIX stand out from the crowd? Not only is our film stylish, atmospheric, and sleek, but we have an onslaught of WORLD-FAMOUS genre influencing artists on our team including:

ED REPKA

Headbangers rejoice! Iconic thrash, punk, and heavy metal album cover artist, Ed Repka, has signed onto ZOMBINATRIX. Best known for his work with Megadeth and their iconic Vic Rattlehead mascot,  Repka will be creating a unique band poster featuring a Metal Mascot Monster puppet created by Ralph Cordero and Webster Colcord. We don’t want to give too much away, but we’re sure this will be one of your favorite scenes from the movie! 

JEFF GAITHER

​

Jeff Gaither has practiced his unique and morbid horror-rock style for over 30 years. In the '80s, he worked for Ed "Big Daddy" Roth, the cartoonist and custom car fanatic behind the famous Rat Fink character. Jeff has gone on to create artwork for bands like the Misfits, Guns N' Roses, Van Halen, Testament, Stone Temple Pilots and GG Allin. Jeff's work has been featured on over 400 album covers and he has created an EXCLUSIVE poster and Blu-Ray/DVD combo cover for the director's cut of ZOMBINATRIX! Please note, this version of ZOMBINATRIX is ONLY AVAILABLE through the fundraising campaigns.

XNO

Chet Darmstaedter, known professionally as XNO, is widely considered one of the greatest lowbrow underground horror comix artists in the world. His influence on the skateboarding and surf culture of the 1980s and 1990s is absolutely undeniable.

Honing his skills at Memphis Art College in the 1980s, he began illustrating for punk rock magazine Malice and self-publishing underground comics with his company, XEX graphics. His work garnered the attention of R. Crumbs’ Weirdo Comics and Ray Zones’ 3D Comics ,which in turn led him to collaborate with artists R.K. Sloane and Big Daddy Roth.

His expansive career has included published work in Thrasher Magazine, Hustler Magazine, Topps’ cards Dinosaurs Attack series, and animation for MTV.

We are proud to say he is now creating BRAND NEW ORIGINAL artwork for ZOMBINATRIX. This work is exclusive to the crowdfunding exclusive Blu-Ray/DVD comb/lowbrow director’s cut version only.

WHAT WE NEED

  • Though our Kickstarter campaign was a smashing success, filmmaking is still extremely expensive. With a larger budget, not only can we finish ZOMBINATRIX faster, therefore getting it to you much faster than anticipated, but we can make the movie more visually dynamic, bigger, bloodier, and sexier!
  • Every dollar donated to this campaign goes straight into production (minus Indiegogo and 3rd party fees). Your donations provide filming and lighting equipment, rental locations, insurance fees and permits, costuming, Hollywood level special effects (both practical and visual), feeding our cast and crew, exquisite costuming, luxe set design, original artwork, and custom props. ZOMBINATRIX will be a world of its own- an artistic, immersive experience for the viewer.

YOUR IMPACT

  • We aren't just producing a run of the mill horror movie for you, we are creating an entire visual, immersive experience with ZOMBINATRIX. We are putting every penny into Hollywood visual fx (including stop-motion), oodles of zombie pracital fx, impecable lighting and cinematography, atmospheric sets, stylish costuming, and the highest quality merchandise and packaging created by world-famous iconic genre artists. To put it simply, you aren't getting "junk" or "schlock" that will be watched once and then forgotten. We believe in getting what you pay for as well as quality versus quantity. Because we know you work so hard for your money, we want to bring you the absolute best product available that will be cherished for years to come. 
  • The ZOMBINATRIX Facebook page already has nearly 27,000 fans worldwide!
  • Our Kickstarter fundraiser was so successful that we were personally invited to Indiegogo's entrepreneurship InDemand campaign!
  • ZOMBINATRIX has already received countless distribution offers and has generated world-wide  press including, but not limited to:

CHALLENGES

At this point, we are proud to say that there is no doubt that the film will be finished. The only question now is how quickly can we finish it so we can get it into YOUR hands? And, how visually dynamic, big, bloody, and sexy do you want the movie to be?

We would love for ZOMBINATRIX  to become the next iconic villain in horror, but in order to do that, we need your help and funding to make this film a classic and launching point for the Undead Mistress. How cool would it be to brag to your friends that YOU helped create the next big thing- a brand new, original horror classic?

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We know how hard you work for your money and sometimes you just cannot contribute. We completely realize that "life happens". But, don't fret! There are a lot of ways you can still help! 

  • You can spread the word to all your friends and share this campaign on your social media platforms!
  • If you're a blogger, have a podcast or vidcast, or write for a magazine or online news service, we'd love to be featured! No outlet is too big or small. We'll talk to everyone- not just horror outlets. Remember, this film covers a variety of subjects- zombies, horror, independent film, heavy metal and rock music, the 1980s, film making, writing, working with a married partner, the fetish and BDSM community (though it's not a pornographic film), entrepreneurship, and more! Plus, not only does Bianca Allaine star as a strong female lead, but Allaine is also the co-writer, producer, costumer, and head of public relations, marketing, and web design.  
  • Are you wanting to get involved artistically in the movie? We're open to product sponsors, costumers, makeup artists, location scouts, and others who would like to collaborate.
  • Do you run an event, group meet-up, film screening club, heavy metal/rock event, or convention? Why not invite us as guests? With her improv training and acting experience, Bianca Allaine can be a fun and lively hostess at your next live event. Together, Michael and Bianca have been guest speakers and lecturers at film workshops.

If any of this sounds good, just send us a message and we'll see what we can do! Let's pave the way in independent filmmaking and make ZOMBINATRIX  a classic movie that can be enjoyed for years to come!

IN LOVING MEMORY OF

This movie is dedicated to the memory our beautiful girls, Molly and Dixie.

"God saw you getting tired and cure was not to be, so He put His arms around you and said come with Me. With tearful eyes we watched you and saw you pass away. And although we loved you dearly, we could not make you stay. A golden heart has stopped beating and you were finally at rest. God broke our hearts to prove to us that He only takes the best."

Hello, everyone! Bianca Allaine here to honestly and openly discuss the challenges and setbacks to ZOMBINATRIX that Michael and I have had to face over the past few years. This is the part of our story that I have had trouble discussing publicly because it is highly personal and I consider myself a sensitive and private person. In fact, writing this portion has been extremely difficult and emotionally draining for me. I won't deny that trying to talk about the last few years always leaves me in tears. But, I have always felt that being completely honest with people, no matter how painful or embarrassing it may be, is of utmost importance.

First, I'd like to say that having the courage to create and show your personal art to the world can be scary and always comes with risks. Pursuing your artistic dreams can often be equally challenging and rewarding. Michael and I first began the process of creating ZOMBINATRIX in 2015. The excitement of creating our own feature length film was electric and invigorating- probably, the most exciting time of my 20 year career of working in movies.

Little did we know that during filming, personal tragedies would change the trajectory of our journey. We now know firsthand that life can change drastically in the blink of an eye.

On March 11, 2016, Michael's father passed away from a very aggressive cancer, merely 3 days after his 58th birthday, and only months after he was diagnosed. We were by his side during his fight (and, boy, was he a fighter!), doing everything we could to bring what comfort we could. He was far too ill, though, and the outcome was inevitable. Along with family, we held his hand in hospice as he passed away.

We attempted to move forward after the heartbreaking loss, but filming again came to a standstill after our beloved Shih Tzu, Molly, became increasingly ill in December 2016 and was diagnosed with Pulmonary Hypertension. Michael and I considered our dogs, Molly and Dixie, the love of our lives. We did everything in our power to save our beautiful, sweet little angel, but her disease had progressed to the point she could no longer breathe outside of an oxygen chamber. On October 27, 2017, we made the agonizing decision to finally end her suffering after having her in my life for nearly 15 years. It was the worst day of our lives.

Just as I thought things couldn't get worse, life grew even darker. Only 7 months after Molly's passing, on May 30, 2018, we lost our beautiful Shih Tzu Dixie only days after her 17th birthday to cancer.

Needless to say, after these losses, our lives were left completely shattered. The suffering I continue to endure after the loss of both Dixie and Molly have affected me in ways I had never expected. I will be forever grateful for having them as shining beacons in my life, but I will never be the same person again. I fell into an even deeper depression and began having debilitating panic attacks like I've never experienced before.

Honestly, I was hesitant to even bother with our movie, but Michael lovingly encouraged me to continue. Some days are much more difficult than others, but we remain determined to finish our dream project, ZOMBINATRIX.

Since this is an independent movie, there may be more challenges along the way. However, Michael and I are completely committed to bringing you the BEST movie possible. We know you work very hard for your money and therefore we take our work very seriously. We believe that through hard work, creative solutions to challenges, and the love and support of you all, we will finish this movie through sheer determination and will-power. Of course, it will be much easier and quicker to finish if we have you all on board!

I want to thank you so much for reading this very personal portion of our story and for believing in and supporting our dream.

Much love and light,

Bianca Allaine

story:
Thank you everyone for the amazing support and helping us exceed our target goal.

 

Keep It A Secret recounts the inspiring true story of the dawn of Irish surfing and how the sport’s brave trailblazing pioneers found peace and escape in the water during the most violent years of The Troubles conflict between The Republic of Ireland and Britain in the late 1960s and 1970s.

Thank you everyone for the generous support for the Keep It A Secret crowdfunding campaign! 

The financial support from the campaign will help final editing, music licensing costs and give us budget to shoot additional water and drone footage with renowned Irish surf and water cinematographer Kev L. Smith. Kev's amazing footage will bring to life the majestic coast of Ireland, where world-class waves were first surfed by the pioneers of Irish surfing in the 1960s when the island was a surfing paradise completely unknown to the outside world. 

 

 

About the director:

My name is Sean Duggan, I've spent much of my career working in radio/music and advertising. I've been thinking about making a film for years and five years ago I started to actively pursue and learn everything I could about filmmaking: watching more movies, reading every book I could get my hands on that relates to film, and making short films in Brooklyn.

 

About the film:

Three years ago I started to compile a list of film projects and stories which I thought would make interesting and entertaining movies. One story, I began to develop as a script was about a (fictional) California surfer who arrives in Ireland in the 1960s to bring the sport to island at the time when surfing was completely unknown and the West Coast Ireland was a remote place not yet touched by the modern world.

As I started doing some preliminary research for my script and began interviewing the Irish pioneers of surfing, many whom had never shared their stories before on film. I started to realize that the true story of how this group of trailblazing pioneers came together as the island was entering the most violent years of The Troubles conflict was an amazing story and better than any scripted film I could develop. And thus began the journey into making the documentary, Keep It A Secret. 

This film covers.

  • The story of a Dublin boy,  Kevin Cavey who would see a surfing photo in Reader's Digest at the age of 12 and make it his life's mission to bring surfing to Ireland.
  • The Troubles Conflict between Britain and The Republic of Ireland, how surfers on both sides of the conflict (Northern Ireland and The Republic of Ireland) came to find peace in the water
  • The Belfast Boys who would take a DIY approach to surfing and develop the sport on their own terms with fearlessness and creativity that was year's ahead of mainstream commercial surfing in California.
  • The Black Wetsuit Brigade a group of Irish surfers who would protest all major international surf contests and fight the commercialization of surfing in Ireland.
  • The 1972 European Surfing Championship in Lahinch, Ireland. When Ireland hosted their first major international surfing contest during the most violent year of The Troubles conflict.

 

Sneak preview:

A sneak peak of a few of the surfing pioneers who appear in the film.

Davy Govan, pioneer Irish surfer from Belfast recounts surfing in the dark at Easkey.

 

Willie Britton from Rossnowlaugh, Co. Donegal, a three time Irish National surfing champion describes locals seeing surfing for the first time in West of Ireland. #theboyiswalkingonthewater! #itsamiracle! 

 
Roger Steadman, a surf obsessed British marketing executive who would request a transfer from London to Ireland in 1966 for one reason-waves. Roger was convinced there had to be great surf in Ireland and he would discover a surfing paradise beyond his wildest imagination.  Here Roger recounts a bad wipeout and what medical treatment was like in rural Ireland in 1969,
 

 

Davy Govan describes life in Belfast in the early 1970s while he was attending Queens University, Belfast. Between 1968-1972 Belfast become a war zone during the most violent years of The Troubles conflict with daily armed checkpoints, kidnappings, shootings, and bombings.  For the Belfast Crew surfing would take on a greater meaning than just the pursuit of waves, it would mean escape for the turbulence and violence that was tearing their city and Ireland apart. #surfingfromtrouble #keepitasecretfilm

 
 
The Musgrave Twins, Damian and Derek Musgrave of Tramore, Ireland, share story of receiving their first surfboard and excitedly plunging into the frigid Winter Celtic Sea surf with NO WETSUIT. #anythingforsurfing #howcoldcanyousurf 
 

 

 

How you can help: 

 To date, this film has been 100% self-financed through frugality, DIY filmmaking and the generous work of many talented film professionals from Dublin to Los Angeles who believed in this film and either donated their talents or worked at favorable rates (all to whom I’m eternally grateful)

  • We are now nearing completion of the film, a rough cut of the film has already been completed and was screened this Fall to enthusiastic audience response.
  • We still need to polish the rough cut and hire an editor to bring film to final cut for film festival release. I did the editing of the rough cut and trailer and now it's time for me to pass the editing baton to top tier professional editor to elevate the quality as we complete the final cut of the film.
  • The funds of this campaign will also help cover post-production work (audio mix, graphics, color grading) and licensing of archive video and music. 

 

Impact:

This film tells the story of a relatively unknown time in Ireland's history. 

  • A powerful reminder of what a divided Ireland was like during the peak of The Troubles conflict between the Republic of Ireland and Britain.
  • At a time when Brexit will be going into effect January 2021, the Brexit debate and implementation is once again stoking the fears of a divided Ireland and the potential violence of The Troubles.
  • An uplifting distinctly Irish story, reminding viewers that despite differences of class, religion, nationality there are more powerful forces that can bond and bring people together. As best stated by Martin Lloyd (Belfast Surfer, Documentary Subject) who lived through 1970s Belfast bombing campaigns and violence  "In the water, there is no nationality or religion, we're all just surfers". 

 

Risks & Challenges

At this time, the film has not secured buyer or distribution.

  • Our plan is to complete the film in early 2021 for film festival screenings.

 

How you can help

If you can't make a financial contribution at this time. You can still help us by

  • Signing up for film email release info and insider updates
  • Sharing the film trailer on social media to help spread the word. 

For more info and exclusive content visit www.keepitasecretfilm.com
story_txt:
Thank you everyone for the amazing support and helping us exceed our target goal.

 
Keep It A Secret recounts the inspiring true story of the dawn of Irish surfing and how the sport’s brave trailblazing pioneers found peace and escape in the water during the most violent years of The Troubles conflict between The Republic of Ireland and Britain in the late 1960s and 1970s.
Thank you everyone for the generous support for the Keep It A Secret crowdfunding campaign! 
The financial support from the campaign will help final editing, music licensing costs and give us budget to shoot additional water and drone footage with renowned Irish surf and water cinematographer Kev L. Smith. Kev's amazing footage will bring to life the majestic coast of Ireland, where world-class waves were first surfed by the pioneers of Irish surfing in the 1960s when the island was a surfing paradise completely unknown to the outside world. 
 
 
About the director:
My name is Sean Duggan, I've spent much of my career working in radio/music and advertising. I've been thinking about making a film for years and five years ago I started to actively pursue and learn everything I could about filmmaking: watching more movies, reading every book I could get my hands on that relates to film, and making short films in Brooklyn.

 
About the film:
Three years ago I started to compile a list of film projects and stories which I thought would make interesting and entertaining movies. One story, I began to develop as a script was about a (fictional) California surfer who arrives in Ireland in the 1960s to bring the sport to island at the time when surfing was completely unknown and the West Coast Ireland was a remote place not yet touched by the modern world.
As I started doing some preliminary research for my script and began interviewing the Irish pioneers of surfing, many whom had never shared their stories before on film. I started to realize that the true story of how this group of trailblazing pioneers came together as the island was entering the most violent years of The Troubles conflict was an amazing story and better than any scripted film I could develop. And thus began the journey into making the documentary, Keep It A Secret. 
This film covers.

The story of a Dublin boy,  Kevin Cavey who would see a surfing photo in Reader's Digest at the age of 12 and make it his life's mission to bring surfing to Ireland.
The Troubles Conflict between Britain and The Republic of Ireland, how surfers on both sides of the conflict (Northern Ireland and The Republic of Ireland) came to find peace in the water
The Belfast Boys who would take a DIY approach to surfing and develop the sport on their own terms with fearlessness and creativity that was year's ahead of mainstream commercial surfing in California.
The Black Wetsuit Brigade a group of Irish surfers who would protest all major international surf contests and fight the commercialization of surfing in Ireland.
The 1972 European Surfing Championship in Lahinch, Ireland. When Ireland hosted their first major international surfing contest during the most violent year of The Troubles conflict.

 
Sneak preview:
A sneak peak of a few of the surfing pioneers who appear in the film.
Davy Govan, pioneer Irish surfer from Belfast recounts surfing in the dark at Easkey.

 

Willie Britton from Rossnowlaugh, Co. Donegal, a three time Irish National surfing champion describes locals seeing surfing for the first time in West of Ireland. #theboyiswalkingonthewater! #itsamiracle! 


 
Roger Steadman, a surf obsessed British marketing executive who would request a transfer from London to Ireland in 1966 for one reason-waves. Roger was convinced there had to be great surf in Ireland and he would discover a surfing paradise beyond his wildest imagination.  Here Roger recounts a bad wipeout and what medical treatment was like in rural Ireland in 1969,
 


 


Davy Govan describes life in Belfast in the early 1970s while he was attending Queens University, Belfast. Between 1968-1972 Belfast become a war zone during the most violent years of The Troubles conflict with daily armed checkpoints, kidnappings, shootings, and bombings.  For the Belfast Crew surfing would take on a greater meaning than just the pursuit of waves, it would mean escape for the turbulence and violence that was tearing their city and Ireland apart. #surfingfromtrouble #keepitasecretfilm


 
 
The Musgrave Twins, Damian and Derek Musgrave of Tramore, Ireland, share story of receiving their first surfboard and excitedly plunging into the frigid Winter Celtic Sea surf with NO WETSUIT. #anythingforsurfing #howcoldcanyousurf 
 


 
 


How you can help: 
 To date, this film has been 100% self-financed through frugality, DIY filmmaking and the generous work of many talented film professionals from Dublin to Los Angeles who believed in this film and either donated their talents or worked at favorable rates (all to whom I’m eternally grateful)

We are now nearing completion of the film, a rough cut of the film has already been completed and was screened this Fall to enthusiastic audience response.
We still need to polish the rough cut and hire an editor to bring film to final cut for film festival release. I did the editing of the rough cut and trailer and now it's time for me to pass the editing baton to top tier professional editor to elevate the quality as we complete the final cut of the film.
The funds of this campaign will also help cover post-production work (audio mix, graphics, color grading) and licensing of archive video and music. 


 
Impact:
This film tells the story of a relatively unknown time in Ireland's history. 

A powerful reminder of what a divided Ireland was like during the peak of The Troubles conflict between the Republic of Ireland and Britain.
At a time when Brexit will be going into effect January 2021, the Brexit debate and implementation is once again stoking the fears of a divided Ireland and the potential violence of The Troubles.
An uplifting distinctly Irish story, reminding viewers that despite differences of class, religion, nationality there are more powerful forces that can bond and bring people together. As best stated by Martin Lloyd (Belfast Surfer, Documentary Subject) who lived through 1970s Belfast bombing campaigns and violence  "In the water, there is no nationality or religion, we're all just surfers". 


 
Risks & Challenges
At this time, the film has not secured buyer or distribution.
Our plan is to complete the film in early 2021 for film festival screenings.

 
How you can help
If you can't make a financial contribution at this time. You can still help us by

Signing up for film email release info and insider updates
Sharing the film trailer on social media to help spread the word. 

For more info and exclusive content visit www.keepitasecretfilm.com

story:
A Not So Typical Love Story:

"Desperate times, Desperate measures"

A line from the script that defines the whole story of "Goin' Up". The film is about a young man who joins a team of criminals to steal money so he can reunite with the love of his life on a wealthy colonized station on the moon.

The concept for the story stayed in my head rent free since late 2019. I knew I wanted to do a story set in the near future, involving the moon and a love story in the middle of all of it, but I didn't know exactly. Then the year 2020 happened and I was able to fully form the script we have now.

On the Surface, the film is high octane Sci-Fi Crime Thriller set in an alternative near future (Within the next 10 years or so) where the Earth is in a state of collapse, but it really serves as a backdrop a few things: the lengths you can go for someone you love, how people can use societal movements or situations for their own gain and the metaphor of using space colonization to escape our problems rather than facing capitalism head on.

I pull influences from the films I love and inspire me to be the filmmaker I am.  Taking influence from “Good Time”, “Elysium”, “If Beale Street Could Talk” and “Clockers”. 

The film is designed to be a thriller packed with colorful characters, dynamic/odd camera techniques and a unique use of combining genres that do not typically go together. The story is a nonlinear one, taking place within a few hours and you see fragments of his past with his Girlfriend. As the story takes place from the main character's perspective, you feel his sense of anxiety and suspicion.

The Budget:

Our budget goal is $35,000. Here is where that budget will go:

-$9,000 for Crew

-$8,000 for Location and Set Design

-$8,000 for Wardrobe, Props, Makeup and Wardrobe

-$6,000 for Equipment

-$2,000 for Insurance

-$2,000 for Craft Services

Pre-Production:

With the help of talented Bay Area artists, Marcus Lopez and Vanessa Vargas, we were able to create very detailed storyboards and concept  art to help us bring the vision of the film to life.  A vision that will soon be put to screen.

Here is a sample from the films Mood Board. A mood board is meant to help everyone be on the same page in terms of understanding the films tone and overall visual style that will be put on display for the entire runtime. 

The Crew:

-Director/ Writer/Editor: Alec Douglas

-Producer: Latoya Hawkins

-Executive Producer: George Almanza

-Director of Photography/VFX: Joshua Martinez

-Original Score: Bill Snyder III

-Assistant Editor: Daniel Ellsworth

-Production/Post Production Sound: Nick Lovato, Jessica Chew, Emerald Tanaka

-Costume Design: Gabriella "Gabby" Pena

-BTS Photography:Joey Martinez

-BTS Videographers: Jamal Davis, Jonathan Garcia

-Storyboard Artist: Marcus Lopez

-Concept Artist: Vanessa Vargas 

*The list continues to grow*

THE CAST:

Tyson Brown as Marcus Jordan: 

A 22 year old who comes from a hard upbringing but still means well in a world that challenges his morals and insecurities. As society on Earth begins to collapse, Marcus finds out that his wealthy girlfriend,  Abigail, and her family have been selected to go up to the colonized moon, elevating his fear of losing her and leading to an argument that puts their relationship on “break”. Marcus, desperate to recapture the love he let go because of his selfishness, takes an offer from a friend to rob a bank in order to gain the money needed to get smuggled to the moon.

 Abby Tozer as Abigail "Abby" Francis

A 21 year who comes from an upper class family. With her parents coming in and out of the house because of work, Abby developed a sense of independence and responsibility to take care of her two younger sisters. She meets Marcus through a chance encounter and falls in love with him despite his non wealthy background. When she discovers that her family has been chosen to be transported to the moon, she tells Marcus and sees he is upset at the idea of her leaving. After an argument, Abby decides she must do what’s best for her family, promising Marcus that even though they are on “break”, she still loves him.

Ian S. Peterson as Jackson

The handsome leader of the heist whose intentions are not as clear as they seem. 

Romeo Abasolo as Caesar Navarro

Marcus’s close friend who also comes from a low income household. After a successful series of robberies, Caesar invites  Marcus into a new heist that would allow him to gain enough money to get to the colonized moon.

Natalia Dominguez as Franceska "Frankie" Robins

A young woman who is in a relationship with her girlfriend, Millie. After some bad decisions, Millie gets arrested and Frankie joins the heist to get the money needed to get her out of jail and move far away.

Ray Raymundo as Zack Reyes

A naive former football player who’s looking to gain some money for an injury to his knee that put his career on indefinite hold.

Art Brown as Norman Fisher

A wealthy man who owns the building the group robs.

The Impact

Films have always had a big impact on me as you can not only find entertainment in them, but they can open up your eyes to aspects of life you weren't aware of or remind you not to make the same mistakes of the past. Over this last year, I feel like my approach to filmmaking has changed significantly. Portraying realistic depictions of the region I was born and raised in felt important to me as there is so much culture under our beautiful California sun. Seeing films such as "The Last Black Man in San Francisco", "Blindspotting" and "Fruitvale Station" showed just how much we have to offer. 

We have many talented artists from all walks of life coming together to work on this film, all with the potential to go far in our careers. With your support,  we could bring a vision to life that we're all so passionate about. 

Risks & Challenges

There will always be risks and challenges to making a film of any size. The usual risks of weather, loss of cast, crew and location that could cause delays. Of course now we have the new challenge of Covid and potential lockdown scenarios. As a crew, we are ambitious and crazy enough to take on every challenge that comes our way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you were to support us in other ways, please spread the word about the project! 

Share our IndieGoGo page, email your friends and family, post about us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc. You never know who might be looking.

We truly appreciate any support to achieve our goal.

story:
Friends and family,

Appreciate you for opening the link! As some of you may know, I gave up my D1 football graduate scholarship at the University of Central to pursue a passion for film.  I also got into a top 5 film school at The University of Southern California. I plan on dedicating my life to learning about the craft, telling stories that inspire, and eventually getting my Master's of Fine Arts.

I'm super excited about this upcoming experience, but I'm even MORE EXCITED about the project I'm directing in October. I wrote a script that I'm very passionate about, I'm collaborating with an awesome/very skilled crew from up and down the east coast, and I'm also working with some really compelling actors. 

With your help, I can give my craft some identity before I head off to school. Your donation will go to securing locations and equipment, Covid 19 protocols, craft services/meals, and housing arrangements.

 

Some incentives:

$50 for a major thanks in the film.

$100 for an associate producer credit in the film.

$750 for an executive producer credit in the film and a Saaintuary hoodie by designer Saaint. 

 

The cast and crew would be very appreciative of anything you could give, but I'm just glad you read this far. I love you and thank you much for supporting my dreams. I promise to pay it forward.

story:
We have now gone INDEMAND so people who couldn't contribute during the initial 40 day run can now help support the upcoming production of the film by securing some exclusive perks only available in this campaign! Although the pandemic really threw the production off track the film officially wrapped production on Oct 17, 2021 and is currently in post production.

Happy Halloween! I’m Justin the director of the 80s monster/slasher throwback horror film THE BARN...an adult Goosebumps with boobs and blood! First off, I want to thank you for helping me successfully finish THE BARN by donating to my crowd funding campaign right here on Indiegogo. You made a dream come true for me and now is your chance to be a part of the next chapter of my Halloween tale.

You might recall my story about how I wrote THE BARN in 1993 when I was 8 years old and then with the help of a lot of dedicated people, 22 years later that idea became a reality. Since then the film has screened across the globe and brought back multiple awards. The horror community has embraced the film with such love that it validated all the troubles we went thru to create this Halloween bad boy. After running a successful crowd funding campaign for The Barn, I soon realized how important and great it is to help fellow artists make their dreams come true too. Since then I have supported over 30 projects on Indiegogo, Kickstarter, GoFund Me and other platforms.

What Is This Campaign About?

Well it never fails, after every Q&A or convention I attend I get the same question - "So when is the sequel happening???"

The answer…As soon as I raise the funds. That’s right, I am here today calling on your help to make The Barn Part II. What many people don’t know is that I wrote the sequel when I was 10 and it was called THE BARN PART II: ZOMBIE RAILROAD.

What’s the film about? Well without ruining the story completely here are some details:

  1. The surviving cast is returning including Linnea Quigley and Ari Lehman.
  2. It’s a continuation of the first film and takes place in the early 1990s.
  3. It will of course be a Halloween film.
  4. It will be based off the original Part II story as well as the updated content of the first film.
  5. And perhaps it contains zombies to some degree…perhaps.

There are many questions that went unanswered in PART 1: What happens to Sam and Josh and Michelle, does Ms. Barnhart stay true to her word to ban Halloween in Helen’s Valley, and what was up with The Boogeyman’s helmet having the name DANIELS written on it (ya know our hero Sam’s last name)? Well to be honest the original film was written to setup the story arc in the event of a sequel and keep an authentic flow. I want this next film to have the same fun schlocky charm as the first, but with more monsters, more kills, more Halloween!

How Will The Funds Be Used?

Funds would go to actors, crew, meals, upgrading equipment, rentals, set designs, costumes, SFX, VFX, Sound mixing, music, key art (a new poster from Sadist Art Designs), marketing of the film, perk fulfillment costs and shipping expenses plus platform fees and much much more.

Perks

You will see we are offering some really cool perks and screen used props from the first film, plus you will also now have the chance to actually be in the movie or better yet being killed on screen by Linnea Quigley or Ari Lehman.

With your help, I can make this sequel a reality. The first film took me places I never imaged I would have the opportunity to go and I sincerely thank you all for that. With your continued support I know I can deliver another fun and entertaining Halloween adventure.

If you’re unable to donate money to our campaign, all I ask is you share this info with others so they can be aware of it and hopefully back it.

Thanks for checking out the campaign. Please share this fund raiser https://igg.me/at/thebarnpart2 when possible and LIKE our Facebook page www.facebook.com/TheBarnMovie

 

Much Love and Happy Halloween!

JMS
