It will be based off the original Part II story as well as the updated content of the first film.
And perhaps it contains zombies to some degree…perhaps.
There are many questions that went unanswered in PART 1: What happens to Sam and Josh and Michelle, does Ms. Barnhart stay true to her word to ban Halloween in Helen’s Valley, and what was up with The Boogeyman’s helmet having the name DANIELS written on it (ya know our hero Sam’s last name)? Well to be honest the original film was written to setup the story arc in the event of a sequel and keep an authentic flow. I want this next film to have the same fun schlocky charm as the first, but with more monsters, more kills, more Halloween!How Will The Funds Be Used?Funds would go to actors, crew, meals, upgrading equipment, rentals, set designs, costumes, SFX, VFX, Sound mixing, music, key art (a new poster from Sadist Art Designs), marketing of the film, perk fulfillment costs and shipping expenses plus platform fees and much much more.PerksYou will see we are offering some really cool perks and screen used props from the first film, plus you will also now have the chance to actually be in the movie or better yet being killed on screen by Linnea Quigley or Ari Lehman.With your help, I can make this sequel a reality. The first film took me places I never imaged I would have the opportunity to go and I sincerely thank you all for that. With your continued support I know I can deliver another fun and entertaining Halloween adventure.If you’re unable to donate money to our campaign, all I ask is you share this info with others so they can be aware of it and hopefully back it.Thanks for checking out the campaign. Please share this fund raiser https://igg.me/at/thebarnpart2 when possible and LIKE our Facebook page www.facebook.com/TheBarnMovie Much Love and Happy Halloween!JMS

story:
YOU CAN STILL BE A PART OF THIS GLOBAL BEATLES FAN ADVENTURE! 

NOW IN POST-PRODUCTION - RELEASE SPRING 2022.

We've surpassed our initial fundraising goal!  So we’re now planning additional shoots with some more wonderful Beatle people (follow this page for updates). You can still contribute to the project, claim rewards and be included in the credits amongst our backers, with every contribution helping us bring more Beatles fan stories and music to the film. 

To that end, and inspired by all the fans who have joined us, we’re in the process of creating a new online space for our Indiegogo backers to share video and audio clips about their love for The Beatles. These can be anything from personal stories about how The Beatles have impacted our lives, a chance to perform a song, or simply reflect on something about them which speaks to you. You can show your memorabilia collection, share your artwork, perhaps read a poem you’ve written. Anything that floats your yellow submarine! This space will be open to all backers of Here, There & Everywhere at any level of contribution, and we’ll be emailing you soon with details on how to add your submission to the site.  

Here, There & Everywhere includes a kaleidoscope of stories and performances from musicians, authors, artists, experts, collectors and friends and family of The Beatles. From fans who were there at the very beginning to teenagers who are discovering them anew in the 21st century, Here, There & Everywhere is the ultimate fan family album; an opportunity for The Beatles family to come together and deliver a love letter to the greatest band of all time. 

With hundreds of hours of material to work from, we're creating a downloadable version of the film, DVDs, Blu-rays and a host of unique perks for our backers, which you can still pre-order and claim during this InDemand phase on Indiegogo. We will be keeping backers informed with updates as the edit progresses whilst we secure distribution for the film around the world.

HEAR WHAT SOME OF OUR BEATLE FRIENDS ARE SAYING

ABOUT HERE, THERE & EVERYWHERE

WATCH MORE CLIPS FROM HERE, THERE & EVERYWHERE

​Here, There & Everywhere was created by me, Simon Weitzman, a network TV director and author. After working on a series of Beatles books I decided I wanted to make a film about the extraordinary fan family that adopted me on my travels to events and festivals. I've been joined on this adventure by a fantastic video editor, Andy Lee, who is also a lifelong Beatles fan.

Our mission  is to create a celebratory film for every Beatles fan on the planet, across the universe and beyond! Thousands of fans have followed the project's evolution at festivals and on social media, and now it's finally about to become a reality, thanks to everyone’s support for our campaign.

We've created perks which are rewards we're offering to backers in return for contributing to help us complete the Here, There & Everywhere. Have a look through and select something you like from just £5. Each contribution will help towards additional filming and ongoing post production costs. Everyone who claims a physical perk will have their name listed amongst our backers at the end of the film. Any contribution also entitles you to submit the name of a loved one or loved one dear to you that you may have lost over the years. We want to enable you to honour them. To find out more contact info@beatlesdoc.com 

Here, There & Everywhere is all about the global love for The Beatles and we are delighted to be able to share this film with you and the world! 

Thanks for all your wonderful support.

Simon

THE PERKS FOR OUR BACKERS

'Here, There & Everywhere' Soundtrack CD

Here, There & Everywhere is full of wonderful renditions of Beatles songs by performers from teenagers to octogenarians. Some are uncannily faithful to the originals whereas others go in different directions to reimagine the music. All the numbers on this soundtrack CD are passionate and beautiful tributes to the act we've known for all these years. Includes The Quarrymen, Monalisa Twins, Chris McCarty, The Cavern Club Beatles, Dea Matrona, Estef Lennon and many, many more!

Strawberry Field Gold Pass

Strawberry Field in Liverpool have very kindly put forward one of their gold memberships to help us reach our target. Gold membership gives the donor discounts on site and invitations for Strawberry Field events. You'll see lots more about Strawberry Field, the creation of the new venue and performances by The Quarrymen in our film. It's a magical place! Click to learn more about Strawberry Field

Angie McCartney signed books and personal zoom call

The wonderful Angie McCartney, Paul's step-mother, has donated 3 of her signed books (2 pre-signed and 1 new signed), her trademark tea, a signed photo and a 30 minute private 1-2-1 zoom call with her and daughter, Ruth, during which you can ask them anything you like! The 3 books are Your Mother Should Know, The Long & Winding Road and Here, There & Everywhere, the tour book. A truly fab experience.

The Beatles handwritten quotations from 1964

The Beatles were asked to do a lot of things while in the United States because of their short time there during their summer tours and they were even asked to write quotations instantaneously. This is a sheet with handwritten quotations by all four members of The Beatles which was used for excerpts either for an interview, news, or magazine publication.​

Ringo - It was in the film that we saw two heroes 

George - That's the trouble with good old Harry - isn't it! 

John - Thorg hilly grove and burly Ive Deaf Ted Danuta and me! 

Paul - New York policemen are studying a dart gun

This piece is from the collection of Tom Fontaine, who has given us permission to make a limited edition of 75 numbered prints to offer to our backers. Each one is a facsimile of the original with folds and tears in place and mounted on high quality art board. (12 x 10.5")

The John Lennon Series books

Jude Kessler, author of the nine volume John Lennon Series is donating a signed and dated copy of each book in the series (apart from Shivering Inside, Vol. 2 e-book). The series is an expanded biography which covers John's life from 1940-1980. 5 volumes are available for immediate shipment. The other 4 volumes will be shipped as they are printed.

Concept drawing by Andrew Edwards

This is the preliminary concept sketch by Andrew Edwards, who created the famous statues of The Beatles on Liverpool's waterfront. Andrew will individually sign a limited edition of 100 prints, 18"x 13.5" inches with card mount. This is the first time the sketch has been published since Andrew drew it.

'Here, There & Everywhere'

Portfolio Print Set

We've created this high quality print set especially for the Indiegogo fundraising campaign, this set will be serially numbered, strictly limited to however many are pledged for during this campaign. Your name and address will be printed on the portfolio, designed to resemble the Beatles 1967 Xmas record envelope on high quality board, safely mailed to you in a separate cover.​ Includes a never-before-seen image of "Blackbird" by Mal Evans from his 1968 diary, previously unpublished Yellow Submarine photos of John, Paul, George and Ringo and Andrew Edwards's concept drawing for The Beatles waterfront statues in Liverpool, also never published before and more! (see below)

Inside the Portfolio will be ten 9”x12” prints on 350 gsm art board of images donated by artists and collectors who are featured in the film.

'Coming Apart' by Tom Murray (Artist's Proof)

In the early summer of 1968, The Beatles took a break from recording the White Album to spend a day shooting new publicity images around London, in what became known as the ‘Mad Day Out’.​

Tom Murray, who was 25 at the time, is now a famous award-winning photographer whose work has appeared in many leading magazines. He says the shoot “was the perfect assignment and a day to remember”.​

This C-Type photographic print is the one-of-a-kind artist's proof (20" x 24" from a subsequent edition of 185), hand signed by Tom above his embossed stamp. 

'George gets busted' by James Wilkinson

James Wilkinson’s ‘George gets busted’. In 1969 George was arrested for possessing cannabis resin; this facsimile artwork of the charge sheet and photo was created to capture an infamous moment in time. Complete with recreated tears in the paper to fully imitate the original, this is number 1 of a limited edition of 5 (16" x 22.5" plus frame).

John Lennon's Five Obscenities

In 1977 journalist Jimmy Smith asked Lennon to write the five most obscene things he could think of. Artist, James Wilkinson has created a limited edition print of his drawing of John with glasses formed from a mic cable used to record 'Imagine' (this print of the artwork is number 1 of 40) . Mounted on art board  (22" x 15.5" plus mount) 

'Wired' by James Wilkinson

A beautiful limited edition print by renowned V-Festival artist James Wilkinson (this one is number 2 of 6). The print, titled 'Wired', is glass framed with an authenticated mic cable used during the recording of ‘Imagine’ at John & Yoko’s home studio in Tittenhurst Park, 1971. Comes with full documentation from the artist. (32.5" x 25.5" x 2")

 

Original maquette by Andrew Edwards

For our campaign, Andrew he has donated the original maquette he produced prior to working on the full size sculptures. The plan was to include Brian with the four lads, as in this maquette, but later the idea was shelved in favour of just John, Paul, George and Ringo. (Bronze resin, 18" on wooden plinth).

 

Three drawings of John by Helen Anderson

Artist Helen Anderson was a close friend of John Lennon's from their time at art school onwards. These three limited edition prints are of drawings she made of John in '58 & '59. They also come with a personalised hand written note to the backer who buys them thanking you for helping us complete the film. Edition numbers are 18/100, 13/100 & 15/100

The Beatles 1967 Christmas record

given by Paul to Mal Evans

In 1967 Paul McCartney gave Mal Evans, roadie and personal assistant to The Beatles, five copies of their Christmas single, featuring Mal himself goofing with the four lads. Mal's son, Gary, who is in our film, has donated one of the records to our campaign. In original unopened mailer with no address or postage marks. A copy in this pristine condition is extremely rare and no collectors we’ve spoken to have seen one before. The provenance only adds to this items uniqueness and it comes with a letter of authentication written and signed by Gary Evans.

'The Mad Day Out', 1st edition, signed and hand noted by Tom Murray

Tom Murray’s original edition of the book of his 'Mad Day Out' Beatles photos. This 1st edition is completely sold out and is one of only a few remaining copies owned by Tom, who has signed and hand noted it to donate to our crowdfunding campaign. It's a real gem and rarity!

All You Need Is Love - 1st edition, signed book

All You Need Is Love is the definitive photographic journey through The Beatles iconic performance on June 25, 1967 for 'Our World'. This is my personal copy of the sold out 1st edition, signed with slipcase. Written by Simon Weitzman, designed by Paul Skellett. I'll also add a dedication thanking the backer who opts for this perk.

Eight Arms to Hold You - signed 1st Edition

This is my personal signed copy of 'Eight Arms To Hold You', the book I produced about the making of Help! Richard Lester, the legendary director of Help! lent his assistance in releasing parts of his private collection including his hand notated script. With rare and never before published photos, this original edition is completely sold out.

Stay tuned, subscribe for updates and please spread the word far and wide amongst your Beatles friends and family!

The "Here, There & Everywhere" film is an independent production and is not associated with Apple Corps Ltd, nor is it attempting to pass itself off as an official Beatles product. It is a production made by fans for fans.

story:
Short Summary

The Sunny Side is an observational documentary following the life of Alfred Engerer, a Toronto native and legendary glass-blower who lives in a slow, nostalgia-filled world, and invites the audience to reminisce through his musings. Alfred spends his time surrounding himself with art, music, and other things that inspire him, including sharing his work with young creatives. Despite achieving acclaimed status for his work, in the late 2010s, Alfred was evicted, along with other artists, from his studio of 20 years at 442 Dufferin. His space was demolished to make way for condo development, and Alfred has not found a studio space since, due to the absurdly high costs of living in Toronto. Alfred’s work is kept in storage and around his home, although the majority of his public installations have been destroyed. The studio’s destruction took a toll on his self-esteem and artistic endeavours, but ultimately he decided to embrace the odds and keep humble. While his artistic output is important, the film will act as a character study of a truly unique man by focusing on Alfred’s persona and lifestyle.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise funds to help us tell this incredible story.

All contributors will receive:

- Personal thank you

$10+ donations:

-High-quality digital pack of stills from the film - great to print and frame or have as a wallpaper for a device

$20+ donations:

- Ticket to advance remote screening OR a digital copy of the doc

$40+ donations:

-Your name in the film credits

$50+ donations:

-Exclusive behind-the-scenes footage and deleted scenes

$100+ donations:

-Set of high-quality digital art prints including artwork by Alfred Engerer and Sam Kilpatrick 

$200+ donations:

-Executive Producer Credit

If we raise enough to rent the hot shop studio, top-tier donors may be able to receive a piece of blown glass artwork made during the production of this documentary (TBC)

Primarily, the film will serve as an observation of an old soul and reveal that no matter the circumstances, we must stay true to ourselves and look on the bright side. This story is not an average artist biopic, but rather a tale of how a man who lost everything was able to come through to the other side. Alfred’s story is one that is needed now more than ever. The City of Toronto’s diminishing support for independent artists and working class citizens, not only affected Alfred but thousands of others. Sharing Alfred’s story not only sheds light on an unfortunate situation but offers a positive reflection for the next generation to take away from.

Risks & Challenges

Renting studio space where we can capture Alfred working on blown glass artwork could prove to be difficult due to pandemic restrictions, given that glassblowing involves shared tools that go in the mouth and close proximity to instructors. While this issue is proving to become less and less concerning with pandemic restrictions opening up, it is still a possibility. On another note, rental fees for glass studios are incredibly expensive, so your help is needed now more than ever. 

 

We would also like to capture footage for either b-roll or a walking interview of places where his work is publicly on display, however, depending on the locations there may be permits and insurance which will need to be paid for. Since this is the element which holds the largest temporal value in the film, paying for location permits is something that needs to be accounted for and funded.

story:
Official Trailer:

 

“Daylight Again” is a drama-thriller directed by Cullen McFater, founder of Postromo Pictures. His debut feature film follows Maggie, who seems to be in trouble with everyone - Her mother, her friends, and the law. However, when her luck runs out and she has nowhere to go, Peter, a former lover from years ago re-enters her life with an offer to save her. Upon accepting his offer, Maggie comes to learn that Peter's motive isn't rooted in kindness - and now she must figure out an escape before it's too late.

From the director: "Filmmaking is an incredibly time-consuming process with an abundance of costs that quickly add up. This fantastic team and I have completed the production of this film and now need your support funding the elements of filmmaking that are often overlooked and, most importantly, ones that can make or break the success of a project. Creating a successful film is not as easy as getting a camera and a group of friends together. The more eyes that see this film, the greater potential for success we have. The end goal for Daylight Again is to get as many eyes on it as possible - be it through the festival circuit, distribution, or other avenues.

Getting the film shot was my number one priority so that our hard work would make it to the screen no matter what. The funds raised through this campaign will be able to provide additional resources that will make this picture even better. Your support will provide an overall higher quality product as we focus on putting value into the important elements of post-production. 

Daylight Again not only had a phenomenal group of people working on it for months, but also the incredibly generous support from local businesses and locations without whom the film could not have been made."

 

Filming for Daylight Again took place over 34 days at multiple locations throughout Ontario. Collectively, we have pulled together resources and funds to fully produce the film. The additional funds collected through crowdfunding will go towards costs that will put this film in the forefront and give it the visibility it needs to succeed.

Your investment will go towards items such as:

  • Post-Production Costs:
    • Funding for a professional composer
    • Sound editing/sound mixing costs
  • Premiere venue fees (all donors will be invited to join us for our premiere of the film in December)
  • Festival submission fees
  • Publicity and marketing fees
  • Additional miscellaneous costs included in film distribution (music licensing, etc.)
  • Crowdfunding fees/Indiegogo processing fees.

 Additional funds raised above our initial goal will go towards additional labor fees to fairly compensate our cast and crew for all of the work they put in, and further publicity for the film.

 

Cast

  • Maggie - Rio Sousa
  • Peter - Devin Bell
  • Hector - Michael Pearson
  • Sammy - Scott Hossack
  • Mother - Erica Wood
  • Additional Cast - Andrew Castonguay, Catherine Clayson, Susan Collins, Victoria Lenhardt, Nathen Matthew, Ralph Perl, Jessica Perl, Laura Popa

Crew

  • Director/Executive Producer - Cullen McFater
  • Executive Producer - Alexxa Newman
  • Assistant Director - Adam Tucciarone
  • Location Sound - Evan Hoffman
  • Key Grip - Ethan Eng
  • Special Makeup Effects - Kati Atkinson
  • BTS/Stills Photography - Laura Clayson
  • Grip - Cameron Vrckovnik
  • Grip - Andrew Michalko
  • Production Assistant - Julia Tomasi
  • Production Assistant - Nigel Kennedy
  • Composer - Katharine Petkovski

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to give financially at this time, but there are other ways to support our campaign that will be just as helpful! Please share this site or any other currently published Daylight Again content with anyone who would be interested in donating or learning more about our project.
story_txt:
Official Trailer: “Daylight Again” is a drama-thriller directed by Cullen McFater, founder of Postromo Pictures. His debut feature film follows Maggie, who seems to be in trouble with everyone - Her mother, her friends, and the law. However, when her luck runs out and she has nowhere to go, Peter, a former lover from years ago re-enters her life with an offer to save her. Upon accepting his offer, Maggie comes to learn that Peter's motive isn't rooted in kindness - and now she must figure out an escape before it's too late.From the director: "Filmmaking is an incredibly time-consuming process with an abundance of costs that quickly add up. This fantastic team and I have completed the production of this film and now need your support funding the elements of filmmaking that are often overlooked and, most importantly, ones that can make or break the success of a project. Creating a successful film is not as easy as getting a camera and a group of friends together. The more eyes that see this film, the greater potential for success we have. The end goal for Daylight Again is to get as many eyes on it as possible - be it through the festival circuit, distribution, or other avenues.Getting the film shot was my number one priority so that our hard work would make it to the screen no matter what. The funds raised through this campaign will be able to provide additional resources that will make this picture even better. Your support will provide an overall higher quality product as we focus on putting value into the important elements of post-production. Daylight Again not only had a phenomenal group of people working on it for months, but also the incredibly generous support from local businesses and locations without whom the film could not have been made." Filming for Daylight Again took place over 34 days at multiple locations throughout Ontario. story:
Hey Chainsaw Fans! Welcome to The Sawyer Massacre final pre production Indiegogo campaign.  We have raised more than 20K towards our budget and now we need your help to get that final push to bring the CHAINSAW back to TEXAS! The Sawyer Massacre is a feature length fan film and unofficial prequel to the iconic horror film, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre. 

 

 

 

 

 

Because it's not only iconic but it's scary as hell!

The Texas Chainsaw Massacre is the film that inspired director, Steve Merlo to become a filmmaker! It's also the first film to truly give him nightmares. It's just simply the most realistic horror film ever made and there are moments where you actually forget that it's just a film. It's incredibly inspiring how subtle the filmmakers were  able to display such strong messages and themes on the state of the social climate of that time period. In no way could that be duplicated but our script has small reflections of many similar themes happening today, paralleled with the social issues of the mid 60's, which is when our film takes place.

It is our intent not to copy what the original did, but use it as influence in a stylistic way. Our film will have more blood and kills but will still be very subtle in it's delivery. 

 

Our goal for the campaign is to raise $12,500 CAD (Approx $10,000 USD) towards our production budget. The money we raise will go into financing this film at the best possible level. The more money we raise, the more professional it will be. No profit will be made off of distribution of this film and none of the money raised will go into any other film projects. All funds received will go directly into this project only! The money raised will go into the pre-production, production and post production stages which include,

Distributing all perks

Location fees

Prop rentals

Equipment rentals

Insurance

Cast and Crew

Permits

Accommodations for cast and crew

Craft services

Editing & Foley/ADR

 

If we succeed in raising our 12.5K to film in Texas, we have a stretch goals to make our film even better! The more we raise, the better this film can be!

Stretch Goal #1 - MORE SFX: If we reach a goal of $25,000 CAD ($20,000 USD Approx)we'll be able to make it much bloodier and have way cooler FX done by our awesome SFX artist, Stephanie Escamilla.

Stretch Goal #2 - MORE SHOOTING DAYS: If we reach a goal of $37,000 CAD ($30,000 USD Approx) we'll be able to extend the shooting dates by 5 days giving us more flexibility to capture greater shots and better acting performances.

Stretch Goal #3 - HIGH END POST PRODUCTION: If we reach a goal of 49,000 CAD ($40,000 USD Approx) we'll be able to hire a great post production team to help bring this film to life. 

 

Jordan O’Neal is a Houston native actor and graduate from the University of Texas. After college he dove head-first into acting professionally and created his own mini series "Fabletown". He's excited to bring Jimmy to life in a horror script that "lets its characters grow beyond just being monster-fodder."

Scotty Parkin is a Canadian theater actor with more than 20 years of experience. He made the leap into film with our Indiegogo trailer. At 6 feet 7 inches, he has the height and mass to play the iconic killer. Playing this role has been a dream of his for a long time and we know he will KILL IT just like he did in our trailer.

 

Nika Louw is a young theater actor that is making her way into film. She impressed us so much with her performance in our trailer that we knew she was right for the character of Alison. This girl can give an intense performance!

Alicia Jade is a young aspiring actress from Alabama that strives for more knowledge and success in the movie industry. She is very creative and dedicated any project thrown her way. Her audition made it very clear that she was right for the role of Loraine.

 

John Tague is a well accomplished film and TV actor and been in such recent productions as American Horror Story 1984, Lucifer, Why Not Choose Love: A Mary Pickford Manifesto, and The Blacklist. We know that he will make a great younger version of the character Jim Siedow made famous!

Michael Vincent Berry is a Texas-born actor who is best known for his work in Sony/Amazon's Them: Covenant, Netflix's The Irishmen Activation, and the Emmy and Cannes Golden Lion winning SXS Westworld. As Rex, he will bring his "Unhinged" persona to the mysterious character.

 

Bryley Michael Bell is an Actor Known for; Aberdeen, 11:11, Z Dead End, Friday The 13th Vengeance Part 2: Bloodlines, The Boy in The Tiny House and The Monster Who Lived Next Door, Cross Hollow, and more. He started officially Acting when he was roughly 15 years old. Bryley gave up his 11 Year old Baseball career, to follow in the footsteps of 'The Actors Life'. He was a Pitcher for many years, and it forever is one of his favorite played sports.

 

 

Jenny De La Fuente showed interest in the Performing Arts at a very young age and has since dedicated her time to perfecting her craft. She graduated from The University of Texas at Austin where she focused on acting and was involved in numerous theater productions such as Lindsay from Some Girls, Joyce from The Sparrow and Angelica from Push Up. She is excited to be playing Mary-Ellen in our film.

Patrick Lescarbeau has been acting since age 9 in theaters in New York, Vermont, and Texas. He recently made his crossover to film in 2015 with the short "Rare Model". Since the he has acted in film in Texas, California, New Mexico, and Tennessee.  Patrick is playing loving father and husband "Henry" in our film.

 

Lexi Graves is an 12 year old actress/singer/dancer/model, all around performer, that has decided to focus on her talent in film This little lady has big dreams and a lot of talent! Lexi has a love for comedy but secretly, her passion is horror and her goal is to be a Big Screen Scream Queen.

Trish Powell will be playing the role of Dixie in The Sawyer Massacre. She has appeared in various Feature Films, Short Films, TV Series, and VO Projects. Trish feels that her greatest moments are when she has moved audiences by “Bringing a Character Role to Life”….....contributing to making the Film Executives VISION a REALITY!

 

Josh Skurnik is an actor known for the TV Series Dead of Night (2019) and the short film Glossolalia (2019). He went into acting after a decade-long career as a television reporter at stations and networks across North America. Josh is based in Austin, TX and owns a production company.  As well as playing Bob in our film he will act as co-producer.

Olivia Andrade is thrilled to be a part of her first feature length film.  She currently studies Theatre and has appeared in shows such as “House of Home”, Footloose and Addams Family: A New Musical.  With this opportunity Olivia looks forward to her new experiences in film.

 

Nick Gilley is a Texas native and versatile performer. Nick is an actor, voice actor, singer, physical performer, artist, and writer. He was introduced to camera work in short films during his time at the University of North Texas. Since then, Nick has gone on to perform in a variety of medium, playing everything from lovable boy-next-doors to debouched villains. From television series' to feature films, Nick Gilley continues to expand his colorful repertoire.

Bill Houskeeper was born in Baker, Oregon, and grew up in the coal mining town of Price, Utah. His father Jack worked as a coal miner, After graduating with a B.F.A. from Mesa State University Bill moved to Los Angeles to continue his acting career. He has been trained in Meisner from Playhouse West under Jeff Goldblum (personally) and has been cast in over 20 films.

 

Avery Berry is a very talented young actress with a great scream. She has been taking acting lessons from our very own Michael Vincent Berry and came very highly recommended and after a great audition we knew she was great for our film!

Vernazza Rae Merlo at just 4 years old has become a very amazing voice artist. At less than a year old she was creating her own creepy Gremlin like voice and wrote her first song at just 2 years old!

 

Julian Seager is an English award winning character Actor. Julian splits his time between the USA and UK. He appears in box office hit Fisherman's Friends and has recently had a lead role in the political horror movie Election Night. He has had featured roles on TV shows such as Bafta Award Winning Poldark, Miracle Workers, Cursed, Galavant and is a season regular for last 10 years on Doc Martin. He also appears in movies such as Death Race 4, Scareycrows, Viking Legacy, Survivorz and a plethora of Independent Films.

 

Albie Robles is a voice actor, and host of the Scare Me podcast. While much of his work is in corporate training videos, his real love is voicing for animation, video games, and film... Especially when it's horror!

 

Steve Merlo is a Canadian Filmmaker/Musician from Kelowna, British Columbia. He is best know for his short horror/thriller film "Unseen" which has been selected by numerous festivals and won 3 awards including "Best International Short Horror Film" at The Los Angeles Academy of Filmmaking. In 2019, he re worked a rough Texas Chainsaw Massacre screenplay and consulted many accomplished industry professionals who really liked his idea. Before long, The Sawyer Massacre was born and here we are today, ready to take this idea to the next level!

 

Josh Skurnik runs Josh Skurnik Productions and has since produced many documentary films as well he is an accomplished Editor and Camera Operator.

 

Clancy James Maguire Born in 1991 deep in the Koots Creston B.C. He always had a deep rooted passion for film and now runs Solar Squid Productions.  His passion is acting yet he also admires the various jobs it takes to make a production. He has worked with Steve on many productions in the few short years they've known each other.

 

Christopher Vaughan is a Dallas based cinematographer and has worked in many other areas of film. He is known for his work on Visitor in the Dark (2017), Love Torn Between Two (2020) and Beside Myself. His company, Little Black Dog Films have been involved in many productions in the Dallas/Fort Worth area.

 

Stephanie Escamilla of Skin Deep SFX is an amazing Make Up and Special FX artist. You can expect her to create some amazing things that you won't be able to un see no matter how hard you try.

 

The Impact of Fan Films has been massive over the last few years. Horror fan films are among the most popular and it has become a great stepping stone for indie filmmakers to get their passion for horror to the mainstream audience. With a feature length fan film, we can give The Texas Chainsaw Massacre fans a film they deserve.  We believe that this is a Chainsaw film that needs to be made and will have it's place in an amazing franchise.

 

The original was an incredibly difficult film to shoot and we expect ours to be no different. The Texas heat will be an obstacle that will challenge us for sure. We want to make sure that it will be a safe environment  for the cast and crew. Our plan is to have a medic on set at all times and plan out the safest ways to shoot potentially dangerous scenes.  Locations will need to be approved by the production team and deemed safe before they are booked.

Raising 10K US is no easy task, but we feel that with the dedicated fan base that The Texas Chainsaw Massacre has that this is very possible. It is not essential that we raise the entire amount but if we are to film in Texas and give the fans everything we possibly can, this will be our bar. 

 

We are very active on Social media and it is another great way that you can help us reach more and more fans. Make sure to like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram and twitter. Share as much as possible!

https://www.facebook.com/The-Sawyer-Massacre-10...

https://www.instagram.com/chainsaw_sawyer/?hl=en

https://twitter.com/MassacreSawyer

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjsSSZsPM2X54N...

story:
Since leaving home a timid 20-year-old has grown apart from her parent’s traditional ideals and ways. Forced to move back due to covid, she’s faced with the decision to be who she is or who her parents want her to be.

 

 

ANNA, a timid 20-year-old is forced to move back home due to covid. She faces the traditional ways and ideals of her parents that she had left behind when she moved out. When moving back home she goes to lengths to find ways to hide her true self from her family and fabricate a life they think still exists.

But as life in lockdown continues, Anna finds it harder and harder to keep up with the cultural morals of her family heritage. From conversations about university to upholding the image of a respectable daughter within the community. Anna’s values change and she finds herself left with the decision to be who she is or who her parents want her to be.

 

 

Finding your independence and identity is a tough thing to go through and honestly most of us have experienced something like this growing up and is especially prevalent within migrant families. And that’s where you guys come in - by donating you will be supporting this film and the need for more recognition of people of colour.  - a lot of the time there is misrepresentation and a lack of authenticity.

 

 

You can support us by donating as little or as much as you would like. And even if you can’t support us financially that’s cool too; we need an amazing group of people supporting us online. we have Facebook and Instagram pages that you guys can follow that will update you guys on the campaign and what’s to Come with the film.

Facebook: @fortherbettershortfilm

Instagram: @fortherbettershortfilm

 

 

The money raised will be put towards things like the Location, Set Design, Costumes and props, catering and Covid safety essentials like masks and sanitisers to keep everyone safe.

 

If we surpass our fundraising goal, the extra money will go into production design, film festival submissions and marketing.

 

 

If you’re fortunate enough to donate there are several perks you can receive; like getting a copy of the script; or a digital copy of the official film poster or even be credited as the executive producer in the credits. The more you donate the more you get!

 

-

 

The rest of the crew and I can’t wait for you guys to see what we’re working on and hope you guys follow us on this amazing journey! See you all soon!

When moving back home she goes to lengths to find ways to hide her true self from her family and fabricate a life they think still exists.But as life in lockdown continues, Anna finds it harder and harder to keep up with the cultural morals of her family heritage. From conversations about university to upholding the image of a respectable daughter within the community. Anna’s values change and she finds herself left with the decision to be who she is or who her parents want her to be.  Finding your independence and identity is a tough thing to go through and honestly most of us have experienced something like this growing up and is especially prevalent within migrant families. And that’s where you guys come in - by donating you will be supporting this film and the need for more recognition of people of colour.  - a lot of the time there is misrepresentation and a lack of authenticity.  You can support us by donating as little or as much as you would like. And even if you can’t support us financially that’s cool too; we need an amazing group of people supporting us online. we have Facebook and Instagram pages that you guys can follow that will update you guys on the campaign and what’s to Come with the film.Facebook: @fortherbettershortfilmInstagram: @fortherbettershortfilm  The money raised will be put towards things like the Location, Set Design, Costumes and props, catering and Covid safety essentials like masks and sanitisers to keep everyone safe. If we surpass our fundraising goal, the extra money will go into production design, film festival submissions and marketing.  If you’re fortunate enough to donate there are several perks you can receive; like getting a copy of the script; or a digital copy of the official film poster or even be credited as the executive producer in the credits. The more you donate the more you get! - The rest of the crew and I can’t wait for you guys to see what we’re working on and hope you guys follow us on this amazing journey! See you all soon!

story:
Hellboy has appeared in countless graphic novels and comic books, prose novels and short story collections, acclaimed role playing games and video games, three live action films and two animated features, and has inspired toys and collectibles. Now it’s time for award-winning Hellboy creator Mike Mignola to get his turn in the spotlight in the all new documentary MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS, the definitive story of one of the most influential and important comic book creators of all time. 

MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS is going to be a feature-length documentary film that tells the story of how Mike Mignola came to create a world-renowned comic book universe.  The film includes never-before-seen interviews conducted with the legendary creator at his studio, drawing demonstrations, behind the scenes footage from workshops and comic book conventions, and interviews with some of the most influential people in entertainment. 

As one of the most successful independent comic book creators, Mignola has inspired generations of writers and artists. This film provides an in-depth look at his legacy, from the beginning of his career to his success with Hellboy. We have funded on Kickstarter and are here on IndieGoGo InDemand to allow others to partake in getting some cool rewards to continue to make the film as awesome as possible!

 

What You Get

(Note: All items will be delivered when the film is done - currently projected for April of 2022)

Who We Are

MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS is being directed and produced by Jim Demonakos (co-founder, Emerald City Comic Con and LightBox Expo) and Kevin Konrad Hanna (Director, Clockwork Girl). We love comics. We love Mignola. We are committed to making an in depth, top-shelf documentary film, and we already have over 80 hours of footage that we have shot over the last year and a half.

 

Why Back Now?

  • Help Make The Documentary Better - This is the most important part - you! Your financial support will fund our conducting additional interviews throughout the country, plus hiring a professional editor and sound designer to get the final film ready to release. By backing us now, we can use the funds you pledge to make this documentary about Mike Mignola truly special.
  • We're Over Half Way There - Mike Mignola: Drawing Monsters is already in production and we're committed to finishing this film on-time! Filming will continue and is scheduled to be done in the fall/winter of 2021 with the finished film debuting by spring of 2022! For reward fulfillment, we are working with the team at White Squirrel to make sure everything is professionally delivered to you.

 

Connect With Us

 

Risks and Challenges

We are well in to the production of the film, but our biggest challenge is dealing safely with the pandemic. Even with changing schedules and travel restrictions, we will be taking all necessary precautions and are confident that we will be able to do the bulk of our remaining filming in the fall of 2021 and be able to release the film on time by April of 2022.

story:
The Witches of the Sands

The First 'Post-Modern Meta, South-Eastern Gothic, Folk Horror, Bloody Psychological Slasher B-Movie'... EVER!!!

As a life-long horror fan, I wrote 'The Witches of the Sands' as a love-letter to horror movie lovers everywhere. 

One of our many, many baddies...

(Behind the scenes with Dani Thompson and The Killer)

The Witches of the Sands follows two narratives:

That of the director making his B-Movie (and his progressively tentative grip on reality)and the narrative of the B-Movie he is making, featuring inept paranormal investigator and pod-caster, Fischer Markway, and his increasingly bizarre adventures...As well as this, we have many surprises and even some audience participation in the style of the great showman, William Castle.

The Witches of the Sands (or TWOTS as we like to affectionately call it) features many, many well known horror genre greats. However, each actor was chosen specifically with scenes written especially for them and not just in it for name's sake as can sometimes be the case with an ensemble cast. Although the scenes are fresh, the audience will find a great deal of horror movie nostalgia in them too. 

(Behind the scenes- Linzi Drew-Honey in Make Up by Grace Smith)

See:

Debra Lamb (Teacher Shortage) as the witch Alysandra of Caerwent

Linnea Quigley (Return of the Living Dead, Night of the Demons) , Beverly Randolph (Return of the Living Dead) and Brinke Stevens (Slumber Party Massacre)  in a Return of the Living Dead inspired scene.

Barbara Magnolfi (Suspiria) playing every bit the Italian diva.

Lynn Lowry (The Crazies, Shivers) getting her revenge in a particularly nasty fashion.

Lloyd Kaufman (Troma) looking for Melvin whilst taking on janitorial responsibilities.

Dawna Lee Heising (Arachnado 2, Robowoman) taking on Shakespeare.

Pauline Peart (The Satanic Rites of Dracula) as the mysterious matriarchal figure

Brandon Crane (IT) and Eileen Dietz (The Exorcist) in two scenes so bizarre you'll want to watch them again and again....

Linzi Drew-Honey (An American Werewolf in London, The Lair of the White Worm) plays the 17th Century Witch, Embeline Proctor

Giovanni Lombardo Radice (Cannibal Ferox, City of the Living Dead) killing his lunch

And many, many more....Including Shawn C Phillips (Ghost Shark, Arachnado), Michael St. Michaels (The Greasy Strangler), Dani Thompson (Pandamonium), Joshua Kennedy (House of the Gorgon), Genoveva Rossi (Shakespeare's Shitstorm), Maria Lee Metheringham (Bite Night) and Martin Payne (Millennial Killer).

We are also privileged to have many other horror movie names involved including Allan (The Darkside) Bryce, Eric (We Belong Dead) McNaughton, Tris (Abertoir festival favourite and author) Thompson, Mark (Theme '70) Banville and the duo behind Misty Moon; Stuart and Jen Morriss... as well as many others....

We are spoilt for talent!

(Behind the Scenes- Chris Walker sees the points...FX by Dave Fox)

Have a look at the video by Darkside Magazine editor, Allan Bryce (who also makes an appearance in the film), above...

This is the second in a series of three paintings for The Witches of the Sands by artist Simon Pritchard

Here is a short video from the amazing Lynn Lowry...

https://vimeo.com/537782806

I am an actor, appearing in films such as Beyond Fury (alongside Giovanni Lombardo Radice who features in TWOTS), Bad Moon Rising, Black Lizard Tales, Toxic Alien Zombie Babes from Outer Space, Our Manor and others. I recently played the AFC Richmond coach in Season 1 of the Golden Globe award winning Apple TV series, Ted Lasso, with Jason Sudeikis. My next two roles are both back in the horror genre; Playing Mr. Daniels in Mosaic (from the team behind the festival smash hit I Scream on the Beach) and Jared in Strawmen (from the Mycho team)

We have an amazing team who are essential in bringing the vision to the screen, be it cinematographer Andy Boothby (Black Lizard Tales), Editors Alex Churchyard and Michael Holiday (I Scream on the Beach, The Allotment), Visual Effects John Selling and Matt Westrup (Dr. Sleep and Gorillaz respectively) or musicians including the band Die Gruwel. Everyone involved is at the top of their field. 

This campaign is important to ensure we can produce the best film  we can. We are approximately 50% filmed already. All the scenes involving the genre actors are done and dusted- they are great!  But we really need your help to complete filming and  post production work.

We have a big flashback scene planned which I can only describe as Monster Squad Versus Cowboys. This means hiring the Wild West town for a day of filming as well as well as creation of the monsters. This will undoubtedly be the biggest scene of the film and a huge showstopper but will not be cheap.

We are looking to add more blood and guts too, as well as other name actors. We have a few surprises in store if we can reach our target.

Every single penny raised will be seen on screen in one way or another. We are absolutely passionate and committed to making this the best film we possibly can. We want to break the rules, move the boundaries and deliver something very special and unique!

Have a little watch of this quick video by the beautiful Dawna

https://vimeo.com/537788761

Why should you contribute? 

In order to complete the film to the next level, we need your help. We have self-funded up to this point but the scale of the upcoming scenes is so great that we are asking for support. 

In return, we have some amazing, exclusive rewards for you. From media shout-outs and your name in the credits to producer credits and your chance to actually be in the film. If you are a Troma fan, this is your chance to voice one of several Troma characters in one of the animated sequences, courtesy of Lloyd Kaufman. Props, prints, Blu-Rays, DVDs, your photo in the movie and many, many more perks are available. This really is an amazing opportunity to get involved!

If we don't manage to reach our goal, all money raised will still go towards making TWOTS as great as possible. If we raise more, then it will be even better!!! 

If you need another reason to donate...watch this from the fantastic Beverly Randolph

https://vimeo.com/537790286

Please share this campaign far and wide. Help us to bring you the movie we want to make. We are close, but need your help.

THANK YOU FROM ALL OF US WITCHES!!!

story:
'Ice Cream' is drawn from our lead actress and story producer Ellie Rose Boswell's own anorexia experiences. The film follows Amy, a woman recovering from anorexia, who gets caught between the illness and her overbearing mother while attempting to buy an ice cream for her young daughter.

We are aiming this film at loved ones of anorexia sufferers or anorexia sufferers who have made a step towards recovery. We want this film to provide a better understanding of how to talk to those suffering, the stumbling blocks both they and their loved ones may encounter along the way and to highlight that recovery isn't a straight forward, bound to succeed avenue.
 

 


The portrayal of anorexia in the media has repeatedly been misrepresented, emphasising the illness’s misconceptions and misunderstanding to people who know little to no information. For example, anorexia is often glamorised through film, lending itself to the misconception that anorexia starts from a place of vanity - that it's a shallow problem and not seen as a mental health illness.

'ICE CREAM’ aims to address these misconceptions, promote a more realistic portrayal of someone’s anorexia recovery journey and build a supportive community - via the Indiegogo platform - of anorexia survivors, sufferers, loved ones of anorexia sufferers and those interested in understanding more deeply the ups and downs of the recovery from anorexia.

Moreover, few to no films deal with the path of recovery from the illness and those which do, still present a dramatised version far from reality, favouring drama for entertainment purposes rather than true information.

And of those few films, we’re usually only shown serious, somewhat miserable dramas, further increasing the stigma around anorexia and what is seen as a taboo subject. 'ICE CREAM' is a drama with dark comedic and lighter moments, as well a visually brighter palate: we'd like not to alienate our audience, but for them to actually absorb and learn, rather than feeling preached to or overwhelmed.
 


We need to raise around £14,000 to cover part of the shoot production and ensure everyone’s safety on set through Indiegogo. 

Indiegogo is a vital tool for filmmakers as it enables us to collaborate with fantastic people like yourself to make this film a reality. Each member of our team has given a lot of their spare time towards the creation and fine-tuning of 'ICE CREAM':

As a duty of care towards the anorexia community, we have consulted with both male and female anorexia sufferers and survivors to gather a variety of different opinions and experiences for our film; we've delved deeper into the script both as a result of these discussions and as new ideas have developed, tweaking phrases and dialogues to suit; we've reached out to members of crew we believe will help us to bring the story to life; we've researched and contacted locations to ensure we will capture the particularly challenging elements within the story... But if we don’t reach our goal, we can’t make this beautiful film. Every little bit helps and your support is greatly appreciated. If you can’t donate, sharing our film or crowdfunding link means a lot, as it would enable us to reach a greater number of people and hopefully those who will also resonate with our story.

And as mentioned, we really are hoping to grow an inspired and supportive community of anorexia survivors / anorexia sufferers and their loved ones through this campaign, which is another reason why we've chosen Indiegogo crowdfunding as one of our means of fundraising. 
 

 

 

  • Director Audrey Gagneux

Audrey is a French and Canadian screenwriter/ director based in London. 
After years working in development and production for companies, she is now developing her own projects both in French and in English. Her debut short film, LILY MEETS CHARLIE which starred Tanya Reynolds (Sex Education) and Barry Ward (The End of the F***ing World), premiered at the BAFTA-qualifying Underwire film festival where she was nominated for Best Screenwriter Under 25. The film was released online in August 2020 and has gained over 1.5million views. She’s currently developing a limited series called INSANITY, which was as part of Torino Film Lab’s Next - TV workshop and earned her a writing grant from the CNC (Centre National du Cinéma et de l’Image Animée) in France.

Audrey also chairs the Rising Women working group for Time’s Up UK which aims to give a platform to female talents across all craft for Film & TV, and worked with women's organisation Solace Women's Aid which fight violence against women. Audrey believes her work as a filmmaker goes hand-in-hand with her advocacy work toward intersectional women's rights. That's why, with her projects, she hopes to bring a better intersectional representation of women on screen; where female characters are realistic, flawed and most of all relatable.

  • Writer Neil Westley

Neil Westley co-wrote the critically acclaimed short film The Truth About Stanley with co-writer/director Lucy Tcherniak (The End of the F*cking World, Wanderlust), produced by Trademark Films.

  • Story Producer & Lead Actress Ellie Rose Boswell

Ellie was referred to hospital for Anorexia Nervosa in her mid 20s.  Managing to dodge her referral appointment as she simultaneously relocated to the US, Ellie was never contacted about her Anorexia again. Fast forward a few years, recalling life changing diagnoses she had been warned about by continuing to appease her eating disorder, Ellie made a commitment that she, herself, needed to make a change and get better. Her health further declined, however Ellie was actually then on the road to recovery. Five years later, she wrote about her story to Neil. Now, for the first time, Ellie is opening up in more detail about her anorexia experiences, with the hope to create safe, open conversations around anorexia as a mental health illness and dealing with anorexia tendencies in the long term.

Ellie is an actress, film editor & filmmaker. As an actress, Ellie's award winning portrayal of Allison in short film “Itsy” screened at festivals worldwide, including Newport Beach (California) and PostAlley (sponsored by Seattle International Film Festival); Ellie has worked for "The King of Cannes" Joe Pytka, alongside Carrie Fisher and George Takei, comedians and writers from SNL & This Is Us; while in theatre, for Olivier award winning director Bob Carlton’s actor-musician repertory company.

  • Producer Oriane Pick and Candid Broads Productions

Oriane Pick is an actor and producer. In 2019, she produced and starred in the multi award-nominated short drama ‘Say Your Name’, for which she received two nominations as Best Actress. Having dreamt of creating her own series, Oriane is also the co-Showrunner, Executive Producer and one of the lead actresses in short form dramedy “Call It a Day”. She is the director of Candid Broads Productions which aspires to give the stars of tomorrow a chance to create their projects with a fresh and original perspective, bringing to life diverse and meaningful stories to independent filmmaking. Since the company's creation, she has produced 'Smudged Smile' directed by Ella Greenwood, starring Mia McKenna and 'KOTTI' directed by Fabia Martin, starring Emma Appleton and Anna Savva.

  • Casting Director Shakyra Dowling

Shakyra Dowling knows the film and television industry inside out. Having trained and worked as an actor, she spent several years in production before establishing herself as a casting director in 2009.

A fierce champion of new and emerging talent, SDC has carved out a niche specialising in independent British feature films and European co-productions alongside television and commercials – many of which have been internationally recognised and gone on to be nominated for multiple awards including BAFTAs and BIFAs, and at festivals from Sundance to TIFF.

Shakyra is a passionate advocate for diversity in all aspects of casting and a vocal supporter of women’s achievements in filmmaking. She is always on the lookout for new talent and excited to work on fresh creative ideas with both promising new filmmakers and established directors.

 

We are aware that Covid-19 and the new variant may cause considerable risks towards the production and we are currently planning the shoot having everyone’s safety in mind, especially for people who may be at risk.

Our talented team is now familiar with this environment as they have been working on multiple projects since the start of the pandemic. This experience provided both cast and crew with the knowledge of the different safety protocols needed to ensure a secured set for both cast and crew during filming. Moreover, a covid supervisor will be present on set to make sure rules are respected. Shooting in London and Essex, our film will adhere to the areas' guidelines which will be constantly monitored, adapting our shoot if needed.

Depicting an eating disorder and portraying one’s state of mind is a delicate area, so in addition to us consulting with male and female sufferers of anorexia and mental health illnesses, BEAT charity has provided Ellie with their media guidelines, which you can view here.

Thank you for your support and let's make this film together.

As a duty of care towards the anorexia community, we have consulted with both male and female anorexia sufferers and survivors to gather a variety of different opinions and experiences for our film; we've delved deeper into the script both as a result of these discussions and as new ideas have developed, tweaking phrases and dialogues to suit; we've reached out to members of crew we believe will help us to bring the story to life; we've researched and contacted locations to ensure we will capture the particularly challenging elements within the story... But if we don’t reach our goal, we can’t make this beautiful film. Every little bit helps and your support is greatly appreciated. If you can’t donate, sharing our film or crowdfunding link means a lot, as it would enable us to reach a greater number of people and hopefully those who will also resonate with our story.
And as mentioned, we really are hoping to grow an inspired and supportive community of anorexia survivors / anorexia sufferers and their loved ones through this campaign, which is another reason why we've chosen Indiegogo crowdfunding as one of our means of fundraising.  

 


 
Director Audrey Gagneux
Audrey is a French and Canadian screenwriter/ director based in London. After years working in development and production for companies, she is now developing her own projects both in French and in English. Her debut short film, LILY MEETS CHARLIE which starred Tanya Reynolds (Sex Education) and Barry Ward (The End of the F***ing World), premiered at the BAFTA-qualifying Underwire film festival where she was nominated for Best Screenwriter Under 25. The film was released online in August 2020 and has gained over 1.5million views. She’s currently developing a limited series called INSANITY, which was as part of Torino Film Lab’s Next - TV workshop and earned her a writing grant from the CNC (Centre National du Cinéma et de l’Image Animée) in France.
Audrey also chairs the Rising Women working group for Time’s Up UK which aims to give a platform to female talents across all craft for Film & TV, and worked with women's organisation Solace Women's Aid which fight violence against women. Audrey believes her work as a filmmaker goes hand-in-hand with her advocacy work toward intersectional women's rights. That's why, with her projects, she hopes to bring a better intersectional representation of women on screen; where female characters are realistic, flawed and most of all relatable.
Writer Neil Westley
Neil Westley co-wrote the critically acclaimed short film The Truth About Stanley with co-writer/director Lucy Tcherniak (The End of the F*cking World, Wanderlust), produced by Trademark Films.
Story Producer & Lead Actress Ellie Rose Boswell
Ellie was referred to hospital for Anorexia Nervosa in her mid 20s.  Managing to dodge her referral appointment as she simultaneously relocated to the US, Ellie was never contacted about her Anorexia again. Fast forward a few years, recalling life changing diagnoses she had been warned about by continuing to appease her eating disorder, Ellie made a commitment that she, herself, needed to make a change and get better. Her health further declined, however Ellie was actually then on the road to recovery. Five years later, she wrote about her story to Neil. Now, for the first time, Ellie is opening up in more detail about her anorexia experiences, with the hope to create safe, open conversations around anorexia as a mental health illness and dealing with anorexia tendencies in the long term.
Ellie is an actress, film editor & filmmaker. As an actress, Ellie's award winning portrayal of Allison in short film “Itsy” screened at festivals worldwide, including Newport Beach (California) and PostAlley (sponsored by Seattle International Film Festival); Ellie has worked for "The King of Cannes" Joe Pytka, alongside Carrie Fisher and George Takei, comedians and writers from SNL & This Is Us; while in theatre, for Olivier award winning director Bob Carlton’s actor-musician repertory company.
Producer Oriane Pick and Candid Broads Productions
Oriane Pick is an actor and producer. In 2019, she produced and starred in the multi award-nominated short drama ‘Say Your Name’, for which she received two nominations as Best Actress. Having dreamt of creating her own series, Oriane is also the co-Showrunner, Executive Producer and one of the lead actresses in short form dramedy “Call It a Day”. She is the director of Candid Broads Productions which aspires to give the stars of tomorrow a chance to create their projects with a fresh and original perspective, bringing to life diverse and meaningful stories to independent filmmaking. Since the company's creation, she has produced 'Smudged Smile' directed by Ella Greenwood, starring Mia McKenna and 'KOTTI' directed by Fabia Martin, starring Emma Appleton and Anna Savva.
Casting Director Shakyra Dowling
Shakyra Dowling knows the film and television industry inside out. Having trained and worked as an actor, she spent several years in production before establishing herself as a casting director in 2009.
A fierce champion of new and emerging talent, SDC has carved out a niche specialising in independent British feature films and European co-productions alongside television and commercials – many of which have been internationally recognised and gone on to be nominated for multiple awards including BAFTAs and BIFAs, and at festivals from Sundance to TIFF.
Shakyra is a passionate advocate for diversity in all aspects of casting and a vocal supporter of women’s achievements in filmmaking. She is always on the lookout for new talent and excited to work on fresh creative ideas with both promising new filmmakers and established directors.
 


We are aware that Covid-19 and the new variant may cause considerable risks towards the production and we are currently planning the shoot having everyone’s safety in mind, especially for people who may be at risk.
Our talented team is now familiar with this environment as they have been working on multiple projects since the start of the pandemic. This experience provided both cast and crew with the knowledge of the different safety protocols needed to ensure a secured set for both cast and crew during filming. Moreover, a covid supervisor will be present on set to make sure rules are respected. Shooting in London and Essex, our film will adhere to the areas' guidelines which will be constantly monitored, adapting our shoot if needed.
Depicting an eating disorder and portraying one’s state of mind is a delicate area, so in addition to us consulting with male and female sufferers of anorexia and mental health illnesses, BEAT charity has provided Ellie with their media guidelines, which you can view here.
Thank you for your support and let's make this film together.

story:
From Dead Mouse Productions Ltd and Cult Screenings UK Ltd, makers of Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II, You're so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night and RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop and Pennywise: The Story of IT comes this brand-new documentary ICON: The Robert Englund Story. A fully independent retrospective documentary which will explore who the man behind the mask and glove truly is, charting his early days in TV and Film to his current stratospheric status in the horror universe. Including intimate interviews with friends and colleagues as well as the man himself ICON will answer the fundamental question ‘was playing an iconic movie character a gift or a double-edged sword for such versatile and talented actors?’

With exclusive interviews with the man himself and supported by dozens of the cast and crew of Robert’s movies as well as Horror Icons including Eli Roth, Corey Taylor, Adam Green, Dennis Christopher, Kane Hodder, Heather Langenkamp, Miko Hughes, Stephen Geoffreys, Ken Kirzinger, Robert Kurtzman and many more. ICON will cover some of Robert’s classic movies including Nightmare on Elm Street, The Mangler, The Phantom of the Opera, Wishmaster, Urban Legend, 976-Evil, Behind the Mask: The Rise of Leslie Vernon, Dance Macabre and many more. ICON is made by fans of the Robert Englund’s work for fans of Robert Englund’s work. The crew have already received support from over 50 of the cast and crew of Robert’s many films and there is no doubt that by the time of production many more key players will be attached to share their amazing stories about one of the most iconic character actors in Hollywood.

ICON will also explore the fandom of Horror icons such as Kane Hodder, Andrew Divoff, Michael Berryman, Eli Roth, Bill Moseley, Tony Todd as well as many others and how cinema has created such iconic and memorable horror characters in the same vein as Robert Englund’s Freddy Krueger!

The documentary is made as a labour of love by a team of Robert Englund fans and this is YOUR unique opportunity to get on board and not only be part of this amazing project BUT make it a reality.

GARY SMART (PRODUCER/DIRECTOR)

Gary's projects include: MORE BRAINS! A Return to the Living Dead, Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II, You’re so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night, RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop, Pennywise: The Story of IT. Recently Gary has produced two five retrospective books 245 Trioxin: The Story of The Return of the Living Dead, Beware the Moon: The Story of An American Werewolf in London, You’re so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night, Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II and Lost in the Shadows: The Story of The Lost Boys.

CHRISTOPHER GRIFFITHS (DIRECTOR)

Chris' projects include: Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II, You’re so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night, RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop, Pennywise: The Story of IT.

JOHN CAMPOPIANO (ARCHIVE PRODUCER)

John's projects include: Unearthed & Untold: The Path to Pet Sematary and Pennywise: The Story of IT .

ADAM EVANS (PRODUCER)

Adam's projects include: MORE BRAINS! A Return to the Living Dead, Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II, You’re so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night, RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop, Pennywise: The Story of IT.

MICHAEL PEREZ (PRODUCTION MANAGER/PRODUCER)

Michael's projects include: MORE BRAINS! A Return to the Living Dead, Never Sleep Again, Inside Story: SCREAM, I Am Nancy and Crystal Lake Memories, RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop and Pennywise: The Story of IT.

We have already amassed over 50-confirmed interviewees including Eli Roth, Dennis Christopher, Kane Hodder, Heather Langenkamp, Miko Hughes, Corey Taylor, Adam Green, Stephen Geoffreys, Ken Kirzinger, Robert Kurtzman and many more. Throughout this campaign and production this list will grow and grow...

Pre-production is already well underway, with a dedicated team of Robert Englund aficionados working in securing interviewees, production information, behind the scenes photos, effects, music and much more.  

Full production will commence in late July and early August with shooting taking place in LA. ICON aims to be the most comprehensive look into both the career and impact of Robert Englund Iconic status in the horror genre and YOUR help is needed more than ever. ICON is one of Dead Mouse Productions most ambitious project to date and its first biopic documentary, so please support us in making this the most definitive documentary possible. 

Rewards and Incentives are key to a campaigns success, check out some samples below and more details on the right-hand-side. Your support is key to making this project a reality so every incentive helps. If you want to ensure that this project is made and is a success, then please support today! More amazing perks will be added if we meet our goal and can expand further!

Projects like this rely on the fans; this project is a labour of love and a love letter to the countless Robert Englund fans around the world. Without your support this project may not be completed.

Pledgees must take into consideration the logistics of producing a 2-hour documentary, our aim is release by October 2020. However, as we have already undertaken a large-scale project like this with Leviathan, Brewster and RoboDoc - We are only too aware of production delays - for all sorts of reasons. Documentary projects are long production processes and we do have multiple teams working on our projects.

If there are any delays YOU would be informed straight away and kept up-to-date on the projects production.

The biggest reason for production delays is quite simply that the entire crew have day jobs and other projects, however we have factored that into our delivery estimates.

Please note that international deliveries may take longer due to customs and postage regulations.

We have a dedicated team behind this project and are supported by endless members of the cast and crew.

story:
Filmed between Ireland, the UK, South Africa and Switzerland, The Covid Chronicles is a feature length documentary charting one man's remarkable rise to prominence as a "go to" Covid commentator and deep data analyst.  
 

As the Covid pandemic brought the world to a standstill, Ivor Cummins picked up speed in a very personal and passionate quest to unravel and translate the data into meaningful video bites for the general public. 

If you've been following the rise of Covid in any detail, you have probably seen Ivor's videos referenced. If you haven't, you probably know someone who has. 

I have known and worked with Ivor for several years now. We collaborated for 2 years to co-produce "Extra Time" and when I left Ireland to return to Cape Town on March 9th, it was with a spring in my step. We had finalised the details of our Irish premiere screening in May and life was good. 

The following week, South Africa introduced draconian lockdown measures to combat Covid 19. As our plans for Extra Time withered and died, Ivor's commitment to understand exactly what was going on deepened, hardened and ultimately manifested itself in the production of what is arguably the most comprehensive video library analysis of the Covid 19 pandemic data anywhere. 

As the weeks and months passed, we were in constant communication, recording some of our calls on a "just in case Covid got much more interesting" basis (of course it did!). Ivor's research brought him into contact with - amongst others - the 2013 Nobel Laureate, Prof Michael Levitt of Stanford University and Prof Beda Stadler, Switzerland's "Vaccine Pope". 

There was a consensus of opinion emerging that the political response to the Covid pandemic was perhaps not proportional to the threat the disease carried. As I watched that movement grow with the abundance of data becoming available as time went by, it was becoming clear that Ivor's passion and performance had pushed him to the fore in a global debate with astronomical consequences for mankind. 

When Ivor's video update "Viral Issue Crucial Update Sept 8th: the Science, Logic and Data Explained!" exceeded 1 million + viewers - including  Anders Tegnell, Sweden's Chief scientist - within days, it was clear that his unique approach to data analysis had hit a new high.

 After 10 years dedicated to researching root cause mechanisms for metabolic health and heart disease, Ivor's approach to unpacking Covid 19 was resonating with millions of viewers. 

Of course, nobody is 100% right and the debates will rage on for many years - possibly decades - but Ivor's unexpected arrival as a Covid Tour de Force and his contribution to the scientific discussion around the pandemic and its political response is a story of our time. 

The Covid Chronicles will chart Ivor's personal journey and the "great pandemic" of 2020 from a perspective few can ignore. If Covid is a disease of our time, then this is the movie of a time we - and future generations - must never forget.

From the international production team that delivered Cereal Killers (2013), Run on Fat (2015), The Big Fat Fix (2016) and Extra Time (2020).

story:
***NEW STRETCH GOAL $190,000*** We need your help to make indie film history!!! 

Help us make the best Action Horror film of 2021!  Tom Sizemore (Saving Private Ryan) and Noel G. (Fast and Furious, Training Day) have joined the cast. 

SYNOPSIS BERMUDA ISLAND: A passenger jet plane carrying dozens of people going somewhere over the Bermuda Triangle gets caught in a deadly storm and crash lands on an island hundreds of miles away from their flight path. They crash land on an island that seems like paradise. In the day time it has crystal blue ocean water with lots of fish but no other wild life seems to be around. At night time creatures come out of the caves and attack them. They are blood sucking creatures. Someone who survived a ship wreck a few years prior tells them about how his group was killed off by them and how he's the only survivor. He teaches them to survive on the island by catching fish, etc. The group must band together to defeat the enemy but they start fighting each other and split into two groups with different leaders. Can they overcome the odds and survive? Or will the creatures destroy them all?

'

Here is the first teaser for Arena Wars starring Michael Madsen, Robert LaSardo, Eric Roberts and John Wells.  We just wrapped production in June of 2021.  The movie will be in post-production for a year or so.  

Below is the trailer for Night of the Tommyknockers western horror film.  We wrapped production on February 3rd, 2021 and the entire movie will be fully edited in 30 days.  The movie will be released world-wide in Summer of 2022. 

Below is the trailer for Attack of the Unknown starring Richard Grieco, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  It's now available on all major VOD platforms and on Blu-ray!  It was released in over 22 countries on a deal with Fox Network Asia.  Sony Pictures in Germany is about to release the movie as well. 

Check out these great reviews of Attack of the Unknown!
http://drive.google.com/file/d/14GUto9qb-PR3XzcQnJHo7mWOkHCHOP1V/view?fbclid=IwAR0agqE7jj4uWKwL8lokiHrUIw3FE5gMtA3ObmKV97E4JXT81tc73jhloi8

Below is the teaser for Death Count starring Michael Madsen and Costas Mandylor.  We filmed this during the pandemic and the movie is completely shot and in the can.  The movie has been edited and the only thing that remains is the custom music score and the CGI/VFX work.  It will be completed in approximately three weeks. 

 

Here is the trailer for Bloodthirst starring Costas Mandylor, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  The movie got a Lionsgate deal and will be released later this year in 2021.  We are just waiting for the release date from Lionsgate.  

Here is the teaser for Bridge of the Doomed zombie film.  We had a new company re-edit the film and it's so much better.  We will have this project fully completed within 60 to 90 days.  Then we will shop it to distributors and provide a release date.  

Bridge of the Doomed was featured on the front page of InkTip Magazine! 

Below is the trailer for Art of the Dead starring Jessica Morris, Tara Reid and Richard Grieco.  Walmart picked up over 16,000 copies of the film.  It was well received by the critics!

 

Below is the trailer for Bus Party to Hell starring Tara Reid. The movie got in over 18,500 redbox locations around the United States.  It was very well received in the horror community and became a cult classic!  It's also available on EPIX network and Paramount+.  It was also picked up by the Horror Channel in the UK.
