story:
The original Nemesis was released in 1992, directed by Albert Pyun and starring Olivier Gruner. The film went on to span 4 sequels. 

Nemesis Rain is a planned prequel/fan film to the original film and has the blessing of the original films Director. Albert Pyun.

SYNOPSIS. Set a few years prior to the original film. Alex Raine is a cop in the near future working for the LAPD.  Deep Undercover and working as a courier for the criminals of the city. His case brings him up close with an information dealer attempting to sell military plans to opposing countries. 

Now a chip, carried by an innocent woman must be returned and only Alex Raine can do the job. Under the command of commissioner Farnsworth and with the help of his former partner and lover Jared, officer Raine must bring to justice a known information terrorist.

His is every criminals worse nightmare. He is their Nemesis.

We aim to shoot the film in a similar style to the original. 

We are looking for a budget of £10,000.

We want to do the best job possible and do the original film justice. In the original there are alot of stunts, explosions and exciting shootouts.

£10,000 will cover the entire budget needed to make the film from start to finish. Extreme stunts, mostly practical effects, props, production costs, equipment hire, travel and location hire.  Anything over the budget will go towards increasing production value (bigger and better stunts, more explosions, more visual effects)

Nemesis was a low budget hit upon it's release and Albert is now a cult director with 56 feature films. Due to ill health he is currently working on what may be his final project.

A big fan of his films (Cyborg/ The sword and the sorcerer/ Mean guns/ Road to hell/ down twisted and many more) the creative team behind Nemesis Rain would like to complete a fan film in his honour. This will be the first Nemesis fan film.

We have perks where contributors can visit the set, perhaps play a small extra role in the film. Receive a copy of the movie, get an invite to the premier and receive a credit on the film.

The script is finished, the film has been storyboarded from the first to the last shot, casting is currently taking place.

This film will not only pay homage to a legendary director and popular series of films. It will also become a calling card for all involved and showcase the talent involved in the film.
story_txt:
The original Nemesis was released in 1992, directed by Albert Pyun and starring Olivier Gruner. The film went on to span 4 sequels. 
Nemesis Rain is a planned prequel/fan film to the original film and has the blessing of the original films Director. Albert Pyun.
SYNOPSIS. Set a few years prior to the original film. Alex Raine is a cop in the near future working for the LAPD.  Deep Undercover and working as a courier for the criminals of the city. His case brings him up close with an information dealer attempting to sell military plans to opposing countries. 
Now a chip, carried by an innocent woman must be returned and only Alex Raine can do the job. Under the command of commissioner Farnsworth and with the help of his former partner and lover Jared, officer Raine must bring to justice a known information terrorist.
His is every criminals worse nightmare. He is their Nemesis.
We aim to shoot the film in a similar style to the original. 

We are looking for a budget of £10,000.
We want to do the best job possible and do the original film justice. In the original there are alot of stunts, explosions and exciting shootouts.
£10,000 will cover the entire budget needed to make the film from start to finish. Extreme stunts, mostly practical effects, props, production costs, equipment hire, travel and location hire.  Anything over the budget will go towards increasing production value (bigger and better stunts, more explosions, more visual effects)

Nemesis was a low budget hit upon it's release and Albert is now a cult director with 56 feature films. Due to ill health he is currently working on what may be his final project.
A big fan of his films (Cyborg/ The sword and the sorcerer/ Mean guns/ Road to hell/ down twisted and many more) the creative team behind Nemesis Rain would like to complete a fan film in his honour. This will be the first Nemesis fan film.
We have perks where contributors can visit the set, perhaps play a small extra role in the film. Receive a copy of the movie, get an invite to the premier and receive a credit on the film.
The script is finished, the film has been storyboarded from the first to the last shot, casting is currently taking place.
This film will not only pay homage to a legendary director and popular series of films. It will also become a calling card for all involved and showcase the talent involved in the film.

story:
#whoisDrNauberger

Hi, I’m Andras Ostrom, writer-director-producer of Bad Psychiatrist. I’ve been making films since I was about 16 years old, so, roughly half my life... but only short films … This is my first feature. It’s important to me because I’ve always wanted to direct a real movie, but haven’t had a chance. This is it.

We’ve shot 55 minutes, using my own money and that from close friends/family, but now I need help finishing it up. If you contribute you’ll help expand a 55 minute movie into ‘feature film’ range, which is at least 80-90 minutes. That’s the goal. We plan on shooting in November or possibly December. Then we can start submitting to film festivals and find proper distribution.

What We Need

We need $5,000 to film the additional 30 minutes. It’s mainly going into hiring actors, a cinematographer, a stills photographer, a script supervisor, and locations. I'll do a lot of the other roles myself. Then, when we’re done shooting - I'll need money for prints and advertising (marketing) costs in order to get the word out, and deliverables. Film festivals often require a DCP or digital cinema package and that itself can cost up to $1000 for a film of this length; and distribution companies require a laundry list of deliverables that can cost a lot of money to produce.

We do have perks if you back the film:

$10 - Addition into end credits under “Bad Psychiatrist Fan Club”

$25 - A PDF copy of the script with digitally signed title page sent to you electronically, as well as inclusion in credits under “Bad Psychiatrist Fan Club”

$50 - A full sized printable digital JPG of the movie poster, individually signed and numbered by me, sent to you electronically, as well as inclusion in credits under “Bad Psychiatrist Fan Club”

$75 - One black t-shirt (super soft American Apparel 100% cotton, made in USA) with Bad Psychiatrist title art and brand new Dr. Nauberger doodle, as well as inclusion in credits under "Bad Psychiatrist Fan Club"

$100 - Inclusion in ‘special thanks’

$500 - Inclusion in credits as ‘Special assistant to Andras Ostrom’

The Impact

The story matters to me because it’s a personal story, and I really care about this character of Dr. Nauberger… The project kind of started as a jokey short film, but he’s grown into so much more of a human being. I've personally been through therapy and dealt with certain 'anxiety' much like Dr. Nauberger has, so I want to convey how someone can be helped and that they're not alone. I think at just 55 minutes Dr. Nauberger's story isn’t quite finished, but I don't really want to turn it into a series either. So I think feature length is the way to go. I’d just like to see a few more things in his life resolved.

A few of my previous credits include:

  • 12 Variations - successfully funded on IndieGoGo and fully completed. A classical music piano live video recording.
  • Massive Sonata - another music video
  • The Cyclist - An award winning (NFFTY Happy Hour Winner, Jay Sanders Film Festival 2nd place) short film about a bike messenger
  • The Letters - Editor on a feature epic based on the life of Mother Teresa, starring Juliet Stevenson, Rutger Hauer and Max von Sydow

Risks & Challenges

My target goal is low for a feature film, even if it is just one third of a feature. But it's in the ballpark of what I think I can raise and we'll work with whatever we can get.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about Bad Psychiatrist by liking our Facebook page, sharing, and following us on Instagram and Twitter..
  • Don't forget to use the IndieGoGo share tools!

story:
Death is one of the few things that unites us all.

It doesn’t matter how old you are or where you’re from; how much money you have or don’t have or whether you’re a good egg or a bad egg. We all die and we all suffer when those we love die. It’s not something the average person thinks a lot about because, well, it’s seen as all a bit morbid and depressing isn’t it? But, in my opinion, it doesn’t have to be.

My first solo single “An Open Letter To Death” and its music video are the story of how I was forced to acknowledge the mortality of both myself and my loved ones. When my dad died my family fell apart, each in our own unique but equally destructive way. We mostly coped in ways that not only didn’t help but made it worse. And our story is far from unique. But I eventually realised that it’s the fragility of our lives that makes our time on earth special and gives us the push we need to truly live and not just exist. I made friends with death, heartless f*cker that he is.

Who Am I?

For those of you who are unfamiliar with my work, my name is Olivia Hyde and I am a singer-songwriter from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire who makes music videos. My sound has been described as “art pop meets neo classical” and my videos have been described as “dark”, “emotional” and sometimes just “downright creepy.”

Why Have I Invited You Here?

I’ve invited you here because I want to make a music video/ short film that documents the story of someone who is grieving and how they ultimately find freedom and maturity when they work up the courage to look death in the eye. Once they do, they realise that he isn’t the enemy. Without him, life would have no meaning.

I would describe my intended look and feel for the project as “bleak and creepy fairytale for grown ups.” If the pledge campaign is successful, Death will be played by none other than veteran actor Clive Russell- best known for starring as Blackfish Tully in Game Of Thrones. 

Those of you who are already familiar with my work as a director will probably know that I’m used to working on a shoe string. My partner and I made Blood and Rust in Lockdown with a budget of £20 being a prime example. I’m used to having to beg, borrow and steal in order to finish a project. But this story is just too important to approach in this way. It is retelling of, not only the most painful and profound experience of my life, but one that mirrors that of countless others. I want to do it right and to do that we need great equipment, great costumes, great props and, of course a fantastic cast and crew. I also want to tell this story with no holds barred. In my experience grief is terrifyingly dark and I’ve no intention of sugar coating it so that it’s more palatable for the masses.

The Synopsis

The synopsis of the film is that my character witnesses the death of her father then enters a surreal dreamworld where she's forced to watch her family and friends' coping strategies destroy them one by one. On the other hand, she can actually see Death who, not used to being seen by humans, follows her with curiosity until she finds the courage to face him. 

This said, even though there is a story, we're primarily concerned with making a beautiful video full of emotion and atmosphere. It's ok with me if people interpret the narrative differently.

What You Can Get For Your Pledge

  • Limited edition EP “An Open Letter To Death”My full album will not be ready until next year BUT, especially for this campaign, I have produced a limited edition EP featuring five of the finished tracks including the first single with two bonus tracks which will NOT be on the final album. Only 1000 copies of this EP will ever exist. 
  • Limited edition T-shirt
  • Props and costumes from the film
  • Signed shotlists and storyboards
  • Unique, personalised experiences

But best of all, you get the Behind The Scenes pass. 

Upon pledging you’ll have access to (released over the course of the campaign):

  • Clive Russell’s screen test as Death
  • The taped auditions of the various other characters
  • Rehearsal footage
  • A mini series we’ve put together of the various adventures we have while location scouting affectionately named “Recce Time With Bungle” as we always take our dog. 

As we get closer to the shoot dates there’ll also be updates showing the process of designing the sets and how the decisions get made.

So have a gander at all the things on offer and I will see you behind the scenes. 

This project feels like a lifetime in the making for me. Despite the difficult subject matter for someone such as myself I’m already absolutely certain that it will be our best video yet and that making it will be all the sweeter with your support.

story:
Hello!

Thank you for stopping by and viewing Lee Hampton Films next action packed project 'ABSOLUTION'

The film is about an armed response officer named Joel.  Who after many years of being undercover, for his health and knowing he has a baby on the way, decides to set up one last deal to bring down the known felons and leave the outfit for good.  After a devastating incident he is forced back into the world he so desperately wants to leave.  He is forced to make drastic choices that will change his life forever.

                                    

KRISS DILLON has come on board to play the lead character Joel. A man thrown deep undercover to unravel the drug trade and seek out those responsible.  He is loving husband, but struggles to cope because of all of the harsh acts he's had to commit to stay undercover.

Kriss has many years experience, working on short films such as DAMAGED, TV shows RED DWARF, CUCKOO and big budget films such as THE ONE AND ONLY IVAN which starred Bryan Cranston. He is extremely passionate about this project and like the rest of us, can't wait to get filming!

    

LAURA LANDAMORE is a multi talented actress experienced in Theatre, on screen presenting, short and feature films. She will be playing 'Adina' the wife of the lead character Joel. I have worked with Laura on my feature film fighting heart and she is a joy to work with. Always full of smiles and happy to work. She always brings passion for the project and is full of ideas on and off the camera. 

    

STACEY GOUGH will be playing one of the main villains 'Tony' A family man who puts the business first and is ruthless with anyone who steps out of line. Stacey is an amazing actor who after a very long phone call, shares the same excitement and passion for the project as I do. I can't wait to see him bring this character to life.

 
SIMON MICHAEL MORGAN will be joining the cast to play Dan.
He Is originally from Wales and has made his home in Norfolk.
2021 marks twenty years as a professional after studying theatre and directing at the Rep College in Reading. 
Film and tv work includes ‘Hatched’ for Proportion Productions, adverts for Pokemon and Specsavers and Talk Talk, forthcoming tv show ‘The Engineers that built America’ History Channel, ‘Fear in the Fens’ nominated horror short, ‘The Escape’.
Theatre includes Hamlet at the Kenton Theatre, Rough Crossing Bill Kenwright (understudy), Puck Cambridge Shakespeare Festival, two summers at the Edinburgh Fringe with new musicals, numerous Shakespeare whilst writing and directing for his own company, Strange Fascination Theatre.He also is a published writer of short stories and poetry. 
 
                                                
LEE HAMPTON is the writer/director/producer on the project. He has always shown great interest in drawing, writing, watching films and cartoons. At the age of fourteen he found a great love for boxing and began training at his local Boxing gym. At twenty three he decided to take writing more seriously and wrote his first feature script based on the life of Rocky Marciano. He loves all aspects of film making, enjoying the fact that you learn with every film you make which ultimately leads to bigger better films for the audience.
 

     

DARRYL JOHN HANNAN is an award-winning composer for film, television and commercial media. He has worked on a myriad of feature and short films throughout his career with clients from London to Los Angeles. Most notably, working with George Bamber (of Pitch Perfect renown) on Kept Boy as well as Hansel Rodrigues on Horse Play which premiered at the Cannes Film Festival in 2019.
 

   

ANDY BLITHE will be joining the production as the camera operator. Andy Blithe is a an award winning filmmaker, Actor, Director and Producer originating from Chesterfield in Derbyshire. Andy previously was in the RAF and a Sergeant in the Police Service. He became involved in the film industry around 10 years ago. He has a Masters in Film and Television Production and has produced several short films and feature documentaries.

 
For full cast and crew listing please visit the official IMDB page.
 

- Cast And Crew wages

- Food

- Travel 

- Accommodation

- Equipment Hire

- Indiegogo fees

- Costumes

- Location Costs

- Insurence

- Festival Fees

- Music Score

- Sound Mixing

- Special Effects

- 10% Overflow

 

Over my twelve year career of indie film making, I've defiantly come up against some challenges as I'm sure all low budget film makers have!

All I can say is, it's made me a more confident film maker and given me experience to handle any challenge that comes my way. Plan plan plan, plan some more and always have a plan B. 

There's always a silver lining and I'm planning to find them all to make this shoot run as smoothly as possible.

We are committed to making this film the best it can be. Every one has pulled together to get us this far. And with your help we can reach our goal and bring this project alive. 

If you can't donate the minimum perk, no matter. You can donate £1. Believe me it all helps. You can also follow us on the official Absolution face book page and share this page on your social media sites. Tweet it, Share it, Talk about it!

Thank you for your time.

We're all excited to get this project off the ground and look forward to working with you.

story:
After enjoying his retirement in Florida, carving wood, enjoying the white sand beaches, and dancing to old disco, Uncle Stan (Leslie David Baker) gets a call from his nephew Lucky in Los Angeles asking for help with his two kids and running his motorcycle/flower shop. With his business failing, his kids growing up without enough attention, and on the brink of losing his patience with the cast of characters he has working in the shop, Lucky is going to need all the help he can get from no-nonsense Uncle Stan. 

 

 

When Lucky picks up his uncle at LAX in a motorcycle with a sidecar laden with flowers and no room for his luggage, Uncle Stan knows that he will be in for quite the adventure and challenge. With his unique personality and business acumen that he has acquired over decades, Stan is sure to clash once or twice with the wild personalities that Lucky has working in the shop. With his lady friend and soon-to-be fiancé completely in the dark, Uncle Stan must take swift action to make sure that not only his nephew comes out on top, but that he is able to maintain some semblance of his previously comfortable lifestyle moving forward.

 

- Location & Photos courtesy of Rusty Coones.

 

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Interior

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Bar

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Office

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Garage

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Garage #2

 

 

ADD ONS:

You may add on any of the following items to your selected reward, if an item is not mentioned and you would like to add it on please send us a message and we will get it set up for you! 

  • Signed Blu-ray - $50
  • Signed Posters - $25 Each
  • Signed Script - $50
  • T-Shirts - $25 Each
  • Pretzel Day Pin - $15
  • Live Q&A with Leslie David Baker & The Cast - $25
  • Signed "Stanley Hudson" Funko Pop - $100
  • Signed Personal Item - $100 Each
  • Personal Phone Call from Leslie David Baker - $100
  • "Thank You Credit" At The End Of The Show - $200
  • Tickets to Events and All Other Rewards - Please Send Us A Message For Price

 

 

Crowdfunding gives us a unique opportunity to create and deliver a quality series while providing us the independence to develop a captivating story and take risks which the networks may find challenging. Our vision is to collaborate with a diverse array of talent, both new and seasoned veterans. This means that writers, actors, and the production team will be staffed by persons of all ages and ethnicities, new and old. We are excited to include you from the very beginning of this project, as your suggestions will be brought to our attention and may be implemented within project/plot lines to enhance and move stories forward. Our goal is to have a pilot that fans can be proud of as well as be entertained and enlightened. 

 

 

While attending Comic Cons and making promotional appearances, the questions most often asked were: "What happened after your retirement, and what project are you working on next?" These are often the two most important questions we ask of the television characters we've grown to care about. The audience wants to know about that characters life and journey. Well in a perfect world you'd have the ability to have those questions answered. Here is your chance to do just that!

 

 

By retaining what we have learned within the entertainment/production industry, and combining that with new technology and fan participation, will enable us to access some of the best talent and provide a quality show.  Accessing our loyal fan base will only serve to enhance the nuances of production. This will facilitate the Casting, Writer Selection, Script Development, Future Story Arcs, and will readily demonstrate fan base support. All of the aforementioned are vital if this project is to garner network support.

 

"Uncle Stan - Pretzel Day" Limited Edition Print by Spaghetti Toes

 

 

A Crowdfunding campaign comes with its own set of challenges and a learning curve. During the course of project development, it is our intention to continue to address our donors concerns and overall expectations of this project. The level of fiscal and programmatic transparency will continue to be addressed throughout this project. This will be done without sacrificing storyline content.

 

Donor Exclusive Limited Edition Print by Maas Art

 

 

SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!!! Please share this campaign on all of your social media channels. Get the word out however you can! This is a fan based effort and it will take fan support to bring it to life. If you can afford to donate, please do, but if you can't, simply help us via word of mouth. We have faith in our fan community to make this happen!

 

Thank you for your continued love and support. 

 

- Sardar Khan & Leslie David Baker.
story_txt:
After enjoying his retirement in Florida, carving wood, enjoying the white sand beaches, and dancing to old disco, Uncle Stan (Leslie David Baker) gets a call from his nephew Lucky in Los Angeles asking for help with his two kids and running his motorcycle/flower shop. With his business failing, his kids growing up without enough attention, and on the brink of losing his patience with the cast of characters he has working in the shop, Lucky is going to need all the help he can get from no-nonsense Uncle Stan. 
 

 
When Lucky picks up his uncle at LAX in a motorcycle with a sidecar laden with flowers and no room for his luggage, Uncle Stan knows that he will be in for quite the adventure and challenge. With his unique personality and business acumen that he has acquired over decades, Stan is sure to clash once or twice with the wild personalities that Lucky has working in the shop. With his lady friend and soon-to-be fiancé completely in the dark, Uncle Stan must take swift action to make sure that not only his nephew comes out on top, but that he is able to maintain some semblance of his previously comfortable lifestyle moving forward.
 

- Location & Photos courtesy of Rusty Coones.

 


Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Interior

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Bar

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Office

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Garage

Lucky's Motorcycle Shop - Garage #2

story:
***FINAL STRETCH GOAL $260,000***

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE VAMPIRE FILM HISTORY!

 
SYNOPSIS: 

In a post apocalyptic world run by vampires, only the strong survive. John Shepard, Vampire Hunter, is one of them. John has to track down and eliminate the master vampire before he himself gets turned.

 

 

Be a part of a fresh and original story and help us bring this vision to the big screen!

Producers Michael and Sonny Mahal, following in the success of their recent films "Bridge of the Doomed" starring Michael Pare and Robert LaSardo, "Attack of the Unknown starring Robert LaSardo, Richard Grieco and Tara Reid" “Bus Party To Hell” starring Tara Reid and "Art of the Dead" starring Richard Grieco and Tara Reid, they are ready to conquer the world of horror and thrills again with “Bloodthirst”. With a passion for bringing new and exciting stories to the big screen while expanding the scope of filming in the Vegas Community, Michael and Sonny will once again knock this production out of the park!

Here is the 90 second official trailer for Attack of the Unknown.  The film is currently in post-production and will be distributed in October of 2020 world-wide. 

 
 

 

Here is the official trailer for "Art of the Dead" horror film starring Tara Reid and Richard Grieco. This film is currently distributed world-wide and is available for purchase at Walmart nationwide (Walmart bought over 16,000 copies of the film alone) 

 
 

 

Here is the teaser for Bridge of the Doomed starring Michael Pare and Robert LaSardo. This film will be distributed world-wide in October 2020. 

 
 

 

Bus Party to Hell was distributed world-wide by Gravitas Ventures. We got in 18,500 redbox locations which is every other Redbox in the United States of America. 

 
 

 

 

Tara Reid from American Pie and Sharknado is playing a Vampire Queen
 
 
Robert LaSardo (Nip/Tuck, General Hospital, The Mule)  is playing the main villain and vampire master in the film. 
 
 
 
Scream queen Sarah French is playing one of the Shotgun Sisters.

story:
Short Summary on LACED

Hi, I’m Colin — a ragtag independent filmmaker and erratic lo-fi punk-rock musician— one can check out PANIC ATTACKULA  over on bandcamp: a very rugged album mostly about dinosaurs and bi-polar depression (basically me in a nutshell) if those things vibe with you.

I’m the writer/director of some zero-budget short-film obscurities such as SADIE, BABY (2014) & THE BEARSUIT-MAN STRANGLER (2007) —both of which can be found and viewed on YouTube + the screenplays of which can be found and read over here on Film Freeway at your convenience - SadieBabyRemakeMaybe & TheBearsuit-ManStrangler - respectively— which I’m encouraging you do if you want to check out some samples of my screenwriting: my strongest suit and I think that’s the best way to get a feel on what I try to do.

So what is LACED? Laced is basically “It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia” meets “The House by the Cemetery”. I want to tell stories about severely flawed and dysfunctional people and I’d like to think that this is a twisty-spin on the typical haunted house tale.

Normal is boring. Personally, I like super weird and super spooky.

As somebody who lives with pretty whack and debilitating anxiety: horror's always been a safe space that resonates with me. Horror resonates with a lot of people for a lot of reasons: it’s a malleable and unique experience rooted in human empathy.

Anyway, the goal here is to make a film that is every bit as scary as it is funny, which is a hard balance to properly achieve but it can be done: a character-driven, borderline-experience ala Return of the Living Dead, a personal favorite of mine. Anyway, ‘nuff ‘bout me yakkin’ bout me.

What We Need & What You Get

All of the money funded towards LACED will be going towards covering meals, transportation costs & COVID-19 testing as we try to ensure and maintain a safe shooting environment for everyone involved.

A super-talented cast are volunteering their time and energy into this film. Meet some of them over here LACED on IMDb. Basically, people gotta eat & people gotta be safe, most importantly. 

We’re brand new to crowd-funding and perks! Will update rewards as we go, so please bear with us! Maybe you give us an idea of what you’d like— Signed scripts by the cast and crew? In-film props? Screen-worn wardrobe? The Kane from Citizen Kane? This is all just stuff— like, stuff and junk, ask yourself— do you really need more stuff in your life? If the answer is yes: sure we’ll gladly get you some stuff, please just let us know what you’d want!

Our focus is simply making the film the best film it can possibly be and not so much the gimmicks behind crowd-funding— doing the best we can with what we have is our first priority!

The Impact of LACED

Worst case scenario: it’s not a some fancy-schamncy award-winning movie that moves people to tears, grown men and women will not openly weep then erupt into thunderous applause at a premiere, and the world will continue to go on as it is, for no better, and for no worse.

Best case scenario: it’s a great movie and you were a key element to the making of it! It’s some funny, scary, truly oddball stuff — and you can be like, “yeah I made the world a better place, like no big deal or whatevs. The word hero gets thrown around a lot these days &…”

In all honesty, I wouldn’t be here pitching you a movie about PCP smoking degenerates living in a haunted house cursed by witchdoctor voodoo if I didn’t really-super-believe in the movie. It's a tough sell, I get it. Personally it’s really not easy for me putting myself out here like this. Anxiety man, I’m very, very uncomfortable. So uh… hi, all!

Either way at the end of the day: the movie’s happening one way or another, for as much as we have or as little as we have on hand— but if you know you know: a little bit of money goes a long way in micro-budget filmmaking.

We’re trying to make a weird n’ spooky, quick n’ dirty 80-minute little indie movie that scares, entertains, resonates- and we could sure use a hand if you can spare it.

Thanks so much.

“Some people will always need help, but that doesn’t mean they’re not worth helping.”

Other Ways You Can Help LACED!

Can’t help with money? Ja feel. But there’s still other ways you can help LACED!

You can simply subscribe to a small but proud YouTube channel at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNcmR80q7MKaSO... so we can change that ugly-ass URL!!! Like, yeesh amirite! Behind-the-scenes LACED footage is to be posted there as we go!

You can follow and be a fellow creep to @bestghostvideo over on Instagram.  It's cooky and fun as possible over there because social media is toxic and exhausting.

You can share this funding campaign using the Indiegogo share tools! Tell your friends!

 

Thanks for reading this far, it’s really super cool of you and I hope you’ll consider taking a chance on a ragtag New Jersey dude who just wants to share a weird, fucked up ghost story.

— Colin @ Best Ghost Video

 

LACED on IMDb

 

Sincere Post Script:

I'd just like to add: please don't misconstrue any of the above -- I assure you, this is not about me trying to prove myself as filmmaker or some cringey-shit like that. I'm happy with who I am.

This is just about a movie I really want to make if that makes any sense?

In the words of the immortal Dewey Cox: I'm working something out.  It's called a metaphor. It's secret- that's why it's called metaphor: it's a secret-- that's what metaphor means: secret!

I suppose that's more or less my creative process.  I mean, I'm no Dewey Cox: far, far from it! That's not what I'm trying to say! I just write the things I write or do the things I do I mean...

Like, sometimes we keep secrets from ourselves and don't even realize that we're doing it? 

I truly didn't figure this out until days after posting this gogo and drafting, re-drafting the whole dealy-o,  fussing, tinkering with this and that but then it just hit me.

So bear with me... like, I know I'm talking a whole buncha nonsense-sounding nonsense about sum' witchdoctor voodoo, cursed PCP and haunted house schenanigans—

—in a really weird, really vague and really super-obtuse way that... well... ain't exactly obvious...

This is a movie about losing a pet. And I would just like to say a proper goodbye in the only weird way I know how to.

Au Revoir, Aurora

story:
The Project
 

My name is Calvin Romeyn, and I'm an award-winning visual effects artist with over a decade of industry experience.  My work is driven by my passion for using cutting-edge technology to create imagery that captivates, in the service of telling stories that inspire.

 

In 2018, I released my first independent project, a crossover fan film titled Galactic Battles.  Featuring characters and settings from my favorite sci-fi franchises, from Star Wars, to Star Trek, to Mass Effect and Halo. with some of the characters voiced by their original voice actors - the film went viral on YouTube, and now has over five million views:



This year, I've begun work on my next project - FIRMWARE, a post-apocalyptic science-fiction short film inspired by the likes of Half-Life 2, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, and my longtime interest in the real-life exclusion zones around Pripyat and Fukushima.

 
 
Zaraiah, a spunky, vivacious 20-something year old, is desperate to escape the only world she's ever known. Her best hope for liberation- a pessimistic, decommissioned war droid, "AL-1". I would love for you to be a part of her quest!

 

Created entirely with state-of-the-art motion capture technology in Unreal Engine, FIRMWARE is on the cutting-edge of a new kind of film production  - where performances are captured at a comfortable pace in a controlled studio, without the pressures of long hours and a massive production crew.  Every creative decision can be created, tested, and workshopped in post-production, allowing the story to be perfected like never before.

 

FIRMWARE is set in an alternate 1990 where the adoption of nuclear energy never ended.  Somewhere in Eastern Europe, long after civilization has collapsed and national borders have been forgotten, the walled-off "Alcazar Exclusion Zone" has emerged as a small functioning society, a melting pot of survivors from around the world. 

 

Kept together by an authoritarian government, citizens have almost no freedom in their daily lives, and are constantly fed propaganda that justifies military control under the guise of "personal safety."

 

The Inspiration

Although this is an original work of art, as storytellers, we are always inspired by others. The inspirations for FIRMWARE come from real life photos of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone, Half-Life 2, Children of Men, The Last Of Us, and the artwork of Simon Stålenhag.

 


The Studio

I'm excited to announce that we've partnered with Beyond Capture, a full-service performance capture studio in downtown Vancouver (https://www.beyond-capture.com). They will be providing the studio space to capture all the required high fidelity data in order to translate the actor's dialogue, motion capture, and facial performances to their representative CG characters.

Beyond shares a physical space with Vancouver Film School, and strongly believes in opening up the field of motion capture technology to students and independent filmmakers.   

 


Budget and Perks

We've already completed our first motion capture shoot, in which we captured the majority of our background characters. The world that Zariah inhabits, along with a majority of the story's props, have already been modeled, textured, and made ready for animation.  The next phase of the project involves capturing the performance of the main cast.

In order to complete this project, we need your help to raise $6000: 

  • $4000 for production, including studio fees, transportation, and catering.
  • $1000 for post-production, including visual effects assets and hardware upgrades.
  • $1000 for festival applications and distribution, to reach audiences worldwide.


Once we reach our goal, any overflow contributions will be used to purchase additional visual effects assets to use in the film, and to give back to both the team at Beyond Capture and to our post-production team, all who are giving their time to be involved.
 

Why Support Us?

Empowering and inspiring fellow creators is a passion of mine, and I love to mentor and to share my technical knowledge and skills with others. 

My goal is to use the unique production process behind FIRMWARE to serve as a learning resource for other filmmakers, using in-depth behind-the-scenes breakdowns of our team's use of a "virtual production" workflow.  I believe that this technology will become an integral part of our industry's future, and will play a vital role in making the filmmaking process more accessible and more enjoyable for all.

I'm also a strong believer in representation for all.  Vancouver, BC is an incredibly diverse place, where almost every culture in the world has a voice.  The opportunities made available through my work, both for cast and crew, will represent that. 
 

The final film will be released for free on YouTube, with 100% of all ad revenue being donated to Global Aid Network, a non-profit organization that provides relief for women living in injustice, poverty, and crisis around the world (https://globalaid.net/).
 

Cast & Crew

Director, Writer, VFX | Calvin Romeyn

Producer | Noah Penner

Animation Team | Fred Smith, Will Inglis

Texturing | Francois Van Eeden

Composer | Jose Pavli

Behind The Scenes | Ruby Alstad

Cast | Angel Celiz, Reece Presley, Suksham Shan, Sam Krochmal, Avery Taylor, Miglė Kužmarskytė, Sam Romeyn

 

Performance Capture Team:

Graham Qually     President & CEO

Our Sponsors

story_txt:
The Project 
My name is Calvin Romeyn, and I'm an award-winning visual effects artist with over a decade of industry experience.  My work is driven by my passion for using cutting-edge technology to create imagery that captivates, in the service of telling stories that inspire.

 
In 2018, I released my first independent project, a crossover fan film titled Galactic Battles.  Featuring characters and settings from my favorite sci-fi franchises, from Star Wars, to Star Trek, to Mass Effect and Halo. with some of the characters voiced by their original voice actors - the film went viral on YouTube, and now has over five million views:

This year, I've begun work on my next project - FIRMWARE, a post-apocalyptic science-fiction short film inspired by the likes of Half-Life 2, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, and my longtime interest in the real-life exclusion zones around Pripyat and Fukushima. 
 
Zaraiah, a spunky, vivacious 20-something year old, is desperate to escape the only world she's ever known. Her best hope for liberation- a pessimistic, decommissioned war droid, "AL-1". I would love for you to be a part of her quest!

 
Created entirely with state-of-the-art motion capture technology in Unreal Engine, FIRMWARE is on the cutting-edge of a new kind of film production  - where performances are captured at a comfortable pace in a controlled studio, without the pressures of long hours and a massive production crew.  Every creative decision can be created, tested, and workshopped in post-production, allowing the story to be perfected like never before.

 
FIRMWARE is set in an alternate 1990 where the adoption of nuclear energy never ended.  Somewhere in Eastern Europe, long after civilization has collapsed and national borders have been forgotten, the walled-off "Alcazar Exclusion Zone" has emerged as a small functioning society, a melting pot of survivors from around the world. 

 
Kept together by an authoritarian government, citizens have almost no freedom in their daily lives, and are constantly fed propaganda that justifies military control under the guise of "personal safety."

 
The Inspiration
Although this is an original work of art, as storytellers, we are always inspired by others. The inspirations for FIRMWARE come from real life photos of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone, Half-Life 2, Children of Men, The Last Of Us, and the artwork of Simon Stålenhag.


 

The Studio
I'm excited to announce that we've partnered with Beyond Capture, a full-service performance capture studio in downtown Vancouver (https://www.beyond-capture.com). They will be providing the studio space to capture all the required high fidelity data in order to translate the actor's dialogue, motion capture, and facial performances to their representative CG characters.
Beyond shares a physical space with Vancouver Film School, and strongly believes in opening up the field of motion capture technology to students and independent filmmakers.   



 

Budget and Perks
We've already completed our first motion capture shoot, in which we captured the majority of our background characters. The world that Zariah inhabits, along with a majority of the story's props, have already been modeled, textured, and made ready for animation.  The next phase of the project involves capturing the performance of the main cast.In order to complete this project, we need your help to raise $6000: 

$4000 for production, including studio fees, transportation, and catering.
$1000 for post-production, including visual effects assets and hardware upgrades.
$1000 for festival applications and distribution, to reach audiences worldwide.


Once we reach our goal, any overflow contributions will be used to purchase additional visual effects assets to use in the film, and to give back to both the team at Beyond Capture and to our post-production team, all who are giving their time to be involved. 

Why Support Us?
Empowering and inspiring fellow creators is a passion of mine, and I love to mentor and to share my technical knowledge and skills with others. My goal is to use the unique production process behind FIRMWARE to serve as a learning resource for other filmmakers, using in-depth behind-the-scenes breakdowns of our team's use of a "virtual production" workflow.  I believe that this technology will become an integral part of our industry's future, and will play a vital role in making the filmmaking process more accessible and more enjoyable for all.I'm also a strong believer in representation for all.  Vancouver, BC is an incredibly diverse place, where almost every culture in the world has a voice.  The opportunities made available through my work, both for cast and crew, will represent that.  
The final film will be released for free on YouTube, with 100% of all ad revenue being donated to Global Aid Network, a non-profit organization that provides relief for women living in injustice, poverty, and crisis around the world (https://globalaid.net/). 
Cast & Crew
Director, Writer, VFX | Calvin Romeyn
Producer | Noah Penner
Animation Team | Fred Smith, Will Inglis
Texturing | Francois Van Eeden
Composer | Jose Pavli
Behind The Scenes | Ruby Alstad
Cast | Angel Celiz, Reece Presley, Suksham Shan, Sam Krochmal, Avery Taylor, Miglė Kužmarskytė, Sam Romeyn
 
Performance Capture Team:

story:
***FINAL STRETCH GOAL $260,000***

Help us make the best Sci-Fi Action Film of 2021!

SYNOPSIS:  In 2045 convicted criminals are given the choice of lethal injection or they can compete in the Fight Dome. Contestants have to survive seven arenas with different killers. If anyone survives they win their freedom.

Below are original costumes that were designed for Arena Wars movie by Macabre Intentions. 

Below is the trailer for Night of the Tommyknockers western horror film.  We wrapped production on February 3rd, 2021 and the rough cut has already been assembled.  It's definitely our best movie completed so far.  It will be released world-wide in 2022. 

Below is the trailer for Attack of the Unknown starring Richard Grieco, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  It's now available on all major VOD platforms and on Blu-ray!

Check out these great reviews of Attack of the Unknown!
https://drive.google.com/file/d/14GUto9qb-PR3XzcQnJHo7mWOkHCHOP1V/view?fbclid=IwAR0agqE7jj4uWKwL8lokiHrUIw3FE5gMtA3ObmKV97E4JXT81tc73jhloi8

Below is the teaser for Death Count starring Michael Madsen and Costas Mandylor.  We filmed this during the pandemic and the movie is completely shot and in the can.  The movie has been edited and the only thing that remains is the custom music score and the CGI/VFX work.  It will be completed in approximately 90 days.

Here is the teaser for Bloodthirst starring Costas Mandylor, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  Filming was completed safely during the pandemic and the first cut is done at 96 minutes.  The movie is signed to Hollywood Media Bridge and they got us a deal with Grindhouse/Lionsgate. The movie will be released in Mid-2021 world-wide.  (A final trailer will released next week)

Here is the teaser for Bridge of the Doomed zombie film.  A new trailer will be edited in a month or so.  We hired a new editing company to re-edit the first half of the film.  The same company that edited Night of the Tommyknockers and Bloodthirst is now editing Bridge of the Doomed.  It will be in post production for another 90 days.  There is a lot of extensive CGI/VFX work.  The movie will be released world-wide by end of 2021. 

Bridge of the Doomed was featured on the front page of InkTip Magazine! 

Below is the trailer for Art of the Dead starring Jessica Morris, Tara Reid and Richard Grieco.  Walmart picked up over 16,000 copies of the film.  It was well received by the critics!

Below is the trailer for Bus Party to Hell starring Tara Reid. The movie got in over 18,500 redbox locations around the United States.  It was very well received in the horror community and became a cult classic!

story:
A new father, in the midst of a life altering decision, is sidetracked when his daughter is thrust into his care.

How did it start?

Dimeji wanted to explore a story about the effects trauma has on fathers and the issues they face when attempting to connect with their children. During the pandemic he shared the story with Shola and together, the two of them started writing the script.  We believe that this project is so important. We organized a table read soon after completing the script and the reactions to Malik's story were overwhelming. This story has touched the hearts of so many people who have read the script so far.

What is this film about?

This film is about Malik, a first-time dad, to a beautiful little girl. He is experiencing parenting for the first time with his successful wife. Malik loves his daughter but because of his deep painful trauma he can't bring himself to connect with her. When the film begins Malik is about to make a dark, life-altering decision concerning this, while his daughter is in his care. What he decides to do will not only alter his own life but those around him. As he tries to rise above his own trauma to be a better man and father to his child, we are led to an ending that is unexpected and shocking...yet hopeful.  Your contribution to the making of this film would give a voice to so many new fathers who are not given the space to process their traumas and also talk about the fears they have about fatherhood. We hope to share this film with communities and engage community members in conversations around the challenges with parenting while trying to be the best fathers they can be.

Why do we want to make his film?

This film provides a space to present various issues men face, especially, while navigating expectations thrusted onto them concerning their role as "protector". We want explore the conflict men face balancing vulnerability and masculinity; all while trying to be good fathers to their children. By telling this story we look at the challenges some men experience trying to keep their children safe from a world and experiences that have negatively impacted their fathers and the burden that presents. It provides an opportunity for men of all races to also think about the relationships they have with their children and the desire to protect them from the effects of their own trauma. 

What is the money going to be used for?

In addition to applying for grants and sourcing for in kind donations we are working to raising $10,000 dollars towards the production of this film on Indiegogo.   

With the help of our amazing team of creatives, crew, and actors. We are aiming for a three-day shoot in Orlando, Fl. Our locations are set and our actors are ready to go.

Funding for the film will:

  • Rent equipment (lighting kits, audio equipment, etc.)
  • Secure locations 
  • Pay actors & crew
  • COVID safety (daily masks, renting space to keep people who have been tested)
  • Post-production (color grading and sound mixing specifically)
  • Licenses and insurance
  • Composer
  • Film festival and screenwriting contest entries
  • Refreshments (breakfast, lunch, and dinner)

Who is making this film?

Director/Story Creator /Writer - Oladimeji Ajayi - has been working in the tech industry for over 12 years and is also an Author and Creator under Tell Our Own Tales Production House. This would be his directorial debut and he has two additional scripts he is developing.

Assistant Director/Writer/Producer - Shola Ajayi - is a project developer, part-time lecturer, and filmmaker based in Lagos, Nigeria. She is a 2021 Scriptapalooza Semi-finalist and has had her films featured at the Big Hero Film Festival, Redstone Film Festival, and Sarasota Film Festival, What's Up Africa?, African Independent Television, Channels TV, and Africa Magic.

Director of Photography/Editing - Brandley Jasney -  is an up-and-coming cinematographer who's worked with models, musicians, actors, and directors on small indie projects throughout the Orlando, FL area. His goal is to create powerful images and tell stories that are transformative.

Producer - Breion Moses - is the founder of 7 Hillz Production and a veteran producer based in South Florida. She is an influential force in the film industry in Florida and she will ensure we stick to our budget and follow COVID guidelines on set. 

Producer - Glory Akhere - is a Nigerian born former actress/model and host of TreasHERd, a podcast focused on inspiring and empowering young women. She is based in California and will work with her networks to ensure this film gets seen.

Composer - Noah Lifschey -, Grammy-nominated, and award-winning composer was sold immediately after reading the script and wanted to help bring this strong and unusual story to life with his music.


We want to ensure that everyone is properly compensated and taken care of during the course of this production. We have a few individuals (investors) who have committed to the production of this project​ but we need to raise these funds first.

Other Ways You Can Help

First, thank you! For your desire to support us. Please do not feel like you can't contribute to the success of this project. Even if you can't donate you can help us in other ways:

  • Please share our campaign! Watch, like, share and talk about the campaign video we created.
  • If you have a platform you belong to tell them about our project or if they would love for us to speak about the project let us know.
  • If there is a group that might be interested in screening the film please connect us. Our email address is tellourowntales@gmail.com.
  • Follow us on social media. The productions' social media handle is @TellOurOwnTales on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Through our campaign and social media we will be updating you regularly about our production. As this campaign goes on you will learn more about our crew, our actors and our great team as well as the other group of people joining us to bring Malik's story to the screen.

Thank you!

story:
"So, what the heck is TRIVIAL?"

TRIVIAL is a revenge based horror thriller written and directed by James L. Edwards(HER NAME WAS CHRISTA, BRIMSTONE INCORPORATED) that can best be described as the most twisted gameshow ever aired. Six strangers awaken to find themselves chained to chairs in a makeshift studio and forced into a bizarre televised trivia contest. Get the answers correct, they advance to the next round. Get the answers wrong and suffer grave consequences. 

Our goal is to begin pre-production on the film in fall of this year with a projected release date of spring 2022, We hope to raise $10K on this campaign to put towards the budget. That's where you come in and I gotta tell you, we've got some fantastic perks in store for you.

"Why do you want to make this movie so badly?"

Quite frankly, I'm in love with the story. Since I began directing my own films, I've tried incredibly hard to not only stay within the horror genre, but also add elements of drama and dark comedy within the story. TRIVIAL is no exception, but it also will give me the opportunity to do something extremely gruesome. I believe it's an incredibly unique screenplay and, along with our phenomenally talented cast and crew, will be able to give horror audiences exactly what they have been craving.

"Who stars in this movie?"

Our talented cast features many genre vets including.... 

Sasha Graham

Sasha Graham is a 90's B-movie starlet who has starred in over 20 indie horror flicks. Not your average "final girl," Sasha is usually found playing supernatural creatures like vampires, werewolves, aliens and mafia hit chicks! She starred in Kevin Lindemuth's ADDICTED TO MURDER Trilogy as Angie the bloodthirsty night stalker and as Tarper, the cocaine snorting survivalist in JR Bookwalter's sci-fi action classic POLYMORPH. Sasha is the bestselling author of over ten books and tarot kits, including 365 Tarot Spreads, Llewellyn's Complete Guide to the Rider Waite Smith Tarot and  Dark Wood Tarot. She teaches tarot classes all over the world and produces tarot events at New York City's premier cultural institutions, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Sasha has appeared on film, television, radio and in the New York Times.

James L. Edwards

Starting at the age of 12 with the J.R. Bookwalter directed/Sam Raimi produced THE DEAD NEXT DOOR, James L. Edwards has had a 35+ year career span in indie horror as an actor, screenwriter and producer. His credits include BLOODLETTING, POLYMORPH, ROBOT NINJA, JUNE 9 AND CORDOBA NIGHTS. He was also a contributing writer for Alternative Cinema Magazine as well as Blackest Heart Magazine. In 2020, he released his directorial debut, the romantic drama/necrophile love story hybrid HER NAME WAS CHRISTA. The following year, he directed the horror anthology BRIMSTONE INCORPORATED with co-director Brad Twigg.  

Drew Fortier

Known for his work with such artists as David Ellefson (Megadeth), Bang Tango, and Chuck Mosley (Faith No More), Drew Fortier established himself as a multi-faceted creative force spanning across many mediums. From directing the critically acclaimed rock documentary ATTACK OF LIFE: THE BANG TANGO MOVIE, to joining Bang Tango as a guitarist, Fortier has also starred in the cult horror film HER NAME WAS CHRISTA as well as the critically acclaimed and 14x award-winning no budget found footage horror film DWELLERS which he, apart from starring in, also wrote, directed, and edited.

Tim Novotny

Tim Novotny is an American film actor, writer, composer and director from Ellington, New York. Novotny began his film career as a music composer while working as a part time actor at Kent State University's theatre program from 2008-2012. He has acted in many feature films including RAGMORK, 10/31 PART 2 and the upcoming TV series ST, GABRIEL. He is also the CEO and Producer at his own film company The Novotarian Syndicate based in Akron, Ohio. He’s directed many independent films including VILE PREY, PHARISEE and in production for his latest feature BORN OF MALICE.

Rick Jermain

Baltimore native Rick Jermain is an award-winning actor who has appeared in previous Buffalora films HER NAME WAS CHRISTA and BRIMSTONE INCORPORATED, as well as the cult hits KILLER CAMPOUT, WRESTLEMASSACRE and the upcoming BLOODY SUMMER CAMP with Dave Sheridan and Felissa Rose. A veteran of indie horror since 2013, he has produced, written and/or directed many independent shorts. He is currently starring in and Executive Producing SERIOUS PROFESSION, a crime drama by Key 13 Productions, to be released in 2022. A lifelong musician, Rick also enjoys working in his studio and performing with his band 'The Blacklight Orchestra'.

Adam Scott Clevenger

Since 2014, Adam S. Clevenger has proven himself as a chameleon on the independent movie circuit playing all types of characters ranging from the everyman (PEOPLE TO KILL, of which he also served and writer and director), drugged out thug (PRIMORDIAL), comic relief (YELLOW KING), and Sherriff (BIG TROUBLE IN JACKASS FLATS). His current television and movie projects include ST. GABRIEL, DARHK CITY and THE DYING PLACE. Beyond the screen Adam is proud to roam the Dayton area stage in productions such as NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD LIVE, DESIRE UNDER THE ELMS and STELLA AND LOU.

Douglas Esper

Douglas Esper is an author/musician/actor from Cleveland, Ohio. He recently appeared in the feature films, DWELLERS, THE OTHER SIDE OF DARKNESS and ANATHEMA. His music has recently appeared in the films HER NAME WAS CHRISTA, BRIMSTONE INCORPORATED and THE NUTSHELL, which he also co-directed, co-produced, and acted in. He sings for three bands, Indoria, The Firmary, and Blöd. He played percussion for Chuck Mosley (Faith No More, Bad Brains) until the singer's death in 2017. Douglas has over a dozen publishing credits including his nonfiction book, Reintroducing Chuck Mosley, his novel, A Life Of Inches, and his short story, My Wife's Favorite.

Plus a few more surprises as well!!!!!

"So what exactly is it that you want from us?"

Basically, we need your help to make this film a possibility. Our goal is to raise $10,000 towards the budget of the production. That will assist is covering costs such as paying the cast, securing locations, post production and the eventual manufacturing costs for self distribution of Blu-ray and DVD on our Buffalora Entertainment Group label.

As an incentive to those willing to support the cause, we are offering some amazing perks such as signed Blu-rays and DVD's, special thanks credits, Sasha Graham's own line of signed tarot cards and books and even one of a kind movie props. And if we reach our goal before the deadline, we'll even add more perks in hopes to extend the scope of the production.  

"What are my risks here?"

The majority of those involved in this production have been making independent films for decades. As with any investment, there are always risks involved. That said, we have successfully completed all of our previous productions and  this one will be no exception. We are truly committed to making an incredible film, I assure you, your contribution will go to good use.

"Hey, I'm broke! How else can I help?"

Bottom line, get the word out! Tell a friend. Hell, tell all of your friends. Tell anyone who will listen. Post the Indiegogo link on Facebook and Instagram. Share it with a group. Any amount of press or word of mouth is extremely appreciated. We just want to get this movie made.

Six strangers awaken to find themselves chained to chairs in a makeshift studio and forced into a bizarre televised trivia contest. Get the answers correct, they advance to the next round. Get the answers wrong and suffer grave consequences. 
Our goal is to begin pre-production on the film in fall of this year with a projected release date of spring 2022, We hope to raise $10K on this campaign to put towards the budget. That's where you come in and I gotta tell you, we've got some fantastic perks in store for you.
"Why do you want to make this movie so badly?"
Quite frankly, I'm in love with the story. Since I began directing my own films, I've tried incredibly hard to not only stay within the horror genre, but also add elements of drama and dark comedy within the story. TRIVIAL is no exception, but it also will give me the opportunity to do something extremely gruesome. I believe it's an incredibly unique screenplay and, along with our phenomenally talented cast and crew, will be able to give horror audiences exactly what they have been craving.
"Who stars in this movie?"
Our talented cast features many genre vets including.... 
Sasha Graham

Sasha Graham is a 90's B-movie starlet who has starred in over 20 indie horror flicks. Not your average "final girl," Sasha is usually found playing supernatural creatures like vampires, werewolves, aliens and mafia hit chicks! She starred in Kevin Lindemuth's ADDICTED TO MURDER Trilogy as Angie the bloodthirsty night stalker and as Tarper, the cocaine snorting survivalist in JR Bookwalter's sci-fi action classic POLYMORPH. Sasha is the bestselling author of over ten books and tarot kits, including 365 Tarot Spreads, Llewellyn's Complete Guide to the Rider Waite Smith Tarot and  Dark Wood Tarot. She teaches tarot classes all over the world and produces tarot events at New York City's premier cultural institutions, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Sasha has appeared on film, television, radio and in the New York Times.
James L. Edwards

Starting at the age of 12 with the J.R. Bookwalter directed/Sam Raimi produced THE DEAD NEXT DOOR, James L. Edwards has had a 35+ year career span in indie horror as an actor, screenwriter and producer. His credits include BLOODLETTING, POLYMORPH, ROBOT NINJA, JUNE 9 AND CORDOBA NIGHTS. He was also a contributing writer for Alternative Cinema Magazine as well as Blackest Heart Magazine. In 2020, he released his directorial debut, the romantic drama/necrophile love story hybrid HER NAME WAS CHRISTA. The following year, he directed the horror anthology BRIMSTONE INCORPORATED with co-director Brad Twigg.  
Drew Fortier

Known for his work with such artists as David Ellefson (Megadeth), Bang Tango, and Chuck Mosley (Faith No More), Drew Fortier established himself as a multi-faceted creative force spanning across many mediums. From directing the critically acclaimed rock documentary ATTACK OF LIFE: THE BANG TANGO MOVIE, to joining Bang Tango as a guitarist, Fortier has also starred in the cult horror film HER NAME WAS CHRISTA as well as the critically acclaimed and 14x award-winning no budget found footage horror film DWELLERS which he, apart from starring in, also wrote, directed, and edited.
Tim Novotny

Tim Novotny is an American film actor, writer, composer and director from Ellington, New York. Novotny began his film career as a music composer while working as a part time actor at Kent State University's theatre program from 2008-2012. He has acted in many feature films including RAGMORK, 10/31 PART 2 and the upcoming TV series ST, GABRIEL. He is also the CEO and Producer at his own film company The Novotarian Syndicate based in Akron, Ohio. He’s directed many independent films including VILE PREY, PHARISEE and in production for his latest feature BORN OF MALICE.
Rick Jermain

Baltimore native Rick Jermain is an award-winning actor who has appeared in previous Buffalora films HER NAME WAS CHRISTA and BRIMSTONE INCORPORATED, as well as the cult hits KILLER CAMPOUT, WRESTLEMASSACRE and the upcoming BLOODY SUMMER CAMP with Dave Sheridan and Felissa Rose. A veteran of indie horror since 2013, he has produced, written and/or directed many independent shorts. He is currently starring in and Executive Producing SERIOUS PROFESSION, a crime drama by Key 13 Productions, to be released in 2022. A lifelong musician, Rick also enjoys working in his studio and performing with his band 'The Blacklight Orchestra'.
Adam Scott Clevenger

Since 2014, Adam S. Clevenger has proven himself as a chameleon on the independent movie circuit playing all types of characters ranging from the everyman (PEOPLE TO KILL, of which he also served and writer and director), drugged out thug (PRIMORDIAL), comic relief (YELLOW KING), and Sherriff (BIG TROUBLE IN JACKASS FLATS). His current television and movie projects include ST. GABRIEL, DARHK CITY and THE DYING PLACE. Beyond the screen Adam is proud to roam the Dayton area stage in productions such as NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD LIVE, DESIRE UNDER THE ELMS and STELLA AND LOU.
Douglas Esper

Douglas Esper is an author/musician/actor from Cleveland, Ohio. He recently appeared in the feature films, DWELLERS, THE OTHER SIDE OF DARKNESS and ANATHEMA. His music has recently appeared in the films HER NAME WAS CHRISTA, BRIMSTONE INCORPORATED and THE NUTSHELL, which he also co-directed, co-produced, and acted in. He sings for three bands, Indoria, The Firmary, and Blöd. He played percussion for Chuck Mosley (Faith No More, Bad Brains) until the singer's death in 2017. Douglas has over a dozen publishing credits including his nonfiction book, Reintroducing Chuck Mosley, his novel, A Life Of Inches, and his short story, My Wife's Favorite.
Plus a few more surprises as well!!!!!
"So what exactly is it that you want from us?"

Basically, we need your help to make this film a possibility. Our goal is to raise $10,000 towards the budget of the production. That will assist is covering costs such as paying the cast, securing locations, post production and the eventual manufacturing costs for self distribution of Blu-ray and DVD on our Buffalora Entertainment Group label.
As an incentive to those willing to support the cause, we are offering some amazing perks such as signed Blu-rays and DVD's, special thanks credits, Sasha Graham's own line of signed tarot cards and books and even one of a kind movie props. And if we reach our goal before the deadline, we'll even add more perks in hopes to extend the scope of the production.  

"What are my risks here?"
The majority of those involved in this production have been making independent films for decades. As with any investment, there are always risks involved. That said, we have successfully completed all of our previous productions and  this one will be no exception. We are truly committed to making an incredible film, I assure you, your contribution will go to good use.

"Hey, I'm broke! How else can I help?"
Bottom line, get the word out! Tell a friend. Hell, tell all of your friends. Tell anyone who will listen. Post the Indiegogo link on Facebook and Instagram. Share it with a group. Any amount of press or word of mouth is extremely appreciated. We just want to get this movie made.

story:
Sweethearts, Viktoria, and Mason, are down on their luck and broke with a new baby to take care of. The couple is about to be evicted when Viktoria finds out she has inherited an old farmhouse from a distant relative. Time is not on their side and they have to sign the contract sight-unseen.

Is it a deal with the Devil? Would you do it? What could possibly go wrong?

It seems like an answer to their desperate prayers, so the young couple takes the deal.  They will soon realize that the blackened soul of the relative,  a maniacal witch, still haunts the home... and has other, much more sinister plans in store for them. 

Will they live a happily ever after... or will they end up paying the ultimate, unimaginable price?

 

THE CAST

story:
**FINAL STRETCH GOAL $230,000* 

MOVIE SYNOPSIS:

When miners blast for gold in 1856, they accidentally release ancient creatures known as Tommyknockers! The Town of Deer Creek, Nevada is soon under siege with only a handful of survivors held up in the local saloon. Things go from bad to worse when a gang of criminals on the run from a famous bounty hunter arrive in the town to rob the bank. Now everyone is trapped in a deadly battle against these blood-thirsty monsters, each other and their own greed in this ultimate Horror Western showdown.

 

 

Below is the trailer for Attack of the Unknown starring Richard Grieco, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  It's now available on all major VOD platforms and on Blu-ray!
Check out these great reviews of Attack of the Unknown!
http://drive.google.com/file/d/14GUto9qb-PR3XzcQnJHo7mWOkHCHOP1V/view?fbclid=IwAR0agqE7jj4uWKwL8lokiHrUIw3FE5gMtA3ObmKV97E4JXT81tc73jhloi8
 

 
Below is the teaser for Death Count starring Michael Madsen and Costas Mandylor.  We filmed this during the pandemic and the movie is completely shot and in the can.  We currently have 20 minutes of the 90 minute feature edited.  It will be finished in post production within 90 days and released/distributed in late 2021 world-wide.  (A final trailer will be released in late January) 
 

Below is the temporary poster in for Death Count.  A new one is currently in the works. 
 
Here is the teaser for Bloodthirst starring Costas Mandylor, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  Filming was completed safely during the pandemic and the first cut is done at 96 minutes.  The movie is signed to Hollywood Media Bridge and they got us a deal with Grindhouse/Lionsgate. The movie will be released in Mid-2021 world-wide.  (A final trailer will be made in a month or so)
 

Here is the teaser for Bridge of the Doomed zombie film.  We just filmed two pick up days in October 2020.   We filmed more zombie crowd shots, soldiers killing zombies and survivors killing zombies, etc.  The movie was already edited and these additional scenes are being edited in. The movie will be released world-wide in Summer of 2021.

Bridge of the Doomed was featured on the front page of InkTip Magazine! 

Below is the trailer for Art of the Dead starring Jessica Morris, Tara Reid and Richard Grieco.  Walmart picked up over 16,000 copies of the film.  It was well received by the critics!

Below is the trailer for Bus Party to Hell starring Tara Reid. The movie got in over 18,500 redbox locations around the United States.  It was very well received in the horror community and became a cult classic!

story:
***FINAL STRETCH GOAL $65,000***

We wrapped production of Night of the Tommyknockers on February 3rd, 2021.  We shot a total of 17 days and the entire movie is shot and in the can.  We need your help to raise an additional $65,000 to complete post-production of the film.  This includes all the editing of the film, custom music scoring, sound mixing, color correction, ADR and CGI work. This is a 10 day indiegogo campaign. 

 

Click the link below to see hundreds of still grabs from the movie:  

http://www.facebook.com/media/set?vanity=michael.mahal&set=a.10164931885900595

 

When miners blast for gold in 1856, they accidentally release ancient creatures known as Tommyknockers! The Town of Deer Creek, Nevada is soon under siege with only a handful of survivors held up in the local saloon. Things go from bad to worse when a gang of criminals on the run from a famous bounty hunter arrive in the town to rob the bank. Now everyone is trapped in a deadly battle against these blood-thirsty monsters, each other and their own greed in this ultimate Horror Western showdown.

Below is the trailer for Attack of the Unknown starring Richard Grieco, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  It's now available on all major VOD platforms and on Blu-ray!

 

Check out these great reviews of Attack of the Unknown!

http://drive.google.com/file/d/14GUto9qb-PR3XzcQnJHo7mWOkHCHOP1V/view?fbclid=IwAR0agqE7jj4uWKwL8lokiHrUIw3FE5gMtA3ObmKV97E4JXT81tc73jhloi8

Below is the teaser for Death Count starring Michael Madsen and Costas Mandylor.  The rough cut was just completed 2/17/2021.  It still needs CGI work, custom music scoring, color correction and ADR work.  It will be in post approximately another three to four months. 

Below is the temporary poster in for Death Count.  A new one is currently in the works and will be released within a week. 

Here is the teaser for Bloodthirst starring Costas Mandylor, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  The complete edit is done and we have delivered the files to the distributor for world-wide release.  The movie is signed to Hollywood Media Bridge and they got us a deal with Grindhouse/Lionsgate. The movie will be released in late 2021.  (A final trailer will be made in a month or so)

Here is the teaser for Bridge of the Doomed zombie film.  We just filmed two pick up days in October 2020.   We filmed more zombie crowd shots, soldiers killing zombies and survivors killing zombies, etc.  The edit has been completed and we are in the final stages of post production.  All there is left to do is CGI work and the custom music scoring.  Bridge of the Doomed will be released world-wide in October 2021. 

Bridge of the Doomed was featured on the front page of InkTip Magazine! 

Below is the trailer for Art of the Dead starring Jessica Morris, Tara Reid and Richard Grieco.  Walmart picked up over 16,000 copies of the film.  It was well received by the critics!

 

Below is the trailer for Bus Party to Hell starring Tara Reid. The movie got in over 18,500 redbox locations around the United States.  It was very well received in the horror community and became a cult classic!
