story:
España, la primera globalización

España, la primera globalización  es un proyecto de documental de 90 minutos, producido por López-Li Films con la colaboración de diversos historiadores españoles y extranjeros de reconocido prestigio, que contará la contribución hispana a la era de los descubrimientos y la primera globalización. Pretendemos mostrar aspectos poco conocidos de la historia de España y del mundo hispano en general, como su papel pionero, junto con Portugal, en el surgimiento de una economía global y al mismo tiempo dar a conocer otros aspectos poco tratados como el desarrollo urbanístico o la revolución alimenticia.

La gigantesca batalla propagandística que durante varios siglos provocó la hegemonía de ese imperio (quizás “la primera de la Historia” en palabras del historiador inglés Nigel Townson) ha contribuido a fijar unos estereotipos negativos que se centran en una serie de temas (Inquisición, conquista, incultura, decadencia, incompetencia económica, etcétera) de tintes tan siniestros que han provocado el rechazo de españoles e hispanos de su propia historia. Es un fenómeno histórico y social las consecuencias siguen afectando hoy gravemente a la comunidad panhispánica.

La expansión de la Monarquía hispánica hizo posible la exploración  del Atlántico y el Pacífico, que se cambiaran las coordenadas espacio-temporales del planeta y se modificaran los mapas del mundo entero para siempre en todos los continentes. Por primera vez se conectó Asia, con América y Europa a través de rutas nunca antes empleadas, provocando una revolución económica a través del eje Manila-Acapulco-Veracruz-Sevilla que solo ahora estamos empezando a conocer en toda su amplitud. Esta increíble aventura humana es la que queremos contar.

 

Nuestra película

Hemos acudido a entidades e instituciones que pueden estar interesadas en apoyar el proyecto, pero para llevar a cabo un buen puerto la película necesitamos terminarla con la ayuda de particulares.

Es muy importante que esta película la hagamos entre todos aquellos españoles e hispanos que queremos conocer mejor nuestra historia compartida , que sentimos la necesidad de una divulgación histórica rigurosa y emocionante como un factor de amistad y progreso en la búsqueda de un futuro mejor.

Por eso, más allá del objetivo de recaudación, para los que la realizamos está el deseo de llegar a todas esas personas a las que les gustaría decir que  España, la primera globalización  es también su película.

 

El equipo

España, la primera globalización  está desarrollada por  López-Li Films , productora que cuenta con  más de 20 años de experiencia en películas y series documentales . Ha recibido, entre otros premios, tres Goya, un Ondas y una nominación a los EMMY, y sus películas han sido seleccionadas en festivales de todo el mundo: Berlín, Venecia, Nueva York, San Francisco, Buenos Aires, San Sebastián, Londres, Toronto; y emitidas en TVE, Movistar +, Tele 5, Arte, BBC, Swiss TV.

Está dirigido por  José Luis López-Linares , director, productor y director de fotografía. Su carrera comprende tres décadas y más de ochenta documentales. Como director de fotografía ha trabajado con Víctor Erice, Carlos Saura, Isabel Coixet o Fernando Trueba.

Y contará con la intervención de historiadores de prestigio como  Miguel Ángel Ladero Quesada, Elvira Roca Barea, Carmen Iglesias, Huiling Luo, Marcelo Gullo, Ricardo García Cárcel, Nigel Townson, Martín Ríos Saloma, Luis Ribot o Jaime Contreras .

 

Estado del proyecto

Nuestro documental lleva 8 meses en producción . Hemos rodado en Madrid, Sevilla, Salamanca, Valladolid, Córdoba, Toledo, Guipúzcoa, Cuidad de México y Guadalajara (México), Buenos Aires (Argentina), Santo Domingo (República Dominicana), Amsterdam y Delft (Holanda); y hemos entrevistado a más de 30 historiadores, académicos y conservadores. Abordar la compleja historia de un imperio gigantesco que cambió la faz del mundo exige una calidad y un rigor especial, y está resultando una labor ardua y apasionante.

El presupuesto estimado es 310.000 €, de los cuales hemos conseguido 210.000 € contando con la aportación de TVE, Comunidad de Madrid, y adelantos de distribución.

Queremos completar los 100.000€ que faltan con la ayuda de esta colecta.

El dinero que recaudemos con esta campaña lo destinaremos a:

  • Edición y posproducción. Editar un documental con más 100 horas sólo de entrevistas es un proceso laborioso que dura meses.
  • Compra de derechos de imágenes de películas y archivos audiovisuales.
  • Licencias musicales para la banda sonora.
  • Organizar estrenos (dependiendo del número de patrocinadores que compren entradas).

 

La distribución de la película fuera de España está garantizada por la distribuidora internacional Latido Films, en cines de territorio nacional por Versión Digital, y TVE ha adquirido los derechos de emisión en abierto.

 

Recompensas

Además de ofreceros la película online o en DVD o Blu-ray, tenemos para los más ávidos de historia unas hispanísimas recompensas:

Paquete CIUDAD DE MANILA

Disfruta con un acompañante del estreno en salas de la película. Obtendrás además un enlace privado para verla en casa cuando quieras y un DVD o Blu-ray firmado por el director y Elvira Roca.

Paquete JUAN SEBASTIÁN ELCANO

Te agradeceremos tu participación incluyendo tu nombre en los créditos de la película. Incluye todo lo anterior: dos entradas para el pre-estreno, DVD o Blu-Ray y Elvira Roca, enlace privado y agradecimiento en créditos.

Paquete DOÑA MARINA (¡NUEVO!)

Cuatro películas firmadas por su director José Luis López-Linares: Altamira, el origen del arte, Jerez y el misterio del palo cortado, Jaén, virgen y extra, y la ganadora al Goya al mejor documental 2004 Un instante en la vida ajena.

Cuatro grandes películas que ponen en relieve el patrimonio cultural español, y que tienen el sello y la sensibilidad inconfundibles del director pionero en España del cine documental.

Incluye todas las recompensas anteriores*: dos entradas para el pre-estreno, DVD/Blu-Ray firmado por el director y Elvira Roca, enlace privado y agradecimiento en créditos.

* Los paquetes Inca Garcilaso y Felipe II también incluirán esta recompensa.

Paquete HERNÁN CORTÉS (AGOTADO)

12 fotografías digitales, hechas por José Luis López-Linares, de cuadros y documentos fundamentales de la historia del Imperio español, a una súper resolución de hasta 102 megapíxeles que permite verlos con un detalle sin precedentes.

Enconchado Conquista de México, autor anónimo. Museo de América.

Detalle.

Incluye además todo lo anterior: dos entradas para el pre-estreno, DVD/Blu-Ray firmado por el director y Elvira Roca, enlace privado y agradecimiento en créditos.

Paquete INCA GARCILASO

Organiza una proyección del documental y cuenta con la presencia de Elvira Roca Barea y José Luis López-Linares para presentar la película, responder a preguntas y por supuesto firmar libros y DVDs. Cederemos los derechos de reproducción, y el lugar y la asistencia del evento quedan a la elección del patrocinador.

Especialmente interesante para instituciones, pero igualmente válido para particulares con muchos amigos.

Incluye todas las recompensas anteriores (también las cuatro películas de José Luis). No están incluidos los gastos de desplazamiento.

Paquete FELIPE II

Para aquellos particulares que quieran convertirse en máximos patrocinadores de nuestro documental tenemos preparado:

  • Figurar en los créditos de la película como Productor asociado.
  • Una cena para dos personas con José Luis López-Linares, Elvira Roca Barea y Pedro Insua .
  • Un pase privado del documental con el equipo de López-Li Films.
  • Una visita a la productora para asistir durante un día al proceso de edición .
  • Todas las recompensas anteriores: cuatro películas de López-Li films, dos entradas para el pre-estreno, fotografías, Blu-Ray o DVD firmado y enlace al documental.

Los gastos de la cena están incluidos.

 

Contacto

Para cualquier duda sobre la película o esta campaña no dudéis en escribirnos a esp1glob@lopezlifilms.com .

Gracias por vuestra atención. Nos vemos en las Indias.
story_txt:
España, la primera globalizaciónEspaña, la primera globalización  es un proyecto de documental de 90 minutos, producido por López-Li Films con la colaboración de diversos historiadores españoles y extranjeros de reconocido prestigio, que contará la contribución hispana a la era de los descubrimientos y la primera globalización. Pretendemos mostrar aspectos poco conocidos de la historia de España y del mundo hispano en general, como su papel pionero, junto con Portugal, en el surgimiento de una economía global y al mismo tiempo dar a conocer otros aspectos poco tratados como el desarrollo urbanístico o la revolución alimenticia.La gigantesca batalla propagandística que durante varios siglos provocó la hegemonía de ese imperio (quizás “la primera de la Historia” en palabras del historiador inglés Nigel Townson) ha contribuido a fijar unos estereotipos negativos que se centran en una serie de temas (Inquisición, conquista, incultura, decadencia, incompetencia económica, etcétera) de tintes tan siniestros que han provocado el rechazo de españoles e hispanos de su propia historia. Es un fenómeno histórico y social las consecuencias siguen afectando hoy gravemente a la comunidad panhispánica.La expansión de la Monarquía hispánica hizo posible la exploración  del Atlántico y el Pacífico, que se cambiaran las coordenadas espacio-temporales del planeta y se modificaran los mapas del mundo entero para siempre en todos los continentes. Por primera vez se conectó Asia, con América y Europa a través de rutas nunca antes empleadas, provocando una revolución económica a través del eje Manila-Acapulco-Veracruz-Sevilla que solo ahora estamos empezando a conocer en toda su amplitud. Esta increíble aventura humana es la que queremos contar. Nuestra películaHemos acudido a entidades e instituciones que pueden estar interesadas en apoyar el proyecto, pero para llevar a cabo un buen puerto la película necesitamos terminarla con la ayuda de particulares.Es muy importante que esta película la hagamos entre todos aquellos españoles e hispanos que queremos conocer mejor nuestra historia compartida , que sentimos la necesidad de una divulgación histórica rigurosa y emocionante como un factor de amistad y progreso en la búsqueda de un futuro mejor.Por eso, más allá del objetivo de recaudación, para los que la realizamos está el deseo de llegar a todas esas personas a las que les gustaría decir que  España, la primera globalización  es también su película. El equipoEspaña, la primera globalización  está desarrollada por  López-Li Films , productora que cuenta con  más de 20 años de experiencia en películas y series documentales . Ha recibido, entre otros premios, tres Goya, un Ondas y una nominación a los EMMY, y sus películas han sido seleccionadas en festivales de todo el mundo: Berlín, Venecia, Nueva York, San Francisco, Buenos Aires, San Sebastián, Londres, Toronto; y emitidas en TVE, Movistar +, Tele 5, Arte, BBC, Swiss TV.Está dirigido por  José Luis López-Linares , director, productor y director de fotografía. Su carrera comprende tres décadas y más de ochenta documentales. Como director de fotografía ha trabajado con Víctor Erice, Carlos Saura, Isabel Coixet o Fernando Trueba.Y contará con la intervención de historiadores de prestigio como  Miguel Ángel Ladero Quesada, Elvira Roca Barea, Carmen Iglesias, Huiling Luo, Marcelo Gullo, Ricardo García Cárcel, Nigel Townson, Martín Ríos Saloma, Luis Ribot o Jaime Contreras . 
Estado del proyecto
Nuestro documental lleva 8 meses en producción . Hemos rodado en Madrid, Sevilla, Salamanca, Valladolid, Córdoba, Toledo, Guipúzcoa, Cuidad de México y Guadalajara (México), Buenos Aires (Argentina), Santo Domingo (República Dominicana), Amsterdam y Delft (Holanda); y hemos entrevistado a más de 30 historiadores, académicos y conservadores. Abordar la compleja historia de un imperio gigantesco que cambió la faz del mundo exige una calidad y un rigor especial, y está resultando una labor ardua y apasionante.El presupuesto estimado es 310.000 €, de los cuales hemos conseguido 210.000 € contando con la aportación de TVE, Comunidad de Madrid, y adelantos de distribución.Queremos completar los 100.000€ que faltan con la ayuda de esta colecta.El dinero que recaudemos con esta campaña lo destinaremos a:
Edición y posproducción. Editar un documental con más 100 horas sólo de entrevistas es un proceso laborioso que dura meses.
Compra de derechos de imágenes de películas y archivos audiovisuales.
Licencias musicales para la banda sonora.
Organizar estrenos (dependiendo del número de patrocinadores que compren entradas).
 La distribución de la película fuera de España está garantizada por la distribuidora internacional Latido Films, en cines de territorio nacional por Versión Digital, y TVE ha adquirido los derechos de emisión en abierto. RecompensasAdemás de ofreceros la película online o en DVD o Blu-ray, tenemos para los más ávidos de historia unas hispanísimas recompensas:Paquete CIUDAD DE MANILADisfruta con un acompañante del estreno en salas de la película. Obtendrás además un enlace privado para verla en casa cuando quieras y un DVD o Blu-ray firmado por el director y Elvira Roca.Paquete JUAN SEBASTIÁN ELCANOTe agradeceremos tu participación incluyendo tu nombre en los créditos de la película. Incluye todo lo anterior: dos entradas para el pre-estreno, DVD o Blu-Ray y Elvira Roca, enlace privado y agradecimiento en créditos.Paquete DOÑA MARINA (¡NUEVO!)Cuatro películas firmadas por su director José Luis López-Linares: Altamira, el origen del arte, Jerez y el misterio del palo cortado, Jaén, virgen y extra, y la ganadora al Goya al mejor documental 2004 Un instante en la vida ajena.Cuatro grandes películas que ponen en relieve el patrimonio cultural español, y que tienen el sello y la sensibilidad inconfundibles del director pionero en España del cine documental.Incluye todas las recompensas anteriores*: dos entradas para el pre-estreno, DVD/Blu-Ray firmado por el director y Elvira Roca, enlace privado y agradecimiento en créditos.* Los paquetes Inca Garcilaso y Felipe II también incluirán esta recompensa.Paquete HERNÁN CORTÉS (AGOTADO)12 fotografías digitales, hechas por José Luis López-Linares, de cuadros y documentos fundamentales de la historia del Imperio español, a una súper resolución de hasta 102 megapíxeles que permite verlos con un detalle sin precedentes.Enconchado Conquista de México, autor anónimo. Museo de América.Detalle.Incluye además todo lo anterior: dos entradas para el pre-estreno, DVD/Blu-Ray firmado por el director y Elvira Roca, enlace privado y agradecimiento en créditos.Paquete INCA GARCILASOOrganiza una proyección del documental y cuenta con la presencia de Elvira Roca Barea y José Luis López-Linares para presentar la película, responder a preguntas y por supuesto firmar libros y DVDs. Cederemos los derechos de reproducción, y el lugar y la asistencia del evento quedan a la elección del patrocinador.Especialmente interesante para instituciones, pero igualmente válido para particulares con muchos amigos.Incluye todas las recompensas anteriores (también las cuatro películas de José Luis). No están incluidos los gastos de desplazamiento.Paquete FELIPE IIPara aquellos particulares que quieran convertirse en máximos patrocinadores de nuestro documental tenemos preparado:
Figurar en los créditos de la película como Productor asociado.
Una cena para dos personas con José Luis López-Linares, Elvira Roca Barea y Pedro Insua .
Un pase privado del documental con el equipo de López-Li Films.
Una visita a la productora para asistir durante un día al proceso de edición .
Todas las recompensas anteriores: cuatro películas de López-Li films, dos entradas para el pre-estreno, fotografías, Blu-Ray o DVD firmado y enlace al documental.
Los gastos de la cena están incluidos. ContactoPara cualquier duda sobre la película o esta campaña no dudéis en escribirnos a esp1glob@lopezlifilms.com .Gracias por vuestra atención. Nos vemos en las Indias.

story:
**STRETCH GOAL NOW $70,000!**  We completed sixteen days of principle photography for Arena Wars in early June 2021.  The entire movie is shot and in the can.  We just need your help to raise an additional $70,000 to complete post-production of the film!

SYNOPSIS:  In 2045 convicted criminals are given the choice of lethal injection or they can compete in the Fight Dome. Contestants have to survive seven arenas with different killers. If anyone survives they win their freedom.

Below is the trailer for Night of the Tommyknockers western horror film.  We wrapped production on February 3rd, 2021 and the first cut has already been assembled.  It will be released world-wide in 2022. 

Below is the trailer for Attack of the Unknown starring Richard Grieco, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  It's now available on all major VOD platforms and on Blu-ray!  It was released in over 22 countries on a deal with Fox Network Asia.  Sony Pictures in Germany is about to release the movie as well. 

Check out these great reviews of Attack of the Unknown!
https://drive.google.com/file/d/14GUto9qb-PR3XzcQnJHo7mWOkHCHOP1V/view?fbclid=IwAR0agqE7jj4uWKwL8lokiHrUIw3FE5gMtA3ObmKV97E4JXT81tc73jhloi8

Below is the teaser for Death Count starring Michael Madsen and Costas Mandylor.  We filmed this during the pandemic and the movie is completely shot and in the can.  The movie has been edited and the only thing that remains is the custom music score and the CGI/VFX work.  It will be completed in approximately 90 days.

 

Here is the teaser for Bloodthirst starring Costas Mandylor, Robert LaSardo and Tara Reid.  The movie got a Lionsgate deal and will be released later this year in 2021.  We are just waiting for the release date from Lionsgate.  

 

Here is the teaser for Bridge of the Doomed zombie film.  A new trailer will be edited in a month or so.  We hired a new editing company to re-edit the first half of the film.  The same company that edited Night of the Tommyknockers and Bloodthirst is now editing Bridge of the Doomed.  It will be in post production for another 90 days.  There is a lot of extensive CGI/VFX work.  The movie will be released world-wide by end of 2021. 

Bridge of the Doomed was featured on the front page of InkTip Magazine! 

Below is the trailer for Art of the Dead starring Jessica Morris, Tara Reid and Richard Grieco.  Walmart picked up over 16,000 copies of the film.  It was well received by the critics!

 

Below is the trailer for Bus Party to Hell starring Tara Reid. The movie got in over 18,500 redbox locations around the United States.  It was very well received in the horror community and became a cult classic!  It's also available on EPIX network.

story:
**FINAL STRETCH GOAL $70,000**

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE VAMPIRE FILM HISTORY!  Help us raise the final $70,000 needed to finish post production of the film. When COVID hit and we delayed production for three months.  We were able to resume production and complete filming safely during the pandemic.  We already completed all 17 days of principal photography.   The movie is completely shot and in the can because of you! We need your help to raise an additional $70,000 to finish the film.  This is the best indie vampire film of 2020!  Contribute and help us make history!

 

 
SYNOPSIS: 

In a post apocalyptic world run by vampires, only the strong survive. John Shepard, Vampire Hunter, is one of them. John has to track down and eliminate the master vampire before he himself gets turned.

Be a part of a fresh and original story and help us bring this vision to the big screen!

Producers Michael and Sonny Mahal, following in the success of their recent films "Bridge of the Doomed" starring Michael Pare and Robert LaSardo, "Attack of the Unknown starring Robert LaSardo, Richard Grieco and Tara Reid" “Bus Party To Hell” starring Tara Reid and "Art of the Dead" starring Richard Grieco and Tara Reid, they are ready to conquer the world of horror and thrills again with “Bloodthirst”. With a passion for bringing new and exciting stories to the big screen while expanding the scope of filming in the Vegas Community, Michael and Sonny will once again knock this production out of the park!

Here is the 90 second official trailer for Attack of the Unknown.  The film gets released world-wide on VOD platforms 8/28/20 and gets released on DVD and select theaters on 10/27/20.

 

 

 

Here is the official trailer for "Art of the Dead" horror film starring Tara Reid and Richard Grieco. This film is currently distributed world-wide and is available for purchase at Walmart nationwide (Walmart bought over 16,000 copies of the film alone) 

 

Here is the teaser for Bridge of the Doomed starring Michael Pare and Robert LaSardo. This film will be distributed world-wide in October 2020. 

 

 

Bus Party to Hell was distributed world-wide by Gravitas Ventures. We got in 18,500 redbox locations which is every other Redbox in the United States of America.

story:
We are raising money for our production of "The Door", a short film filled with adventure and mystery. This short film will be filmed in Pennsylvania. These funds will specifically be used to alleviate production costs as well as post-production costs. We are aiming for a total budget of $6,000. 

Currently, we are at the end of our development stage moving into our pre-production phase.  We anticipate production taking place between August - October with a premiere scheduled for the Summer of 2022. 

Through this campaign, we are hoping to raise $4,000, by asking you to donate. Can’t spare a penny? There are other ways you can help like sharing our link on Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, or wherever your heart desires. Every share helps!

 

 

After receiving a mysterious key from her deceased mother, Penny and her friend Ben are on the run from the government, when they teleport into a deadly forest, known as the only path to the source of magic itself. Unbeknownst to them, they have been tracked by Alixis, a rouge agent hellbent on revenge.

Led by a talisman, a key, and a map, Penny adventures into the woods to find the mystical Door and learn about its mystical powers.

But all is not as it seems when a vengeful mystic remerges to create chaos. 

 

 

My team has shown the ability to be efficient with any budget that we have, using connections within our network to mitigate costs. 

Film production is no joke! So we wanted to create a concept piece to show the validity of our idea and there's a lot that goes into making this dream everything it could be, and we can't do that without your help. These necessities include but are not limited to:

  • Payment for crew and actors
  • Delicious food for our shooting days
  • Transportations and locations
  • Equipment and rentals
  • and so much more!

To make this project a success, we will be reaching to achieve a proper Visual Effect Post Production process. That means collaborating with a more established VFX team. 

You'll also be helping us develop even more filmmaking skills allowing us to up our production value as we plan to rent work with more established visual teams to ensure the highest quality possible.

We will also be able to feed and pay those that take time out of their day to help bring this story to life. 

Your donations will help us make a killer production we can all be proud of creating. We're excited to share the final product that you will have made possible!

Reach out to us for more information at darkmindproductions.collab@gmail.com.

 

 

Our biggest roadblock is funding.  2020 was hard on many people. This makes people hesitant to donate for good reason. The way we aim to combat some of that anxiety is by being fiscally sponsored. 

We successfully acquired a fiscal sponsorship with From The Heart Productions as we crowdfund our project. This makes it easier for people to donate to our project.

From the Heart Productions, Inc. is honored to provide fiscal sponsorship for the film The Door.

Please make check donations payable to From the Heart Productions, and indicate the name of the film "The Door" on the memo line. Mail your check to:

From The Heart Productions
1013 Harbor Ave. #53
Oxnard, CA 93035

If you have any other questions, please contact us at info@fromtheheartproductions.com.
We are proud to endorse this project and encourage you to support it.

We have always valued working within the community, and that includes businesses like yours!

That's why we have teamed up with From The Heart Productions and are now fiscally sponsored! This sponsorship allows us to reach out and work with businesses and organizations in the community. We intend to work closely with many different small businesses, including some upcoming perks from our good friends at Dark Mind Productions, LLC.

Stay tuned.

From the Heart Productions is dedicated to helping independent filmmakers with unique films that contribute to society get their films funded.

 

 

We love collaborating and to us that means reciprocation. That's why, with every donation, we plan on giving back as well, whether that means dedicated credits so everyone knows you were a part of this from the very beginning, film props signed by the cast and crew, first look premiere event invitations and so much more! 

We also have plans to partner with multiple local businesses to help build the local economy after such a devastating year. This will allow us to give back to not only the local community but small businesses that truly need support. 

 

 

This film will be produced by Dark Mind Productions, LLC. 

Dark Mind Productions, LLC. is dedicated to helping independent filmmakers and content creators, with unique films and stories that contribute to society, get their ideas made. The films can be narrative, documentaries, short films, and web series with compelling stories told with passion.

​To help filmmakers, Dark Mind Productions offers assistance from development to pre-production and all the way to the final product. Dark Mind Productions, LLC. aims to create a community of artists and creators. Our mission is to create entertaining and inspiring stories that better the understanding of the human experience.

 

 

Pablo Lopez graduated with a BA in Film and Video Production from the Donald P. Bellisario College of Communications. Pablo shines as the Creative Director for Dark Mind Productions, his own independent film company. But why Dark Mind?

On his journey, Pablo suffered a lot throughout his life, including a near-death experience that changed his perspective on life. 

Being diagnosed with PTSD in 2017 he decided to build his own brand with Dark Mind Productions, where he can explain his own fears and insecurities through his own original content, some of which have garnered festival selections and awards. He also plans to use the production company to help rising female and POC filmmakers. 

 

 

Abigail Wilson is a short-form narrative producer with Dark Mind Productions, as well as a full-time television producer and editor. She specializes in live production/broadcast, motion graphics, and documentary-style content. She is a graduate of the Penn State University Bellisario College of Communications with a BA in Film and Video Production.

She also holds a 2016 Mid-Atlantic Regional Emmy from the National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences for her 2015 student film, Carrie Hope, in the category "College/University Student Production Long Form - Fiction,” as well as an Award of Excellence in the Narrative category from the Broadcast Education Association in its 2016 Super-Regional Creative Works competition.

 

 

Remington Daron is a cinematographer with a keen eye for cinematic framing. He is familiar with filming in outdoor locations as well as being versed in Visual effects and Post Production. His experience and passion to create visual stories are a huge benefit to the crew!

"My biggest dream as an artist is to create new worlds for myself and others to explore through the visual medium of film. I enjoy exploring new and old technologies and techniques, constantly developing my skill sets in order to give myself the most tools available on any production. This allows me to be the best filmmaker I can be while also allowing me to let my imagination run wild."

 

 

Tiffany Breon is a graduate of the Donald P. Bellisario College of Communications at Penn State with a focus in Film-Video and a minor in English. S

he specializes in editing, cinematography, producing & set design. She enjoys documentary-style productions and recently had a documentary, BAD BONES, premiere in New York City at the Midnight Film Festival in January 2019 and also in Lisbon, Portugal in March of 2019 at the Lisbon Film Rendezvous.

She has worked on a few narratives and experimental shorts along with Dark Mind Productions such as RADIANCE, OBLIVION, and the ongoing MR. BEAR series.

 

ADDITIONAL CREW:

Script Editor - Taliya Riesterer, @TmGreyPhotography

Concept Art - Olivia Mullens, @LivalittleArtsy

Photography - Jalen Martin, @jalengregoryphotography

Music - Tyler Wilkins, @TJWilkinsMusic

Script Doctor - Emily Laird

 

 

1) Every donation made is going to be used in ways that utilize the local businesses where we intend to film as well as giving exposure to the area as more tourism begins opening back up.

2) You'll be helping us feed the cast and crew to no expense to them, as well as allowing us to expand and develop our skills. Your support really rocks, seriously. So thank you.

3) We have always been fans of the adventure genre.

Whether it be Indiana Jones or Back to The Future, adventure films have always been fun to us. We wanted to create a story with its own world and its own mythology behind it but has these characters really rooted into its history like Indiana Jones or Harry Potter. It’s a mash-up of those two mediums. The heart and the charm. 

Diversity will also be forward-facing. We hope to create an adventure of the magical world using the lens of a female perspective and BIPOC stories with world-building, which we hope will flip the anticipated story tropes, and explore other stories within established genre types. However, this still a story about closure and about the acceptance of death, even when you have the ability to reverse it.

We also believe this will give a new set of adventures to a younger generation. We think this could lead to more stories and adventures from the perspectives of the underdogs and is just the building block for a grand world that we hope to continue sharing with you throughout the years, but first, we want to prove we can do it. With your help, we will be one step closer.

Please make check donations payable to From the Heart Productions, and indicate the name of the film "The Door" on the memo line. Mail your check to:
From The Heart Productions1013 Harbor Ave. #53Oxnard, CA 93035
If you have any other questions, please contact us at info@fromtheheartproductions.com.We are proud to endorse this project and encourage you to support it.
We have always valued working within the community, and that includes businesses like yours!
That's why we have teamed up with From The Heart Productions and are now fiscally sponsored! This sponsorship allows us to reach out and work with businesses and organizations in the community. We intend to work closely with many different small businesses, including some upcoming perks from our good friends at Dark Mind Productions, LLC.
Stay tuned.
From the Heart Productions is dedicated to helping independent filmmakers with unique films that contribute to society get their films funded.
 

 
We love collaborating and to us that means reciprocation. That's why, with every donation, we plan on giving back as well, whether that means dedicated credits so everyone knows you were a part of this from the very beginning, film props signed by the cast and crew, first look premiere event invitations and so much more! 
We also have plans to partner with multiple local businesses to help build the local economy after such a devastating year. This will allow us to give back to not only the local community but small businesses that truly need support. 
 

 
This film will be produced by Dark Mind Productions, LLC. 
Dark Mind Productions, LLC. is dedicated to helping independent filmmakers and content creators, with unique films and stories that contribute to society, get their ideas made. The films can be narrative, documentaries, short films, and web series with compelling stories told with passion.
​To help filmmakers, Dark Mind Productions offers assistance from development to pre-production and all the way to the final product. Dark Mind Productions, LLC. aims to create a community of artists and creators. Our mission is to create entertaining and inspiring stories that better the understanding of the human experience.
 

 
Pablo Lopez graduated with a BA in Film and Video Production from the Donald P. Bellisario College of Communications. Pablo shines as the Creative Director for Dark Mind Productions, his own independent film company. But why Dark Mind?
On his journey, Pablo suffered a lot throughout his life, including a near-death experience that changed his perspective on life. 
Being diagnosed with PTSD in 2017 he decided to build his own brand with Dark Mind Productions, where he can explain his own fears and insecurities through his own original content, some of which have garnered festival selections and awards. He also plans to use the production company to help rising female and POC filmmakers. 
 

 
Abigail Wilson is a short-form narrative producer with Dark Mind Productions, as well as a full-time television producer and editor. She specializes in live production/broadcast, motion graphics, and documentary-style content. She is a graduate of the Penn State University Bellisario College of Communications with a BA in Film and Video Production.
She also holds a 2016 Mid-Atlantic Regional Emmy from the National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences for her 2015 student film, Carrie Hope, in the category "College/University Student Production Long Form - Fiction,” as well as an Award of Excellence in the Narrative category from the Broadcast Education Association in its 2016 Super-Regional Creative Works competition.
 

 
Remington Daron is a cinematographer with a keen eye for cinematic framing. He is familiar with filming in outdoor locations as well as being versed in Visual effects and Post Production. His experience and passion to create visual stories are a huge benefit to the crew!
"My biggest dream as an artist is to create new worlds for myself and others to explore through the visual medium of film. I enjoy exploring new and old technologies and techniques, constantly developing my skill sets in order to give myself the most tools available on any production. This allows me to be the best filmmaker I can be while also allowing me to let my imagination run wild."
 

 
Tiffany Breon is a graduate of the Donald P. Bellisario College of Communications at Penn State with a focus in Film-Video and a minor in English. S
he specializes in editing, cinematography, producing & set design. She enjoys documentary-style productions and recently had a documentary, BAD BONES, premiere in New York City at the Midnight Film Festival in January 2019 and also in Lisbon, Portugal in March of 2019 at the Lisbon Film Rendezvous.
She has worked on a few narratives and experimental shorts along with Dark Mind Productions such as RADIANCE, OBLIVION, and the ongoing MR. BEAR series.
 
ADDITIONAL CREW:
Script Editor - Taliya Riesterer, @TmGreyPhotography
Concept Art - Olivia Mullens, @LivalittleArtsy
Photography - Jalen Martin, @jalengregoryphotography
Music - Tyler Wilkins, @TJWilkinsMusic
Script Doctor - Emily Laird
 

 
1) Every donation made is going to be used in ways that utilize the local businesses where we intend to film as well as giving exposure to the area as more tourism begins opening back up.
2) You'll be helping us feed the cast and crew to no expense to them, as well as allowing us to expand and develop our skills. Your support really rocks, seriously. So thank you.
3) We have always been fans of the adventure genre.
Whether it be Indiana Jones or Back to The Future, adventure films have always been fun to us. We wanted to create a story with its own world and its own mythology behind it but has these characters really rooted into its history like Indiana Jones or Harry Potter. It’s a mash-up of those two mediums. The heart and the charm. 
Diversity will also be forward-facing. We hope to create an adventure of the magical world using the lens of a female perspective and BIPOC stories with world-building, which we hope will flip the anticipated story tropes, and explore other stories within established genre types. However, this still a story about closure and about the acceptance of death, even when you have the ability to reverse it.We also believe this will give a new set of adventures to a younger generation. We think this could lead to more stories and adventures from the perspectives of the underdogs and is just the building block for a grand world that we hope to continue sharing with you throughout the years, but first, we want to prove we can do it. With your help, we will be one step closer.

story:
Introduction

HBFilms and TrashArts Productions are proud to announce that they will be making a UK Slasher Horror feature film: "Terror At Black Tree Forest". This is an authorised reboot of a film originally made by the highly acclaimed US based genre film maker, Dustin Ferguson.

Who are we?
HBFilms and Trash Arts Productions are renowned as being highly prolific producers of horror feature films including "Lonely Hearts", "The Millennial Killer", "The Truth Will Out", "Monstrous Disunion", "Senseless" and many more.

Why are we doing this?
We were, and are, honoured to have been asked by Dustin to remake his film. Originally he asked in 2018 and we were about to launch a crowdfunding campaign for the production costs at the start of 2020 - but held back whilst the covid pandemic took its course. Despite the pandemic, we were able to reschedule another feature, "Senseless", for production between UK lockdowns and remaining covid-secure, following all UK production guidelines, with no adverse effects on any of the cast and crew for that film. Now we are finally able to see a way of making this horror slasher, "Terror at Black Tree Forest", whilst remaining cautious and following production guidelines but we are now confident that we will be able to complete the, mainly outdoor, shoot safely and within a reasonable timeframe this summer (2021).

Past crowdfunding campaigns have been 100%+ supported and we are hopeful that you will be able to make this crowdfunding campaign a equally successful so that we can make "Terror At Black Tree Forest" our very first 'whodunnit'  horror slasher feature.

Stretch Goal

It's great to be able to see that we have achieved our initial funding target. So many people have supported us, and we thank all of them for that, and now we know we will be able to fully film everything we need to make sure that "Terror At Black Tree Forest" is a success. 

But we want to go further. The amount funded is only about half of the Budget that we have agreed upon, and we want to add more! We are now adding our stretch target - if we can achieve another £1,000 on this funder, making a total of £4,000, then we will add an extra kill, a very special one. The extra kill will be played by Sam Mason Bell, the director, and will undoubtedly be the bloodiest, messiest, and slasher-ist death that we can come up with in association with our brilliant Make Up Artist, Katie Johnson, and fully in keeping with the the way our Slasher Killer works.

So, please, lets work to £4,000 and let's get messy!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our Plan

We are anticipating being able to complete the main shoot in five days at Hollybanks Woods and other locations in and around Portsmouth, Hampshire (UK). The shoot itself is budgeted to be around £6,500 / US$9,000.  Of that, about 50% is to pay for the Cast and Crew, 25% for costumes, props, and catering, and about 25% on other necessities such as insurance, covid testing, and post production!  

The Budget for this film is in line with our previous films so we know that we can achieve a good horror film that will be of interest to our fan base, Dustin's fan base, and one that we, and hopefully you, will be proud of.

Your Reward

We do hope that you will be able to support us and, in return, we are offering some good perks above the usual "thank you" on social media and "here's a copy of the film you helped to make".

Those are available too, of course, but we are also giving you the opportunity to own the Killer's mask, the Killer's costume, and a even a fake eyeball (spoiler: one of the character's has their eye popped out on the end of a knife.... not a spoiler: we're not telling you who!). Those items will all be 'as seen on screen' and we will even get the killer (whoever they are...) to sign and personalise their mask and costume. You can even choose to name one of the characters!

Have a look at the 'Rewards' for more details!

Our Backup

So we've said our Budget is around £6,500, but the crowd funder target is far less! We hope that we will achieve at least our target but we do have some stretch goals in mind that we will announce once we hit our initial goal. We really would like to achieve double our target and be able to fully fund the film production but, if we don't, here's what we will be planning to do.

Firstly, we will use all funds we receive on hitting the screen with the story, the kills, and the slasher killer to the best of our ability. If we need to make the kills smaller, or work around how messy we can make them, then we will and we know we can still give a decent story on screen.

Secondly, we have a great potential backer in place, renowned for their love of the horror genre and a supporter many previous films. They have underwritten this project to make sure it happens - but we'd really like to not take advantage of them, and with your help, we won't!

Thirdly, our cast and crew are great. We've built in an allowance for a daily rate above what we have paid in the past. We really, really, don't want to reduce that rate but if we don't achieve the full funding target then we may have to - but we know our cast and crew are dedicated and will help us with that. And we have built in the cost of having an additional pair of hands available 'behind the camera' (a production assistant) but we will be able to work everything out without that individual being required. ​

 

What do we aim to achieve?

We haven't made a true 'slasher horror' before so we are very much looking forward to adding "Terror At Black Tree Forest" into the great British pantheon of slasher films. With your help we can achieve that and continue to ensure that British Horror is held in the same high regard in the 21st Century as it has been for the 60 years or more.

We've worked for Dustin Ferguson before with short films and know that they have been very well received by him and his fan base in the United States - so this slasher killer feature film will be the first full length movie for him, and SRS Entertainment, and will be released by them on Video on Demand and Physical Media in 2022 (or possibly earlier).

Of our previous projects, one has been distributed by Troma Entertainment and six (yes, 6) have been distributed by Darkside Releasing. That doesn't mean we are making 'mega-bucks' but it does absolutely mean that other people, of influence in the film / movie world. have watched our past films and found them good enough to get out into the wider world. You're not being asked to support first time filmmakers with this project!

Past films have also received various awards from, and screenings at, film festivals in the UK, US, and around the world. We wouldn't have been successful unless film festival directors and selection panels liked our work. No independent film making team can truly say you will be backing a sure fire hit, and we aren't saying that about ourselves or this film, but we believe we have the skills and strengths to make "Terror At Black Tree Forest" a strong film that will not disappoint.
 

Risks & Challenges

The UK Film Industry, and other creative / entertainment / hospitality, industries have really suffered over the past year. The Film Industry has issued guidelines on producing feature films during the pandemic, and we were able to create "Senseless" in between lockdowns in the UK. That enabled us to lift our game with ensuring the safety of the cast and crew (no more than six people at anyone time on location, multitasking behind the camera, and re-arranging our shoot plan to reduce the risks for all, as well as daily temperature checks and covid awareness briefings). We also upskilled in our ability to shoot on location, away from electricity and at night, and gained invaluable knowledge with green screen filming.

We know that we will face similar risks on this shoot. So we will be doing very similar - covid testing, shoot planning, reducing risk wherever possible, and maintaining the production guidelines. Whilst the UK may be out of lockdown by the time we start to shoot, we will remain as cautious as we were in 2020.

We have already revisited the script since last year and ensured that cast members are comfortable with the script and any close work with others. Our make up artist is, now, experienced, with working in personal protective equipment and will, if necessary, be doing the same for this production. 

 

Who is our cast and crew?

We will be posting updates during the campaign about our great cast and crew, working with some new faces to the TrashArts / HB Films team as well as working with those who have worked with us before. 

The Indie Horror community in the UK is a great place to be - so much talent in front and behind the screen - and we are keen to tell you who we have working with us so watch this space!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Look, we know that some people just can't contribute much, but that doesn't mean you can't help us! Just by being here and reading this helps us.

Even if you can only contribute £5, it will make a difference.

And if you really can't then we'd like to just mention that funding campaigns really fly when they are talked about. If you can, mention us in your social media activity, share our campaign link, and return to it in a couple of days to share again. Every visit to this page does really make a difference for us!

But, at the end of it all is just a very simple statement that is meant wholeheartedly by all of us involved with "Terror at Black Tree Forest":

Thank you for reading this, stay safe, and have a great day!
Oh, and, whatever you do, do not go down to the Black Tree Forest alone!
